But {POST}MODERN is the first time we’ve taken the chance and created one for ourselves. It's been satisfying to make something that further represents our philosophy: doing the right thing, and always looking for a better, more powerful way to do it. And, it’s been fun to see how much people appreciate it.

story:
Introducing Digital Printing Plus 

Dx+will set the digital print standard for not only St.Kitts and Nevis, but for the entire Eastern Caribbean and beyond. Presently there are no press in the Eastern Caribbean that can provide fast digital top quality prints That's 6 islands with population over 300,000 with no access to digital Printing.

Your contribution will help us to achieve this goal of digital printing, build an industry that is practically non-existence and provide digital printing to the fastest growing tourism and tourism related economies in the Caribbean region.


Our Needs and how YOU Benefit

Our needs are quite simple. We would need:

  1. Digital Copier - Canon Digital Press
  2. Digital Paper
  3. Cutter
  4. UV Machine
  5. Inks

The Impact

Imagine companies being able to have turn-around time that can range from a few hours to 48 hours, depending on the scope of work. 
No more waiting on jobs to come from as far south as Trinidad or far north as Miami. 
Get the same quality work in less time and for less, or comparable price. 
Support the growth of the local economy and provide jobs. 
Plus investing in this business could mean one can become a shareholder or investor in a growing market of print business.

Risks & Challenges

There is risk and there is challenges in any new business. We will be the first business of its kind on island. And competition can arise that may affect our bottom-line. But we welcome competition, and we will work on customer retention and make sure we keep our customers satisfied while never comprising quality for quantity. 

 We will continuously work on improving what we do all the time

  • Show project growth etc.  
  • We intend to grow between the islands and one way we can do that is by offering franchising options. This is another way as an investor one can make their money earn more.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you are not able to contribute financially there's other way you can help.

  • No matter what scope or profession you are in if you can provide any form of contribution it is always welcomed. 
  • Feel free to share this with your friends, coworkers etc. 
  • Check up on us see ho far we've reached and when our doors open online feel free to make an order

We really hope to make this business work and any contribution from you would go a long way. 


About the Project Manager

Gawain Fraites is an Graphic Designer by Profession, I've had also numerous years working around printers etc. Currently I work as a Public Relations/Corporate Communications Officer for a utility corporation. My background is also in Marketing as I've been involved in this field for over 10 years. I'm currently working on my Masters degree in Communications but the bottom line is how I can push this business as a profitable business that will assist customers/ clients on the island in getting quality print work all the time.

story:
Short Summary

 

Hello!

My name is Niccolea Miouo Nance. I am a poet, artist, amateur fire spinner, and soon to be world traveler via sailboat. I am also a sexual assault survivor. As a poet, I have known for years that April is National Poetry Month. What I didn't know was that National Poetry Month shares April with Sexual Assault Awareness Month. This book project is my way of giving back to the world so others can survive and thrive. 

In February and March of this year, Rachel McKibbens was doing an Indiegogo campaign for The Outlast Project to fund a tour to promote awareness of sexual assault. When she was getting closer to her goal, Rachel started posting a poetry prompt for every $100 raised and posted on Facebook and Twitter. By the end, it was OVER FORTY prompts!

I decided to write a poem from some of the prompts for my usual National Poetry Month poem-a-day (aka 30/30) challenge. PLUS, I decided I would make this book dedicated to The Outlast Project and give the profits to charity. Proceeds will be divided between local women's shelters, the National Sexual Violence Resource Center and The Outlast Project (after which this book was named).

I contacted Swimming With Elephants Publications (a small press out of Albuquerque that does wonderful work) and made an agreement for them to publish the book for me at cost. This means only the cost of printing and shipping is deducted from the total, the rest is given to the charities.

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

We would like to start with pre-orders of the books which will ship directly to contributors. Plus, we want to make the books available to independent retailers who are willing to consign without a percentage or at a discounted percentage. In order to do this, we need a minimum of the $1000 goal. The more pre-orders we get beyond the goal, the more we can help others.

As an added incentive for this campaign, the first fifty books will be individually signed and numbered as part of the pre-order printing. Also, the books will include a personal message if this campaign is fully funded!

 

The Impact

Your contribution will make a difference in the lives of survivors across the United States (around the world if we exceed the goal and get volunteers from other countries who want to take part in this project). The funds will help finance resources for survivors, provide an outlet for healing, and in some cases help shelters provide a safe space. This is the important work that we want to do.

 

Risks & Challenges

The main risk is that we don't fully fund. Then NOTHING happens. This is why we need all the participation we can get from caring people like you! Every $1 and share helps immensely!

 

    Other Ways You Can Help

    We get it. Sometimes you just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

    • You can help us by getting the word out and make some noise about our campaign by using the Indiegogo share tools!
    • Like pointed out above: Every $1 and share helps immensely!

    THANKS FOR YOUR PARTICIPATION!

story:
UPDATE: We just added platform #19; your content as a Telegram chatbot!



1stbase is the world's first "Meta CMS"; one simple interface to rule them all. 

  • No more replicating your content across different platforms, services and media.
  • No more DIY design or customising templates.
  • No coding.

1stbase takes care of it all, instantly, real-time.

Even better, you don't have to wait because 1stbase has already been built.


All these could be yours as soon as this campaign is over;


Let's be honest - chances are that designing for 18+ platforms, services and media simultaneously isn't exactly your forte or favourite past-time.

Instead, in 1stbase, the Automated Design Assistant (ADA) is your AI designer and knows best how to deal with the many different platforms, services and media.

And being an AI, she's much faster than you are! Instead of spending hours customising a template, you're done in minutes.





Not happy with the design? Literally tell her of any changes you need, and she will make them within seconds. You can preview or publish your new look in near-real-time, and instantly roll out your changes across your entire 1stbase presence.



 "Can you make it look a bit more modern?", "It's too colourful", "I don't like the red" down to "Please move the navigation down"; they are all valid ways of expressing aspects of your design brief and helping ADA think in the right direction.

If you are more of a control freak, you can also micro-manage ADA by going through each of her design suggestions and adding or removing them to suit your needs.

Alternatively, you can stimulate ADA's neural net directly by directly sending impulses into the different creative areas of her brain, to quickly nudge her in the right direction.



Rather than browsing yet another collection of templates and grappling with yet another DIY drag & drop interface for yet another platform, service or medium, 1stbase and ADA free you up to let you do what you are good at; running your business, blog, band or Kittens Appreciation Society.



1stbase's interface is incredibly quick and easy to use, and has been tested and perfected over three years, with real people of all ages and technical skills.



1stbase is feature-rich when you need it, yet tries to get out of your way when you don't, so you can get on with your day; everything in 1stbase was built for the time-poor.


It's not rocket science; being everywhere gets you noticed. It's an age-old, sure-fire way of getting your message across, employed by the big brands.

Now, 1stbase lets anyone, even small brands, cast the widest possible net, so you too can maximize the amount of eyes and ears you can reach with your message.

In more academic terms, 1stbase lets you cater to the unique uses and gratifications your audience may have for consuming your content on different platforms and media;

Some people like websites, some people never want to leave Facebook, while some like to print off what you have to say, and some prefer to read your content on a Kindle. Whatever people's preferences or habits, with 1stbase you will reach them - guaranteed. Now and in the future.




Getting noticed is one thing, but conversion is the end game. So, once engaged, 1stbase funnels your audience to your "call-to-action", the-thing-you-want-people-to-do, the reason why your content exists. And it does it on each and every platform.

It's not just people either; search engines too notice the comprehensiveness of 1stbase presences and the cross-links they generate, helping your rank higher, quicker.

To 1stbase, your content is literally king; it reigns supreme, dictating the design and functionality, and not the other way around.

There are no templates, pre-determined slots, blocks, fields or columns to fill out, nothing is pre-placed (except when best practices for a particular platform, service or medium dictate otherwise).



Take your brand-new 1stbase website for example; you can make your site into one long page with a few clicks, or you can decide to have a more hierarchical approach with multiple nested pages. The design and functionality adapt immediately.

Your content degrades gracefully if a platform, service or medium cannot render an aspect of your content (for example a YouTube video in a PDF brochure becomes a QR Code with a URL).



Conversely, your content will take advantage of the enhanced capabilities of a platform where possible (for example launch an email client, Google Maps or tap-to-dial if it encounters a phone number on a mobile device).


With 1stbase your content will "live forever"; when a new platform, service or medium comes along, we simply create a new "body" for your content's "ethereal spirit". You will instantly have a presence on that new platform, service or medium without ever lifting a finger or having to learn something new.


In addition to the current 18, we have many more platforms, services and media in our sights. Your Indiegogo support will allow us to bring your content to these too!


To make a point, we have seen to it that 1stbase effortlessly doubles as an on-line Commodore 64 app builder, just like 1stbase is simultaneously a website builder, Android/iOS app creator, Facebook app creator, PDF document creator, email template creator, etc.

As long as our patent-pending technology has some sort of storage and CPU to work with, it can style and distribute a meaningful, updateable experience around your content on any platform, past, present or future. All without bothering you with anything platform-specific, or asking you to do or learn something new.



So, in this instance that means a good bit of your content crammed into just a few kilobytes of memory, ready for viewing on microcomputer from 1982, styled by an AI from 2016. We've gone back to the future for you, just because we can.

Insanely cool or just plain-vanilla insane - you decide - but it hopefully shows how serious we are about our multi-platform capabilities.


kiss* Digital Media (*keep it simple stupid) is Ivo Jager and Renée Fulton.

We're a couple from Melbourne, Australia.

That's right. Just two people. In a relationship. Doing this day in, day out, for the past 4 years. At home. Strung out on caffeine. What could possibly go wrong...


If 1stbase is really as mature as we say it is, why would we need your hard earned dollars?


"If you were in Silicon Valley, they'd be throwing millions at you!" is how one of our early supporters over there summed up our situation a while ago.

- "Yeah, nah. This is 'Straya, mate."

We are based in Australia. And while Australia is an absolutely amazing country to live in, if you're not in the business of digging up rocks or flipping houses, funding for tech startups is almost impossibly hard to come by. Let alone funding and appraisal of tech, like 1stbase, that is just that little bit more "out there" and globally disruptive.

Consequently, we have only gotten to this stage by eating the proverbial noodles for 4 years, juggling credit cards and receiving small bits of investment from our friends and family.

The good thing here though, is that Aussies - and particularly small business owners - see right through hype and empty promises. In fact, this no-nonsense attitude has been instrumental in shaping and maturing 1stbase and ADA. Everything is lean, optimised and field tested, because we had to meet the needs and expectations of real clients. "Fake it 'till you make it" simply does not apply here.

Failure to deliver, would have directly meant not eating our delicious nutritious noodles the next month. Trust us - that is a very powerful motivator to build something that works and delivers the goods.

Fast forward to 2016; every small business that joined us over the years is still with us today.



As the saying goes, "necessity is the mother of invention". ADA too is the product of our Australian environment; lack of qualified VCs, manpower, terrible upload speeds and unstable Internet connections.

We endeavoured to replace a real designer with a cloud-based AI, because it was the only way a small team in our situation could put so many users onto 18 different platforms, services and media. She had to work - to us ADA is a necessity.

In a nutshell, 1stbase didn't just come out of nowhere, we just come from a land Down Under. And now now are ready to take on the world!

We have gone as far and as fast as we could on a shoestring budget and caffeine-fueled skeleton crew of 2, but now we're ready to realise 1stbase's potential in a big way.

Most of the work in making 1stbase scale and supporting a large user base has been completed. After delivering the keys to our 1st-wave backers when this campaign  is over, we will use your support to finish off the last few "boring" bits (e.g. on-boarding, account management), as well as more/better/updated documentation, and support. This will allow us to roll out the second beta wave.

In the medium term, we would like to vastly improve our feature set on the various platforms, and we would love to make ADA truly shine on some of these as well.

Following that, we would like to keep ADA up to date with the latest design trends and expand her repertoire and abilities.

Lastly, we have many more ideas for new platforms and re-purposing your content - all instantly available to you and your new(!) audience as soon we release them; 

100% of your support will be re-invested into furthering 1stbase; supporting 1stbase is an investment that will keep on giving!


ADA was simply the best tool we could come up with to get a job done; making sense of simplified design briefs in order to consistently style 18+ vastly different services, platforms and media at once. She was not conceived as a marketing vehicle or gimmick.


Is ADA "real AI"? If you care about these things, we use common AI algorithms, constructs and data models, such as artificial neural networks, RiveScript (a more elegant AIML), graph searching and constraint solving - all the "usual" stuff to build systems like these. This is in addition to some more "mundane" facial and object detection algorithms.

It is very early days, but ADA is already making sense of 4000+ design decisions with various complex dependencies and applications. She is able to understand different styles, "moods"/"feels", colours and elements. She is aware of basic design principles such as colour theory, contrast, text and image placement, negative space and image content. She does all this while taking into account the devices/screens/media your content is rendered on.

As far as us geeks go (FWIW, one of us actually studied AI at one stage), ADA is proper narrow AI.

So, no, ADA won't become self-aware, adopt a cat and name it Spot, become your BFF, seduce you under false pretences or attempt to kill you if your surname is "Connor". Probably (please refer the relevant indemnity clauses in our terms & conditions).



However, yes, you are able to chat to her in plain English and (hopefully) receive relevant results, answers or questions back in plain English related to your design and colours.  

Whatever your expectations of AI are, we can tell you a little bit about the personal benchmark for AI that gets us excited. It's called "emergent behaviour"; the magic moment when a system starts surprising you with things that you never explicitly taught it. ADA has shown us such moments in spades (and we've only scratched the surface!). 

More importantly to us (and you!), at the end of the day, ADA is a tool that gets a job done that is otherwise hard, costly and time-consuming.


For more information, screen shots, video clips and an extensive FAQ, please visit http://1stbase.ai/indiegogo (and, yes, we eat our own dog food using the latest version of 1stbase and ADA for everything you see there).


Just like we have always done with our small-business clients, we want to offer total transparency, and let you know exactly what you are in for if you support us with your hard-earned cash.
  • 1stbase is a mature system with real people using it on a daily basis; it is fit for purpose today.
  • Importantly, we have repeatedly tested our auto-scaling cloud hosting during multiple high-traffic events (TV performances, multiple expos with 32,000+ visitors) over multiple years. When it comes to traffic, bandwidth and CPU loads, we are confident we can scale up effortlessly.
  • You will be the very first to use ADA. Certain components that ADA relies on to effect a design have been in production for over a year, however ADA herself (the AI, the neural nets, graph solvers, natural language processing and user interface) are - though internally tested and deemed to be fully working - recent additions to the stack.
  • As outlined in the roadmap above, to properly scale up from a customer-intake point-of-view, we need to build the on-boarding piece to be able to take in large amounts of second and third wave beta users. First wave beta users will likely be processed - at least in part - manually. We have been careful not to overcommit.
  • All-in-all, given the maturity of the system and the ample examples, screen shots, videos and documentation already available in the wild, we hope you will agree with our firm belief that your investment in this Indiegogo project is comparatively low-risk at this advanced stage.
  • We recognise communication is just as important as delivering. So, given that, for now, there is just two of us and that we are trying to finish the last bits and pieces, we will have to take out some time to update you on what is going on. This should be somewhat easier thanks to us using 1stbase for ourselves. However, please don't be mad with us for not maintaining a hugely active 2-way social media presence, aside from status updates.
  • You are buying into a beta, and as such we ask for your understanding with regards to the possible presence of bugs, glitches or features that, though implemented, may not yet work fully as intended. However, as opposed to certain other crowd funded projects, we do understand "beta" to be functionally complete and fit for purpose from day one.
  • This is not our first gig creating ground breaking software that is used by thousands, that makes something extremely complex simple again, that is universally well-regarded and that has an active community surrounding it.
  • All that said, there may be a world-wide coffee shortage. In which case we are all absolutely stuffed, as we won't be able to get out of bed and you will lose all your money. This system was built on caffeine, and lots of it. So if that happens, we'll be claiming force majeure. Sorry about that...

It's not just people 
either; search engines too notice the comprehensiveness of 1stbase 
presences and the cross-links they generate, helping your 
rank higher, quicker.





To 1stbase, your content is literally king; it reigns supreme, dictating the 
design and functionality, and not the other way around.

There 
are no templates, pre-determined slots, blocks, fields or columns to 
fill out, nothing is pre-placed (except when best practices for a 
particular platform, service or medium dictate otherwise).






Take your brand-new 1stbase website for example; you can make your 
site into one long page with a few clicks, or you can decide to have a 
more hierarchical approach with multiple nested pages. The design and functionality adapt immediately.
Your
 content degrades gracefully if a platform, service or medium cannot 
render an aspect of your content (for example a YouTube video in a PDF 
brochure becomes a QR Code with a URL).









Conversely, your content 
will take advantage of the enhanced capabilities of a platform where 
possible (for example launch an email client, Google Maps or tap-to-dial
 if it encounters a phone number on a mobile device). 






With
 1stbase your content will "live forever"; when a new platform, service 
or medium comes along, we simply create a new "body" for your content's 
"ethereal spirit". You will instantly have a presence on that new 
platform, service or medium without ever lifting a finger or having to 
learn something new.






In addition to the current 18, we have many more platforms, services 
and media in our sights. Your Indiegogo support will allow us to bring
 your content to these too!




To make a point, we have seen to it that 1stbase effortlessly doubles as an 
on-line Commodore 64 app builder, just like 1stbase is simultaneously a website 
builder, Android/iOS app creator, Facebook app creator, PDF document 
creator, email template creator, etc.

As long as our patent-pending technology has some sort of 
storage and CPU to work with, it can style and distribute a meaningful, 
updateable experience around your content on any platform, past, present
 or future. All without bothering you with anything platform-specific, or asking you to do or learn something new.






So, in this instance that means a good bit of your content 
crammed into just a few kilobytes of memory, ready for viewing on 
microcomputer from 1982, styled by an AI from 2016. We've gone back to the 
future for you, just because we can.
Insanely cool or just plain-vanilla insane - you decide - 
but it hopefully shows how serious we are about our multi-platform 
capabilities. 






kiss* Digital Media (*keep it simple stupid) is Ivo Jager and Renée Fulton.
We're a couple from Melbourne, Australia.
That's
 right. Just two people. In a relationship. Doing this day in, day out, 
for the past 4 years. At home. Strung out on caffeine. What could 
possibly go wrong...





If 1stbase is really as mature as we say it is, why would we need your hard earned dollars?







"If you were in Silicon Valley, they'd be throwing millions at you!" is how one of our early supporters over there summed up our situation a while ago.
- "Yeah, nah. This is 'Straya, mate."
We are based in Australia. And while Australia is an absolutely amazing 
country to live in, if you're not in the business of digging up rocks or
 flipping houses, funding for tech startups is almost impossibly hard to come by. Let alone funding and appraisal of tech, like 1stbase, that is just that little bit more "out there" and globally disruptive.
Consequently, we have only gotten to this stage by eating the proverbial noodles for 4 years, juggling credit cards and receiving small bits of investment from our friends and family.
The good thing here though, is that Aussies  - and particularly small business owners - see right through hype and empty promises. In fact, this no-nonsense attitude has been instrumental
 in shaping and maturing 1stbase and ADA. Everything is lean, optimised and field 
tested, because we had to meet the needs and expectations of real 
clients. "Fake it 'till you make it" simply does not apply here.
Failure to deliver, would have directly meant not eating our 
delicious nutritious noodles the next month. Trust us - that is a very 
powerful motivator to build something that works and delivers the goods.
Fast forward to 2016; every small business that joined us over the years is still with us today.







As the saying goes, "necessity is the mother of invention". ADA too is 
the product of our Australian environment; lack of qualified VCs, manpower, terrible upload speeds and unstable Internet connections. 
We endeavoured to replace a real designer with a cloud-based AI, because it
 was the only way a small team in our situation could put so many users onto 18 different platforms, services and media. She had to work - to us ADA is a necessity.In a nutshell, 1stbase didn't just come out of nowhere, we just come from a land Down Under. And now now are ready to take on the world!


We
 have gone as far and as fast as we could on a shoestring budget and 
caffeine-fueled skeleton crew of 2, but now we're ready to realise 
1stbase's potential in a big way.


Most of the work in making 
1stbase scale and supporting a large user base has been completed. After
 delivering the keys to our 1st-wave backers when this campaign  is over, we will use your support to finish off the last few
 "boring" bits (e.g. on-boarding, account management), as well as 
more/better/updated documentation, and support. This will allow us to 
roll out the second beta wave.
In the medium term, we would like 
to vastly improve our feature set on the various platforms, and we 
would love to make ADA truly shine on some of these as well.
Following that, we would like to keep ADA up to date with the latest design trends and expand her repertoire and abilities.
Lastly,
 we have many more ideas for new platforms and re-purposing your content
 - all instantly available to you and your new(!) audience as soon we 
release them; 
100% of your support will be re-invested into furthering 1stbase; supporting 1stbase is an investment that will keep on giving!






ADA was simply the best 
tool we could come up with to get a job done; making sense of simplified
 design briefs in order to consistently style 18+ vastly different 
services, platforms and media at once. She was not conceived as a marketing vehicle or gimmick.







 
Is ADA "real AI"? If you care about these things, we use common AI algorithms, constructs and data models, such as artificial neural networks, RiveScript (a more elegant AIML), graph searching and constraint solving -
 all the "usual" stuff to build systems like these. This is in addition to
 some more "mundane" facial and object detection algorithms.
It is 
very early days, but ADA is already making sense of 4000+ design 
decisions with various complex dependencies and applications. She is able to understand different styles, "moods"/"feels", colours and elements. She is aware of basic 
design principles such as colour theory, contrast, text and image 
placement, negative space and image content. She does all this while taking 
into account the devices/screens/media your content is rendered on.
As far as us geeks go (FWIW, one of us actually studied AI at one stage), ADA is proper narrow AI. 
So, no, ADA won't become self-aware, adopt a cat and name it Spot, become 
your BFF, seduce you under false pretences or attempt to kill you if 
your surname is "Connor". Probably (please refer the relevant indemnity
 clauses in our terms & conditions).






However, yes, you are able
 to chat to her in plain English and (hopefully) receive relevant 
results, answers or questions back in plain English related to your design and colours.  
Whatever
 your expectations of AI are, we can tell you a little bit about the 
personal benchmark for AI that gets us excited. It's called "emergent 
behaviour"; the magic moment when a system starts surprising you with 
things that you never explicitly taught it. ADA has shown us such moments in spades (and we've only scratched the surface!). 
More importantly to us (and you!), at the end of the day, ADA is a tool that gets a job done that is otherwise hard, costly and time-consuming.




For more information, screen shots, video clips and an extensive FAQ, please visit http://1stbase.ai/indiegogo (and, yes, we eat our own dog food using the latest version of 1stbase and ADA for everything you see there).








Just like we have always done with our small-business clients, we want to offer total transparency, and let you know exactly what you are in for if you support us with your hard-earned cash.


1stbase is a mature system with real people using it on a daily basis; it is fit for purpose today.
Importantly, we have repeatedly tested our auto-scaling cloud hosting
 during multiple high-traffic events (TV performances, multiple expos 
with 32,000+ visitors) over multiple years. When it comes to traffic, 
bandwidth and CPU loads, we are confident we can scale up effortlessly.
You will be the very first to use ADA. Certain components that ADA relies on to effect a design have been in
 production for over a year, however ADA herself (the AI, the neural nets, graph
 solvers, natural language processing and user interface) are - though internally 
tested and deemed to be fully working - recent additions to the stack.

As outlined in the roadmap above, to properly scale up from a customer-intake 
point-of-view, we need to build the on-boarding piece to be able to 
take in large amounts of second and third wave beta users. First wave beta users will likely be processed - at least in part - manually. We have been careful not to overcommit.

All-in-all, given the maturity of the system and the ample examples, 
screen shots, videos and documentation already available in the wild, we
 hope you will agree with our firm belief that your investment in this Indiegogo project is comparatively low-risk at this advanced stage.
We recognise communication is just as important as delivering. So, 
given that, for now, there is just two of us and that we are trying to finish 
the last bits and pieces, we will have to take out some time to update you on what is going on. This should be somewhat easier thanks to us 
using 1stbase for ourselves. However, please don't be mad with us for not 
maintaining a hugely active 2-way social media presence, aside from 
status updates.
You are buying into a beta, and as such we ask for your understanding
 with regards to the possible presence of bugs, glitches or features 
that, though implemented, may not yet work fully as intended. However, 
as opposed to certain other crowd funded projects, we do understand 
"beta" to be functionally complete and fit for purpose from day one.

This is not our first gig creating ground breaking software that is used by thousands, that makes something extremely complex simple again, that is universally well-regarded and that has an active community surrounding it.

All that said, there may be a world-wide coffee shortage. In which 
case we are all absolutely stuffed, as we won't be able to get out of bed and you will lose all your money. This system was built on caffeine, and lots of it. So if that happens, 
we'll be claiming force majeure. Sorry about that...

story:
Hi! My name is Jack Bonneau (I'm 10). I have a chain of drink stands and marketplaces in Colorado where kids and young entrepreneurs (under 18) can operate stands and sell their products.  Now I'm planning to go nationwide!

Jack’s Stands provides kids authentic experiences in entrepreneurship, business, financial literacy, life skills--like confidence building and being social--in actual marketplaces that are safe, properly permitted, licensed, and fun!

I was just featured in...

      

A Lemonade Stand Or a Hot Start-Up?

Some Kids Sell Lemonade. He Starts a Chain.


And now the the Today Show! 

Lemonade stands that take credit cards? Meet the new wave of kid entrepreneurs!


My mission is to expand the number of stands and marketplaces in Colorado and beyond, to provide this great experience and opportunity to as many kids and their families as possible!  

Please join us in our mission!

What We Need

Our goal is raise to $12,500 to double the number of Jack's Stands (and Marketplaces) from 6 to 12 in Colorado.  This will allow Jack's Stands to increase the number of kids who operate Jack's Stands from over 200 in 2015, to nearly 1,000 in 2016!

Let us show you how!

Costs for an additional 6 stands locally in Colorado*

The Impact

A Kaufman Foundation poll found more than half of millennials want to start a business, but that the key barriers are a lack of access to capital and a lack of knowledge. Jack's Stands' goal is to help young entrepreneurs surmount those barriers. 

In 2015, Jack's Stands hosted over 200 kids, with over 60% of them operating Jack's Stands over multiple dates.   In 2016, Jack's Stands (and Marketplaces) hopes to reach 1,000 kids (or more) to have them experience entrepreneurship, learn about business, build confidence, make some money, and have fun!  The impact that this will have on participating kids--with your support--is immeasurable.  

Risk & Challenges

Our risks are...

  • Can we fill all the market dates for new stands and new cities into which we are expanding?  Our previous experience, has been a 98% attendance rate and a wait list for 2016.  We're confident that we will be successful in filling all available dates at new locations.  
  • Can we satisfy local health, permit, and legal requirements for each locale?   Yes, we have in Colorado and through our experience we are able to research, execute, and work with local entities to satisfy any local and state requirements. 


Why Does It Cost so Much for a Lemonade Stand?

A natural question about Jack's Stands is why the stands cost so much. After all, lemonade stands are the first business that kids have, at the end of their driveways or streets.  

But Jack's Stands are on a completely different level. What family has the time, resources, or commitment to put their child's stand in an actual marketplace with real customers, or to properly satisfy the requirements of local health departments, sale tax licenses, insurance, etc.?  Or to have the ability to take credit cards, track sales through an app, and go through a profit-and-loss statement to learn about revenue, expenses, and profits or loss!


What You Get! (and meet the kids!)

Pay It Forward Perks

Two levels of Pay It Forward Perks.  The first level provides a child with a free lemonade at one of the many Jack's Stands this summer.  This perk helps kids with their initial shyness at Jack's Stands by offering a free lemonade to every other customer (until the this perk is exhausted), customers who may not be able to afford a lemonade or would walk by.    

In addition, each drink given away under Pay It Forward Perks will count as a "sale" made to the child operating the stand, and count to his or her revenue at the end of the day.  It's like you were buying the the lemonade yourself!  Lastly, you will have your name mentioned on our Pay It Forward Wall of Fame page at JacksStands.com, with a sincere thank you from Jack and the kids operating Jack's Stands that day!  

The second level--Pay It Forward Perks Plus--provides the same benefits as above, except this level will Pay It Forward to a family of four, while supporting Jack's Stands expansion plans! 


Curated Jack's Marketplace Boxes

These curated boxes have products made by Jack's Marketplace young entrepreneurs under the age of 18 who have sold their products at one or more of Jack's Stands. Approximately 40% of the proceeds will go to the youth entrepreneur and 60% to support Jack's Stands.  

Perk Offering - Jack's Marketplace Box  $25 + Shipping

This box will contain 1 Hanimal Card, 1 lip balm by Sweet Bee Sisters, and a set of 6 wine charms from Charming Wine Charms.  This perk supports both these young entrepreneurs and Jack's Stands.  Specific flavors, card designs will be chosen at the end of the campaign via a backer survey.


Hannah's (age 17) Hanimal Greeting Cards, where stuffed animals help wild animals!


The Sweet Bee Sisters, Lily (15), Chloe (14), and Sophie (11), who for the last 6 years have sold 6 flavors of lip balms, 4 lotion bars, and sugar scrubs, all made from bees wax.

    


Perk Offering - Sweet Bee Sisters Box  $60 + Shipping

This box contains all of the Sweet Bee Sisters' products (6 flavors of lip balm, 4 types of lotion bars, and 1 sugar scrub), plus a note of thanks for supporting Jack's Stands.


Charming Wine Charms by Isabelle May (age 11), Winner at Celebration for Young Entrepreneurs (6-11 age group).  Serial entrepreneur Isabelle creates unique charms for keeping track of your wine glass during gatherings and parties.


Mo's Bows

Moziah Bridges is 14-years-old, and the CEO of Mo's Bows. Mo’s Bows is a company whose mission is to make you look good and feel good, and caters to the fun, cool, sometimes conservative man or lady.  

Perk Offering - Mo's Bows - Youth Bow Tie   $45 + Shipping  

You're purchasing a youth self-tie cotton bowtie, front measures 3” x 4.5”and bow tie will fit neck size 9" to 14" with adjustable with black metal slide adjuster and hook/clip.   Color/designs will be chosen at the end of the campaign via a backer survey.

Perk Offering - Mo's Bows - Adult Bow Tie    $60 + Shipping

You're purchasing an adult self-tie cotton bow tie, front measures 3” x 4.5” and will fit neck size 15” to 18”, with adjustable black metal slide adjuster and hook/clip.  Color/designs will be chosen at the end of the campaign via a backer survey.


Ry's Ruffery

11-year-old Ryan Kelly is the Founder of Ry's Ruffery. Ryan is a young man who started up his own dog-treats business after adopting a dog. He is changing the industry, creating all-natural dog treats that pet owners would love to give as much as their furry friends would love to devour.

Don't feed your dog what you wouldn't eat yourself!

Perk Offering - Ry’s Ruffery Shark Tank Offer  $35 + Shipping


Carter's Define Bottle

Carter Kostler is now a 17-year-old 11th grader who has taken childhood obesity head on. After learning about the startling statistics of how sugary drinks and soda impact today’s youth, he decided to do something about it and started Define Bottle. 

16oz Define Bottle - Sport Flip Top

Perk Offering - Define Bottle Sports Flip Top  $35 + Shipping

The Define Bottle Sport Flip Top is a sustainable, beautifully crafted fruit-infusion water bottle to take on the go.  Fits in a standard cup holder. Capacity: 16 ounces. Easy cleaning (comes apart at the top and bottom). Re-freezable base piece - helps keep your fruit cool. Strainer piece keeps the fruit out of the mouth piece. Odorless, tasteless, and stain resistant. Dishwasher safe. BPA free.


Max'is Creations

When I was 8 years old, I had the idea to put a basketball hoop on a mug that I was making in art class at school.  

My mugs are not just for kids. Moms like my mugs because they help kids not fool around at the table. And adults who like sports like them too.  My product reviews have been really great!  My mugs are good for people who can’t go outside and play basketball. Like kids in the hospital.  And people needing occupational therapy.  I like sports and hot chocolate and that’s why I did it.  Thanks for letting me tell you about my mugs.

Max has sold over 44,000 mugs! He has 5 different mugs (pictured above); Mug With A Hoop, Mug With A Glove, Mug With A Goal, Mug With A Goalpost, and Mug With A Net! 


Higher Level Jack's Stands Perks

These perks will accelerate Jack's Stands growth to reach as many kids and their families as possible.

Jack's Stands Sponsor for a Day

Sponsor a Single Day at a Jack's Stands location.  Sponsors who select this perk will receive a video of the child and family with a report on what they liked and learned about their experience and a personal thank you from from the attendees that day!

Jack's Stands Sponsor for the month of June

Sponsor a month at a Jack's Stands location.  Sponsors who select this perk will receive a receive 1 video each week (4) of the kids and families with commentary on what they liked and learned about their experience, and a personal thank you from the attendees!

Jack's Stands New Location Patron - Colorado

The New Stand Patron - Colorado Perk will allow Jack's Stands & Marketplace to expand and open one additional stand in Colorado. Patron will be acknowledged with a plaque on the new stand and marketplace location. We will also provide acknowledgment and thanks on our Patron page on JacksStands.com and our social media channels.

Jack's Stands New Location Patron - Detroit

This New Stand Patron - Detroit Perk will allow Jack's Stands & Marketplace to expand and open one additional stand in Detroit.  Patron will be acknowledged with a plaque on the new stand and marketplace location.  We will also provide acknowledgment and thanks on our Patron page on JacksStands.com and our social media channels.

Can't Help Right Now?

If you're unable to contribute, you can still be part of the mission to have kids and their families experience entrepreneurship, learn about business, build confidence, make some money, and have fun!  All you have to do is help spread the word by using the Indiegogo share tools below and letting everyone you know hear about Jack's Stands!   

We hope to see you soon at a Jack's Stand or Marketplace near you!  

Thank you,

Jack (and from everyone who helps and participates at Jack's Stands)

story:
What is Katch a Dream?

To "Katch a Dream" simply means to go after your dreams and ambitions.  To foster creativity and to engage and inspire the world.  At Katch a Dream Studios, this can be achieved plus more. 

My name is Kris Rogers.  Ever since my younger ages of watching films of the golden era with my mother, films such as "Singing in the Rain", "Top Hat" and "Arsenic and Old Lace", I have always had a passion for the cinematic arts.  Watching my family passionately serve in various industries from houses of worship, food industry and civil service, cultivated my dream of opening a facility designed to serve those in the community.  A place where anyone can come to create, engage and inspire.

As the leader and visionary of the studios, I bring over 15 years of professional audiovisual and production experience along with 10 years of hospitality and convention service.  As an Entertainment Business graduate from the Full Sail University, I plan to grow Katch a Dream Studios into a leading brand of event and production services.


To Katch a Dream, to Fund the Dream

In order to make this dream a reality, we are in need of $150,000.  Yes, that is a huge number.  But by faith and hard-work, we believe that we can achieve that goal. 

Here is the breakdown in a nutshell of what we need:

  • A remodeled 2,000 sq. ft. property rental:  $40,000
  • Legal/Compliance fees:                                           5,000
  • Business operations                                               90,000
    (Utilities, payroll, marketing, vendors)
  • Studio equipment:                                                    15,000
    (Furniture, audiovisual, office supplies)

The Impact

With your gracious support, the dream of creating the studios will become a reality. Your contribution, will not only have a instant impression, but a long lasting effect in the various communities of the Dallas/Fort Worth metroplex and abroad.  One of the visions of the studios, is to create programs for the area schools to educate and inspire students for careers in the entertainment and hospitality industry.


Risks & Challenges

One of my favorite aspects of Katch a Dream Studios is the location and the environment.  With Dallas/Ft. Worth is becoming a hidden gem in the film industry, and Arlington has become one of the largest sports cities, being home to the Dallas Cowboys, Texas Rangers and the new WNBA team, the Dallas Wings, the need for a facility such as Katch a Dream Studios has become astronomical.  People are looking for new and inviting venues that are set apart from the big chain hotels and convention centers.  Production studios are often lost within industrial warehouse parks and are not the most inviting.

The challenge of creating such a said space is frankly setting ourselves apart from the name brand hotels and convention centers and area production houses.  In this day of age of evolving technology, social media and business practices, the staff and myself must stay a student to the several industries that we serve and be willing to adapt to new environments.


Can You Help in Other Ways?

We realize that not everyone will be able to contribute but there are other things you can do to help. Please share our campaign with all your friends and family.

There are Social Media links on the page which you can use to help get the word out. 

Thank you!

story:
Kurzbeschreibung

Lavabrum Luxurium - unser Traum vom eigenen Badehaus. Wir sind Dani, Julchen und Rufus. Dani tummelt sich seit 13 Jahren auf Mittelaltermärkten herum, in den letzten 10 Jahren war sie erst Bademagd, dann Baderin. Als Diplom-Humanbiologin ist sie die Hygienebeauftragte, sorgt für das saubere Wasser und ist ab Sonnenaufgang für euch da. Julchen ist 2014 zu unserem Team gestoßen, ist unser guter Geist, unsere Terminplanerin, die Ordnung und hat immer ein offenes Ohr für die großen und kleinen Probleme des Alltags. Zusammen mit Rufus begleitet sie euch durch die Nächte im Badehaus. Rufus ist der Holzwurm, der Handwerker, derjenige, der alles bauen und reparieren kann und unseren gemeinsamen Träumen die nötige Struktur verpasst. Außerdem kennt ihr ihn als den wohl beliebtesten Masseur auf Mittelaltermärkten und denjenigen, der auch um 2 Uhr nachts noch gut gelaunt eure letzte Baderunde begleitet. Wir vermissen das Ratschen am Zuberrand, den morgendlichen Kaffeeklatsch, mit euch zu lachen und zu singen, Probleme zu wälzen und Lösungen zu finden. Kurz: Wir vermissen euch und die gemeinsame Zeit. Jetzt brauchen wir euch. Damit wir ein eigenes Badehaus realisieren können, brauchen wir eure Hilfe.

  
Stellen wir uns unser Badehaus einfach mal gemeinsam vor:
Zuber aus Holz, gefüllt mit warmem, dampfenden Wasser. Der Duft naturbelassener Öle und Essenzen. Sanfter Kerzenschimmer - ein Ort, an dem man die Seele baumeln lassen kann. Stimmungsvolle Dekoration in einem edlen Ambiente, mit charmanter Gesellschaft machen das Badevergnügen perfekt. Eine geräumige Umkleide, mit viel Platz für euch und all eure Sachen, zwei Duschen, ein gemütliches Massagezelt mit zwei professionellen Massagebänken und auch hier wieder genügend Raum, um eure Garderobe zu verstauen. Ausreichend große, flauschige Handtücher bekommt ihr einfach ganz bequem zu eurer Baderunde ausgeliehen. 
Unser Badehaus soll ein Ort sein, an dem euer Badevergnügen - und das Badewasser - völlig ungetrübt sind. Dafür verbauen wir für euch die modernste Technik, eine mehrstufige Filteranlage inklusive UV-Filtern, leistungsstarke Pumpen, zwei getrennte Duschen. Diesen Ort möchten wir mit eurer Hilfe erschaffen und unseren Traum gemeinsam mit euch wahr werden lassen.

Was du uns gibst & was du bekommst
Wie jeder Traum kostet auch der unsere Geld und mit eurer Hilfe können wir ihn wahr werden lassen. Konkret brauchen wir natürlich ein Zugfahrzeug, einen Hänger, die Badezuber, Holz, Technik wie Pumpen, Gasthermen und Filtersysteme, Stoffe, Dekorationen, Massagebänke, Kisten, Regale und noch so vieles mehr. Ihr bekommt dafür Entspannung und Zubervergnügen pur. Ab der Saison 2017 möchten wir mit Lavabrum Luxurium Mittelalter- und Fantasy Veranstaltungen besuchen. Hier stehen wir ganz zu eurer Verfügung. Mit Zuberterminen und entspannenden Massagen in historischem Ambiente macht jede Veranstaltung doppelt so viel Spaß. Wir möchten euch historische Badekultur durch die Jahrtausende näher bringen und sichtbar machen. Dazu bekommt ihr natürlich den Service, den ihr von uns gewohnt seid. Es macht uns einfach glücklich, euch rundum zu verwöhnen. 

Die Folgen
Nach den vielen Jahren, die wir als Zuberteam gearbeitet haben, wird es Zeit, unsere eigenen Ideen und Visionen umzusetzen. Wir drei bringen es auf stattliche 30 Jahre Erfahrung mit historischen Badehäusern. All dieses Wissen wollen wir nicht nur in einem funktionierenden Badehaus umsetzen, sondern wir wollen das beste mobile Badehaus Europas bauen. Natürlich wird unser Badehaus schön sein, ein stimmiges Ambiente haben und euch in eine andere Welt entführen, aber das reicht uns nicht. Wir wollen eine optimale, technische Ausrüstung. Damit ihr euch richtig wohlfühlen könnt, muss es einfach sicher sein, dass unsere Wasserqualität nicht nur ausreichend oder gut ist, sondern immer hervorragend. Mit dieser Kampagne wollen wir noch kein komplettes Badehaus bauen aber mit eurer Hilfe schaffen wir es, nicht nur gut, sondern großartig zu werden. Das bedeutet den Unterschied zwischen schlichter Funktionalität und einem stimmungsvollen Ambiente, zwischen langweiligen Stoffen oder orientalischen Mustern, zwischen einem Wasserhahn oder eben einem schönen Zulauf, mit dem wir die Zuber befüllen, zwischen günstigen Handtüchern aus Spenden, die nie richtig zusammen passen, oder neuen, flauschigen, großen Leihhandtücher in den Farben des Badehauses. Mit eurer Hilfe wollen wir genau diesen Unterschied finanzieren. 

Risiken & Herausforderungen
Die größte Herausforderung ist für uns die Terminakquise. Natürlich haben wir uns schon Gedanken gemacht, mit welchen Veranstaltern wir zusammenarbeiten wollen, aber wir können - logischerweise - erst konkret Termine vereinbaren, wenn das Badehaus finanziert, gebaut und getestet ist. Der Zeitplan ist also jetzt schon relativ knapp bemessen. Und natürlich brauchen wir eine gewisse Anzahl an Terminen, um dann unsere erste Saison zu überstehen. 
Wir haben diese Herausforderung deutlich vor Augen und wissen, dass wir sie meistern können und werden. Es ist ganz klar, je erfolgreicher diese Kampagne ist, umso entspannter können wir in unsere erste Saison mit dem eigenen Badehaus starten, zusammen werden wir es schaffen, Lavabrum Luxurium Wirklichkeit werden zu lassen. Wenn unser Badehaus erst gebaut ist, schaffen wir alles andere auch. 

Andere Wege, wie man helfen kann
Je mehr Menschen von unserer Kampagne erfahren, umso größer sind die Chancen, unser Projekt zu realisieren. Bitte teilt uns auf Facebook und in anderen sozialen Netzwerken, sprecht eure Freunde an, helft uns, ein möglichst großes Publikum zu erreichen.
Außerdem könnt ihr uns helfen, indem ihr uns sagt, auf welchen Veranstaltungen ihr uns gerne sehen möchtet und das auch den Veranstaltern mitteilt. Ihr als Besucher habt eine Stimme, eure Wünsche haben ein ganz anderes Gewicht, als es "nur" eine Bewerbung von "irgendeinem" Badehaus hat. Mit eurer Stimme, mit euren Wünschen könnt ihr uns unterstützen.

story:
Now that the campaign has come to a end we would like to thank all those who were able to help any way they could, whether it was monetary or just by helping spread the word. Sadly our goal was not reached and completely understandable since this was not a new tech product or something tangible that can be viewed or shipped. Alas this will not deter us from our plan. Any and all perks and promises will be kept. We just might need a little more time. We shall keep the perks available until grand opening.




A little about us.

Feed Me N.Y.C. is a new locally owned quick service restaurant that hopefully with your  help will be setting the standard in food service. N.Y.C is full of millions of people low on time and with high expectations when it comes to our food, of course that also goes for many others around the world but...one store at a time. We will be providing a combination of high quality food at reasonable pricing in a sleek modern atmosphere built with consumers in mind to ensure consistent product and service times. The taste buds and stomach work as a team, they have spoken and we have listened.

Our Instagram for more pictures.

The Impact

Everyone has that place in their head that they know they can consistently get good quality food, sometimes we have to travel too far to get these items. We feel it shouldn't be that way to get what was asked for in a decent time frame. Feed Me N.Y.C. strives for the upmost quality and speed because our customers are important to us and so is their time . Our whole core is all customers are VIPs to us. Using technology we will ensure the order is taken accurately and then transferred to the cooking team for increased service times while other orders can be taken.

story:
GlobalSay will be connecting multiple local debates on important topics. It will report the conclusions of the debates to decision-makers. It will be a not-for-profit online tool for widely distributed democratic debates.

You are an engaged person. We should discuss matters that concern us all you think. When you discuss with your friends, family, colleagues you may have had the thought how small the discussion group is – compared to how important the issue is. You feel that our world should act as one big democratic deliberation space.

We agree: Big decisions about our lives are taken each day at national, trans-national and global level. But where are the spaces where the citizens themselves can discuss these matters? And which systems can gather the responses of the citizens and direct them to decision-makers? We want to make that system.

GlobalSay will be a world-covering platform that will help people like you set up their own local events for debate, highly coordinated across the globe; it provides balanced high-quality information about the debated topics; it guides the discussion groups through a debate program; collects and compares the conclusions of the participating citizens. And finally – serves the conclusions to relevant policy-makers.

It is even more for you since GlobalSay will not only be useful for global debates. Your national sports association may want to listen to its members in a national large scale dialogue? Or the scouts may want to have a national discussion, in which all scout units have their town hall meeting – and they want to gather the responses and discuss them when all the scout leaders have their yearly assembly?  GlobalSay can be used for that and much, much more.


We will make a platform that makes it possible to set up a multi-site top-quality fair democratic coordinated debate in a few months, based upon multiple small local debates arranged by local engaged people like you.

We give an intro to GlobalSay here - for more, visit the GlobalSay Website www.globalsay.org

GlobalSay consists of Global Actions, made by a GlobalSay Community, which is served by a set of GlobalSay software services.

The GlobalSay Actions are described above: Time-limited thematic global debates, made by the Community, take place at dinner-tables, schools, libraries, etc, and are reported to decision-makers through the software and by the Partners.

The GlobalSay Community consists of Members who will take part in the meetings, and out of these some will act as Hosts and others will take the role as Facilitators. In each country ee will need a National Node, which will translate information materials, videos, questions, instructions and the national language version of the GlobalSay software, and the nodes will help expanding the Community in their countries. Finally, the Community also has Partners, which are organisations taking a co-leadership of GlobalSay, and a Coordinator, which is DBT Foundation.

Besides involving the GlobalSay Community the debates should of course engage citizens at large. This will be done by inviting citizens as guests for the local meetings. And everyone can join as Members.

The GlobalSay software is a combination of

  • Public internet functions to serve the Community with information, ensure the meetings run smoothly, and to disseminate the GlobalSay Action results.
  • Apps for mobiles and tablets to make it possible for members to sign up for the Community and for the meetings, and to report their answers so that they can be analysed and reported to decision-makers.
  • Web-based back-end functions for Coordinator, Partners and National Nodes.
The software is already developed to the level of screen mock-ups, rough specifications and a description of user work-flows. All we need is to code and test it.

What We Need & What You Get

We have four economic targets to establish GlobalSay:

  1. Coding a simple functioning version – 40.000 USD. The first target for now.
  2. Test/showcase one small GlobalSay Action and build global community + 75.000 USD. We would be so happy to receive that from all of you donors now.
  3. Tests, adjust the system, more functions and make a more refined version, plus expanding the community to more countries + 50.000 USD. That would be really, really great to reach!
  4. Make a full scale showcase of a GlobalSay Action + 100-250.000 USD, depending on the number of participating countries. Thanks a very lot if we reach that – we can go the whole way already now!!!

This sums up to 265-415.000 USD. If we receive more then we will speed up the development, make more tests, make it more shiny and elegant, expand the Community to more countries and make a larger full scale showcase or even more showcases than one. If we do not reach our 40.000 USD target then the funds will be used for GlobalSay anyway, and we will continue seek funding by other means. Any donation will land at GlobalSay. See our budget at the GlobalSay website.

The donations from you will be managed by the initiator, the Danish Board of Technology Foundation (DBT). DBT is a world-renowned expert center in public participation about complex societal topics. It is a not-for-profit foundation with a common good purpose and it is overseen by the Danish foundation authorities and by a Danish State authorized auditor.

You can make anonymous donations. However, if you provide us with contact information then we will use it to keep you informed so that you can become a Community Member when we are ready for it. We made som "perks" you can choose if you want to get proof or profile out of your donation.

The Impact

Experts, NGO's, industry, parties - all of them try to influence politics, and they all claim to speak for the public good. But when is it that the public is actually heard? Opinion polls provide reflex answers that people even cannot recall after they answered. What we need is spaces/opportunities for people to be informed, deliberate and provide their reflected and considered answers. Many decision-makers know that and they call for proper public participation.

GlobalSay will be built in order to allow for exactly that: An opportunity for all to take part in dialogues and debates, which are well-informed so that they provide well-considered answers.

In order to make a GlobalSay Action have policy impact there needs to be trust  and there needs to be a good contact to the policy-making level.

First of all GlobalSay wants to be a balanced and unbiased initiative. The intention is to truly bring the voices of citizens to the ears of decision-makers – not to favor certain positions. The impact will be built upon this credibility. Secondly, we have a very large network of potential partners who have very good contact to and are trusted by decision-makers and these contacts will be used and expanded. Thirdly, the Partners will be trained and engaged in establishing new contacts to policy-makers locally, nationally and internationally so that GlobalSay gets the contacts it needs to get the message through. We certainly expect that GlobalSay will attract much attention among policy-makers and media - if not for other reasons then because of the reach and size of it.

The Coordinator DBT has coordinated global citizen World Wide Views debates involving from 25 to 76 nations in collaboration with UN, EU and national governments. And now we want to bring the target higher and we want new on-line services and democratic crowds to help that happen. That is where the idea of GlobalSay comes from and where the impacs will grow from.

Risks & Challenges

The main risk we will face is connected to getting this widely known so that we get many people on board as Members. We will, of course, use social media etc. but we basically trust that rumours will spread fast and people will join. GlobalSay is an opportunity to be part of things that matter. Many people want that, we believe.

But what if this does not happen or happens too slowly? Then we have a Plan B: We are making many other forms of activities and our many colleages around the globe as well. We and they will then begin to use the GlobalSay system for those projects and we will thereby slowly develop a large Community.

Another risk is that we will face problems with making the platform work properly. We do not really find that to be a large risk since we are quite experienced in such work, and since we are very well connected with top-class software developers. But a risk always good to be aware of...

The largest risk is that fundraising goes slow/small, so that it will take too much efforts to get GlobalSay finished for implementation. But that is a risk you can really help us avoid.

Other Ways You Can Help

We are building a method in which the Community is incredibly important.

  • You can really help it all along by spreading the word about this - ask people to check out this Indoegogo page!
  • Ask them to consider joining the Community at some point in the future.
  • Ask them to use their contacts, social media, networks to spread the word.
  • And you can also help GlobalSay along by using the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Anyone can support GlobalSay by making it visible - just as anyone at a later point can support it by becoming part of it.
story_txt:
GlobalSay will be connecting multiple local debates on important topics. It will report the conclusions of the debates
to decision-makers. It will be a
not-for-profit online tool for widely distributed democratic debates.
You are an engaged person. We should discuss
matters that concern us all you think. When you discuss with your friends, family, colleagues you may have had the thought how small
the discussion group is – compared to how important the issue is. You
feel that our world should act as one big democratic deliberation
space.
We agree: Big decisions about our lives are taken each day at national,
trans-national and global level. But where are the spaces where the
citizens themselves can discuss these matters? And which systems can gather the responses of the citizens and direct them to decision-makers? We want to make that system.
GlobalSay will be a world-covering platform that will
help people like you set up their own local events for debate, highly
coordinated across the globe; it provides balanced high-quality information
about the debated topics; it guides the discussion groups through a debate
program; collects and compares the conclusions of the participating citizens.
And finally – serves the conclusions to relevant policy-makers.
It
is even more for you
since GlobalSay will not only be useful for global debates. Your
national sports association may want to listen to its members in a national
large scale dialogue? Or the scouts may want to have a national discussion, in
which all scout units have their town hall meeting – and they want to gather the
responses and discuss them when all the scout leaders have their yearly
assembly?  GlobalSay can
be used for that and much, much more.
We will make a platform that makes it possible
to set up a multi-site top-quality fair democratic coordinated debate in a few
months, based upon multiple small local debates arranged by local engaged
people like you.


We give an intro to GlobalSay here - for more, visit the GlobalSay Website www.globalsay.orgGlobalSay consists of Global Actions, made by a GlobalSay Community,
which is served by a set of GlobalSay
software services.
The GlobalSay Actions are described above: Time-limited thematic global debates, made by the Community, take place at dinner-tables, schools, libraries, etc, and are reported to decision-makers through the software and by the Partners.
The GlobalSay
Community
consists of Members who will take
part in the meetings, and out of these some will act as Hosts and others will take the role as Facilitators. In each country ee will
need a National Node, which will
translate information materials, videos, questions, instructions and the
national language version of the GlobalSay software, and the nodes will help
expanding the Community in their countries. Finally, the Community also has Partners, which are organisations
taking a co-leadership of GlobalSay, and a Coordinator,
which is DBT Foundation.

Besides involving the GlobalSay Community the
debates should of course engage citizens at large. This will be done by
inviting citizens as guests for the local meetings. And everyone can join as
Members.The GlobalSay
software is a
combination of 


Public internet functions to serve
the Community with information, ensure the meetings run smoothly, and to
disseminate the GlobalSay Action results.

Apps for mobiles and tablets to make
it possible for members to sign up for the Community and for the meetings, and to
report their answers so that they can be analysed and reported to decision-makers.

Web-based back-end functions for Coordinator, Partners and National Nodes.


The software is already developed to the level
of screen mock-ups, rough specifications and a description of user work-flows. All we need is to code and test it.   What We Need & What You Get 

We have four
economic targets to establish GlobalSay:


Coding a simple functioning version –
40.000 USD. The first target for now.

Test/showcase one small GlobalSay Action and build global community + 75.000 USD. We would be so happy to receive
that from all of you donors now.

Tests, adjust the system, more functions and
make a more refined version, plus expanding the community to more countries + 50.000
USD. That would be really, really great to reach!

Make a full scale showcase of a GlobalSay
Action + 100-250.000 USD, depending on the number of participating countries. Thanks
a very lot if we reach that – we can go the whole way already now!!!

This sums
up to 265-415.000 USD. If we receive more then we will speed up the
development, make more tests, make it more shiny and elegant, expand
the Community to more countries and make a larger full scale showcase or even more showcases than one. If we do not reach our 40.000 USD target then the funds will be used for
 GlobalSay anyway, and we will continue seek funding by other means. Any 
donation will land at GlobalSay. See our budget at the GlobalSay website.The donations from you will be managed by the initiator, the Danish Board of
Technology Foundation (DBT). DBT is a world-renowned expert center in public
participation about complex societal topics. It is a not-for-profit foundation
with a common good purpose and it is overseen by the Danish foundation
authorities and by a Danish State authorized auditor.You can make anonymous donations. However, if you provide us with contact information then we will use it to keep you informed so that you can become a Community Member when we are ready for it. We made som "perks" you can choose if you want to get proof or profile out of your donation.
  The Impact 

Experts, NGO's, industry, parties - all of them try to influence politics, and they all claim to speak for the public good. But when is it that the public is actually heard? Opinion polls provide reflex answers that people even cannot recall after they answered. What we need is spaces/opportunities for people to be informed, deliberate and provide their reflected and considered answers. Many decision-makers know that and they call for proper public participation.
GlobalSay will be built in order to allow for exactly that: An opportunity for all to take part in dialogues and debates, which are well-informed so that they provide well-considered answers.
In order to
make a GlobalSay Action have policy
impact there needs to be trust  and there needs to be a good contact to the policy-making level. 
First of
all GlobalSay wants to be a balanced and unbiased initiative. The intention is
to truly bring the voices of citizens to the ears of decision-makers – not to
favor certain positions. The impact will be built upon this credibility. Secondly,
we have a very large network of potential partners who have very good contact
to and are trusted by decision-makers and these contacts will be used and
expanded. Thirdly, the Partners will be trained and engaged in establishing new
contacts to policy-makers locally, nationally and internationally so that GlobalSay
gets the contacts it needs to get the message through. We certainly expect that GlobalSay will attract much attention among
policy-makers and media - if not for other reasons then because of the reach and size of it.
The Coordinator DBT has
coordinated global citizen World Wide Views debates involving from 25 to 76 nations in
collaboration with UN, EU and national governments. And now we want to bring
the target higher and we want new on-line services and democratic crowds to help
that happen. That is where the idea of GlobalSay
comes from and where the impacs will grow from.
  Risks & Challenges  The main risk we will face is connected to getting this widely known so that we get many people on board as Members. We will, of course, use social media etc. but we basically trust that rumours will spread fast and people will join. GlobalSay is an opportunity to be part of things that matter. Many people want that, we believe.
But what if this does not happen or happens too slowly? Then we have a Plan B: We are making many other forms of activities and our many colleages around the globe as well. We and they will then begin to use the GlobalSay system for those projects and we will thereby slowly develop a large Community.
Another risk is that we will face problems with making the platform work properly. We do not really find that to be a large risk since we are quite experienced in such work, and since we are very well connected with top-class software developers. But a risk always good to be aware of...
The largest risk is that fundraising goes slow/small, so that it will take too much efforts to get GlobalSay finished for implementation. But that is a risk you can really help us avoid.
  Other Ways You Can Help We are building a method in which the Community is incredibly important.
 You can really help it all along by spreading the word about this - ask people to check out this Indoegogo page! 

Ask them to consider joining the Community at some point in the future. Ask them to use their contacts, social media, networks to spread the word.

And you can also help GlobalSay along by using the Indiegogo share tools!
Anyone can support GlobalSay by making it visible - just as anyone at a later point can support it by becoming part of it.

story:
Democracy is broken

Our nation has always been predicated on one underlying truth:  A functioning democracy demands maximum accountability and transparency. 

Recent outcomes and the shifting political climate have begun to put our elected officials out of reach.

  • We are a small group of passionate technologists and designers that are bringing a user-centric view to the global democratic space
  • We are focused intensely on creating a system that works for today's societies 
  • It's important we are able to crowd source our runway to market to remain non-partisan and be accountable to civilians, voters and constituents

We strongly believe in what Advocate is going to become and just need the runway to get there. The runway to build something that can fundamentally change politics, democracy and governments around the world.  

Influence is out of reach for the average voter

Digital is disrupting democracy but it’s still on the large ticket party terms with:

  • Undisclosed lobbying and Super PACs
  • No standardized connection between candidates and supporters 
  • Lack of transparency into government and upcoming issues 
  • No standardized connection between candidates and supporters 
  • No accountability for politicians to their constituents 
  • No aggregated common way for voters to voice their opinion  to their representatives 

Introducing Advocate

Advocate is a digital platform that increases the accountability and transparency of government. It provides tools that politicians use to connect with citizens to:

  • Activate and organize supporters  
  • Raise non-monetary engagement 
  • Poll and educate constituents 
  • Explain issues and representative positions 
  • Build habits around citizen engagement

What we need and what you get

In the end all we need is time, people and enough runway to take aim at changing the world, to create a new era of habitual democratic tools.

  • We are looking to raise $250K to expand our team in 2016 
  • The funding will go to increase our development velocity to capture awareness during the looming presidential campaign year
  • By donating to our cause you will be the first to Beta test the tools and help drive innovation, identify needs and shape our platform on a global scale 
  • Through aggregating our donation data we are able to get a sense of the correct countries, states and cities to bring Advocate to first in 2016 (tell your local friends!)
  • If we don't reach our goal we will shorten our runway to 6-months and prioritize the tools to get traction in order to be self sustaining 

Other ways you can help

We understand not everyone can give money and we encourage you to: 

  • Get the word out on our mission through your social channels by sharing this page and liking us on all the common platforms 
  • Go to www.joinadvocate.com and register your representatives to be the first to receive space on the platform in order to connect with you

Join us on this journey to make impactful change to the world.
