story:
Ohana Acres Farmstead

 

     Our mission is to work in concert with nature to develop a sustainable and biologically diverse farmstead. By using proven organic methods to raise high quality produce and livestock, we will provide safe, nutritious, and ethical products for our community. For today, tomorrow, and generations to come.


We are seeking help in funding the cost of starting this grand venture. Truly anything would be a great help. The funds will be used to plant acres of fruit and nut trees, outfit the 30' x 96' high tunnel so we can extended our growing season, purchase a chainsaw mill to produce the lumber to build infrastructure, and a walking tractor to ready the feilds.


For updates please visit us at 


Facebook.com/OhanaAcresFarm
story_txt: Ohana Acres Farmstead      Our mission is to work in concert with nature to develop a sustainable and biologically diverse farmstead. By using proven organic methods to raise high quality produce and livestock, we will provide safe, nutritious, and ethical products for our community. For today, tomorrow, and generations to come.We are seeking help in funding the cost of starting this grand venture. Truly anything would be a great help. The funds will be used to plant acres of fruit and nut trees, outfit the 30' x 96' high tunnel so we can extended our growing season, purchase a chainsaw mill to produce the lumber to build infrastructure, and a walking tractor to ready the feilds.For updates please visit us at Facebook.com/OhanaAcresFarm

story:
It was the winter of 2013,  My good friend Chris Zelig spontaneously draped a brand new coat on a surprised homeless man near our office on 22nd street here in Manhattan..

Yeah, he’s just that kind of guy…

Later that same week, Our company bought 300  brand new jackets with the idea of going direct to the people in need and distribute the jackets.

We decided to get everyone in the office involved with the project.

We learned a lot about the mechanics and logistics of doing this sort of thing, and helped some people. The feeling we all had that day was like walking hand in hand with god. Seriously Cool, No other way to say it...

For the next 2 years we thought about how we can take the lessons learned and bring the gift of warmth AND the gift of GIVING to more people.

The gift of giving?

One of the best moments of my entire life was going out with my son Matthew and some friends  to hand out some coats. It was a great experience, seeing the light of gratitude on BOTH my own son and the deserving people whose lives got better as a result of his generosity.

The TRUE benefactor in ANY act of charity, after all is Always the giver…

It was in this moment, that GoodYork was born….

We pledged to shine a light on ordinary people doing extraordinarily kind things.

We believe that the media depicts the majority of people as uncaring, and self-centered, looking out for only themselves, and that's just NOT how the world works from our perspective. Kindness is the norm, and selfish is the exception.

Problem is, it IS what sells papers, airtime and clicks on commercial websites. It’s what gets politicians elected and makes the world go round.

The “Real” actions just aren't as cool in the public eye, OR as profitable for media companies..

THAT changes today!

GoodYork is a different kind of media company. Our primary goal is to move the needle forward on humanity in a way that makes being kind cool!


And we need your help….

All the money for this project to be from good people with a good heart, (You know, people just like you)...

Look, things only change when WE Change Things Together.

To give this movement the “Spark” it so richly deserves, and give you a proper incentive to Give Now, And Invite Friends please. We put together some Perks for you. :-)



Short Summary

  • I’m Gene Mikhov and my background is in marketing, and change.

  • I believe that people are better than the traditional media gives them credit for and THAT needs to change...

  • With a well-placed media campaign highlighting the everyday kindness of the “Average Joe & Josephine”, we can literally change the way people think about their fellow human beings and make the world a better place for our children and really, isn't that the reason we’re all here?.

What We Need & What You Get

  • The goal is to fund a full-time film crew for just 3 months, 25k to make high-quality content that spotlights good people doing good things. My team will make honest money from ad revenue to keep the ball rolling and perpetuate the good You Are About To Do well into the future!

  • Perks!

  • Even if the goal isn't reached, any funds received will go toward getting the word out in whatever way we can.

The Impact

  • By its very design, the world becomes a visibly better place when you participate today!

  • We already have vast experience with sending content viral, your kindness WILL be amplified by this experience!

Other Ways You Can Help

  • People WILL go hungry, and remain out in the cold when others fail to share, comment, and spread the word. Even if you can't contribute today, you CAN raise awareness. Together we can DO this!

story:
Join Our Campaign!

​​Mz Judged is a successful event that's been running in a couple of rural towns in Northern British Columbia for years. The Mz Judged event is a beauty pageant where the women are in fact men and the it's used to fund programs that work to end violence against women and raise awareness for this social issue. This event sell out in minutes every time. We want to make a documentary that shows what the Mz Judged event is so other towns can learn how to raise awareness and funds for their critical programs.  This is a call out there to help fund the Mz Judged Documentary. Let's get it out there! Support the project now!

The Impact

Our goal is to bring the issue of ending violence against women to the front lines and show what can be done at the community level. You need to get peoples attention. Mz Judged does exactly that and people get it. It does bring an element of fun into a sombre issue but that balance is what makes it palatable and highly successful. Towns that can raise funds and awareness using Mz Judged for programs that help end violence will be better equipped and supported to make a difference. Community by community. The Mz Judged Documentary will inspire communities to take their own Mz judged on.

One step further? Imagine provincials then nationals! Completely possible!

The Problem

With government cutbacks to program funding, critical services have become scarce. In Canada there is no proactive support for a man that is violent against a women until the case reaches the courts which is often too late. In addition, women and children need to access services and support in order to leave their house for safety. The only way to make certain these services are available is to fund raise.

The Mz Judged fundraiser increases public awareness to the violence against women issue and gets men advocating for the cause while also raising funds to support positive change. It's a win win event.

The Smithers event in 2014 raised over 50 thousand dollars, which supports programs that help end violence against women. Mz Judged is so entertaining it sells out every year in just over fifteen minutes! It’s a great cause and a great time had by all. They're making a difference with this biannual event!

Other towns need to know about this so they can host their own Mz judged. Why does it work? How do you get contestants? How does this event raise money for front line non-profit societies? Everyone needs to see what small town communities are doing about an issue that’s global. So, the creation of this documentary is to invite other communities to put on their own Mz Judged and raise awareness to help end violence against women.

Prince Rupert B.C. just had their fourth Mz Judged event this October 16h 2015 to a sold out show of 650 people. We’re including this in our final edit which will be posted here by November 4th 2015. Raising Funds

What We Have

We have over 30 hours of footage nearly 85% complete, including interviews with contestants, the Mayor, MLA Rep, the founder of Mz Judged - Executive Director at North Coast Transition Society, Executive Director of Northern Society for Domestic Peace and Dale Trimble MA - currently in private practice he is a pioneer in the anti-violence field of working with men, and co-founder of BC’s first court ordered treatment program for men who assault their partners. Some of the contestants are firemen, lawyers, RCMP, Doctor's, artists and more.

What We Need

By raising funds we can complete the documentary in a 3-4 months full-time rather than a year or so part time. We just finished filming the latest event in Prince Rupert on November 16th, 2015. The funds are to complete interviews in other towns, post production, legal, licenses, insurance and help along the way. It's a tight budget however hundreds of hours have been logged already and the ground work is pretty well done.  We feel time is of the essence with this campaign. Watch the trailer. If you believe in Mz Judged, please help us out and jump in.

The funds we raise will complete the storyline, a few more interviews, post production and mastering of the documentary.

We need a minimum of $14,000 to complete the documentary at this point and anything above that will further improve visuals, promotion, legal, securing broadcast agreements and website development.

$14,000 - Completes the Mz judged Documentary

$18,000 - Improves visuals and helps tailor the package to T.V. networks

$25,000 - Builds the website into tools that help towns manage their event with contestant profiles, how to get it started, graphic packages etc.

$50,000 - Formalize the Mz Judged event with standards to maintain quality and integrity to the cause including developing a national competition strategy for contestants.

We can do it with your help!


Project Risks

I have a high level of perseverance and skill to overcome obstacles along the way. What keeps me going is the power in the event to raise awareness, as I've seen and experienced. My advisory board consists of professionals in both the documentary/T.V. realms along with the agencies that that rely on fund raising to run their programs. As challenges arise, we plan to persevere. Funding allows us the time to focus time and energy on this project.

story:
Help Launch a Community Dispute Resolution Centre for the South Shore!

A group of organizations (including South Shore Community Justice Society, Bridgewater Police Services, Harbour House, and Second Story Women’s Centre) along with interested individuals across the South Shore has come together to create a Community Dispute Resolution Centre (CDRC) in Bridgewater, Nova Scotia.

As a program of the South Shore Community Justice Society, the mission of the CDRC is to provide tools, education, and services that empower people to peacefully resolve their own conflicts using restorative approaches and practices. The vision is to foster safe, peaceful communities through the use of restorative approaches and practices.

Our trained volunteer mediators will provide individuals, organizations, and businesses in our community with assistance in resolving non-criminal conflicts efficiently, effectively, fairly, and by mutual agreement.  This program is completely voluntary. The CDRC will also be a resource to educate and train the citizens, giving them the tools to address conflict constructively and positively in order to build a peaceful community.

What is a “Restorative Approach”?

Restorative approach to conflict focuses on providing a safe and supportive space for all parties to share their perspectives, foster understanding of the situation that caused conflict, and providing support for parties to work collaboratively to avoid future conflict and rebuild damaged relationships. This approach developed as an alternative to traditionally punitive systems that focuses on “wrongdoers” being alienated from the community. This often results in a further breakdown of feelings of connection and responsibility to their community, while simultaneously offering little opportunity for victims to be heard, and little freedom for the parties to work together for mutually beneficial solutions.

What Services Will the Program Offer?

Services will include:

Mediation:This is a process where a trained third person, regarded as neutral by the people with the dispute, assists the disputants to talk about the conflict and come to a resolution that is mutually satisfactory and agreed upon, and which the parties agree ends the conflict.

Facilitation:  The volunteer mediators will also offer facilitation services when the resolution of a problem or dispute would benefit from a group discussion format. Facilitation is an efficient and effective way for groups to discuss a problem thoroughly and reach practical, realistic solutions.

Community Education and Outreach: The CDRC will offer conflict resolution training and education to schools, businesses, and community groups with the ultimate goal of building conflict resolution capacity in the community.

What Can You Do? 

The CDRC will benefit not just individuals, but the entire South Shore—through education, trainings, and a gradual transformation of the culture. We’ve come a long way towards making the CDRC a reality… but we need your help! The dedication of many participating organizations and volunteers has gotten us through the planning stages, and now we need to raise an additional $5,000 to pay for mediator training, office supplies, and other start-up costs to make this vision a reality.

We count on the support of individuals like you to help make the South Shore of Nova Scotia a more peaceful place to live.

We have an incredible team of representatives from interested non-profits and community members who are giving their time to make this happen. We need money to pay for things like:

·  Mediator training

·  Publicity and promotional materials

·  Office supplies

·  Travel expenses for trainings and events

Every dollar helps. Thank you in advance for your contribution—and for sharing this campaign on your social media!

story:
Short Summary

Hi, I'm Terra (and yes, that's my given name, pretty cool...)I'm an artist, a nature lover, a people person, and now a mom. For the last 10 years, I've been a driven entrepreneur with what is now a thriving green business. 2 years ago I had a baby. Along with my perfect little Aria came the question; How was I going to be the mom I wanted to be AND maintain my business and identity as it's owner? Growing up, my mom worked tirelessly to support my family and she set the example that allowed me to never be afraid of hard work. But trying to be a present and creative mom to my daughter isn't just about 'putting in the work'. They say that it takes a village to raise a child but I'm not even sure that many of us parents these days actually feel like we are a part of one. My dream is to create a community, both intellectually AND physically that can support parents toward the best of all worlds. Help them be so good at what they have to DO that it's easy to BE who they want to be, not only for themselves but for their families, for their communities and for the world.

  • Cultivate & Nest is the physical space that will be shared by the Cultivate Community. A growing group of people in the Pioneer Valley of Western MA who are committed to being great entrepreneurs and even better parents. Our goal is to provide not only a physical space where you can come get all your work done but where your child can be stimulated and enriched simultaneously. No more days feeling totally isolated and staying up after baby goes to bed desperately trying to get your work done before you collapse. At Cultivate, you'll have more resources including professional workspace, amenities like meeting space, free coffee and especially moral support and creative collaboration with other families just like yours! In an on site (but separate) space, your preschooler will get healthy socialization and fun, enriching curriculum while being safely supervised by a loving and licensed early childhood professional. Think of what even just 2 hours of totally focused work per day could do for your business...and your sanity! We also plan to make available a true community space where we can share our skills, our wisdom and creativity through workshops and events that help us all grow.


What We Need & What You Get

Cultivate is brand new...like screaming, red-faced newborn new. We need everything from good office furniture to a projector for our community meeting space. We need books and toys and art supplies for the little ones...and of course a good coffee maker!  While we are grateful for all the awesome donations of physical stuff we are collecting, we know that there will still be a lot of things that we just won't be lucky enough to get as gifts. In a perfect world - one where we got fully funded- we will be leasing the space right next door so we can have a bigger, better Nest space and a very large space available for events on a larger scale. Getting funded would give us boat loads more confidence during this start up phase.

  • We are asking for $20,000 in total but EVERYTHING HELPS!  That money will be used to prepay the lease a bit to take pressure off of our founding members as we advocate to grow our community over the first few months. It will also allow us to expand into the larger event and childcare space right away which makes us an even better community asset. It will also be nice to have a little to put into some high quality amenities like a projector and some security measures and goodies to keep our babies educationally entertained, like curriculum and activity supplies. We also hope to get a professional upgrade to our management software and website!
  • It was super important to us, when we thought of what we could use to recognize your generosity, and we wanted it to be GOOD!  At every level, we will be honoring the donor with a handmade flag on a beautiful strand of bunting that will be hung in our space all the way through our grand opening in February, so everyone will know who helped us along the way! You could also get an awesome 'mommy and me' coloring kit that Terra drew personally! We will ship it right to you!  There's marketing opportunities for you and your small business by way of shout outs and even sponsorships of our grand opening event and special projects. And of course, there's lots of ways to support us(and get to know us!) by getting preordered memberships to the space!


  • If we don't get fully funded, we won't be able to expand into the larger space(yet...). But have no fear! Cultivate and Nest is coming no matter what, we might just have to be a little more 'boot-strappy'!

The Impact

Cultivate is more than just a business, it's a social mission, and it's a dream. When I was pregnant, I couldn't imagine how I was going to do it 'all'. And the crazy part, is that I have it just about as easy as a mom could. My business was thriving, I had an INCREDIBLE team (thank you Lynn, Falecia, Andrew, Dan, Sarah, Emily, Susie, Valerie and Eric!) I also had a partner in life, business and everything...and yet, it was still intimidating like crazy!  The idea behind C & N is that by pulling together, we become a safety net for one another during this amazing and transformational time for our lives, our businesses, our identities and our spirits.


  • If you are a parent, you know how hard it sucks to feel like something competes with your little beloved for your attention.  If you are an entrepreneur, you know how impossible it can feel sometimes to get it all done. If you are both an entrepreneur and a parent, you know a pressure that few can relate to. We so desperately want to help relieve that pressure for everyone who locks arms with us. Let's be the village we all need.
  • Building my other green business, Beloved Earth, into a local fixture here in the community, I know what it means to nurture my network and cherish my relationships. I know I can't do this alone, but I also know that I don't need to!

Risks & Challenges

We are not afraid of not opening our doors. But it doesn't mean it's not intimidating. One of the biggest challenges we see is not having enough space to be sustainable. Sharing is an interesting model and while we know that there are a lot of people who need to be with us, our challenge is going to be reaching them all and making sure that we keep our costs affordable enough to make sure they can all join us. Our commitment is to providing awesome, professional, amenity-ridden workspace AND enriching childcare under one roof - FOR LESS THAN PROFESSIONAL DAY CARE ALONE. Yes, we are serious. In order to make sure that's a reality, we need to get out of obscurity, and fast.

  • Fortunately, I love to network and build relationships. This business is MADE for word of mouth, and who talks better than new parents! I think we have an amazing resource with these folks as our target market, you must spend money but saving money is super enticing!
  • Part of our budget will be marketing and networking to get the word out, along with improving our web presence through an improved website and social media engagement. (We already have a trade agreement in place with the local radio station, whoopee!!)

Other Ways You Can Help

What's that you say? The holiday season was a cruddy time to launch an indiegogo campaign?? Yes, we considered that. But, honestly, there's no time like the present! Speaking of presents, what about giving your niece an amazing handmade coloring kit? 2 birds with one stone!

But seriously, if you are not in the position to lend your support financially, could you consider sharing the campaign with your network and helping to get the word out? 

There it is. 

Whether you can help or not...know that we love you, admire all that you do for your business and your family, and we stand in awe as you reflect back to us how awesome we all are for making it work!

My dream is to create a community, both intellectually AND physically that can support parents toward the best of all worlds. Help them be so good at what they have to DO that it's easy to BE who they want to be, not only for themselves but for their families, for their communities and for the world.
 
Cultivate & Nest is the physical space that will be shared by the Cultivate Community. A growing group of people in the Pioneer Valley of Western MA who are committed to being great entrepreneurs and even better parents. Our goal is to provide not only a physical space where you can come get all your work done but where your child can be stimulated and enriched simultaneously. No more days feeling totally isolated and staying up after baby goes to bed desperately trying to get your work done before you collapse. At Cultivate, you'll have more resources including professional workspace, amenities like meeting space, free coffee and especially moral support and creative collaboration with other families just like yours! In an on site (but separate) space, your preschooler will get healthy socialization and fun, enriching curriculum while being safely supervised by a loving and licensed early childhood professional. Think of what even just 2 hours of totally focused work per day could do for your business...and your sanity! We also plan to make available a true community space where we can share our skills, our wisdom and creativity through workshops and events that help us all grow.


   What We Need & What You Get Cultivate is brand new...like screaming, red-faced newborn new. We need everything from good office furniture to a projector for our community meeting space. We need books and toys and art supplies for the little ones...and of course a good coffee maker!  While we are grateful for all the awesome donations of physical stuff we are collecting, we know that there will still be a lot of things that we just won't be lucky enough to get as gifts. In a perfect world - one where we got fully funded- we will be leasing the space right next door so we can have a bigger, better Nest space and a very large space available for events on a larger scale. Getting funded would give us boat loads more confidence during this start up phase.  We are asking for $20,000 in total but EVERYTHING HELPS!  That money will be used to prepay the lease a bit to take pressure off of our founding members as we advocate to grow our community over the first few months. It will also allow us to expand into the larger event and childcare space right away which makes us an even better community asset. It will also be nice to have a little to put into some high quality amenities like a projector and some security measures and goodies to keep our babies educationally entertained, like curriculum and activity supplies. We also hope to get a professional upgrade to our management software and website! It was super important to us, when we thought of what we could use to recognize your generosity, and we wanted it to be GOOD!  At every level, we will be honoring the donor with a handmade flag on a beautiful strand of bunting that will be hung in our space all the way through our grand opening in February, so everyone will know who helped us along the way! You could also get an awesome 'mommy and me' coloring kit that Terra drew personally! We will ship it right to you!  There's marketing opportunities for you and your small business by way of shout outs and even sponsorships of our grand opening event and special projects. And of course, there's lots of ways to support us(and get to know us!) by getting preordered memberships to the space!





 If we don't get fully funded, we won't be able to expand into the larger space(yet...). But have no fear! Cultivate and Nest is coming no matter what, we might just have to be a little more 'boot-strappy'!    The Impact Cultivate is more than just a business, it's a social mission, and it's a dream. When I was pregnant, I couldn't imagine how I was going to do it 'all'. And the crazy part, is that I have it just about as easy as a mom could. My business was thriving, I had an INCREDIBLE team (thank you Lynn, Falecia, Andrew, Dan, Sarah, Emily, Susie, Valerie and Eric!) I also had a partner in life, business and everything...and yet, it was still intimidating like crazy!  The idea behind C & N is that by pulling together, we become a safety net for one another during this amazing and transformational time for our lives, our businesses, our identities and our spirits.


  If you are a parent, you know how hard it sucks to feel like something competes with your little beloved for your attention.  If you are an entrepreneur, you know how impossible it can feel sometimes to get it all done. If you are both an entrepreneur and a parent, you know a pressure that few can relate to. We so desperately want to help relieve that pressure for everyone who locks arms with us. Let's be the village we all need. Building my other green business, Beloved Earth, into a local fixture here in the community, I know what it means to nurture my network and cherish my relationships. I know I can't do this alone, but I also know that I don't need to! 
   Risks & Challenges  We are not afraid of not opening our doors. But it doesn't mean it's not intimidating. One of the biggest challenges we see is not having enough space to be sustainable. Sharing is an interesting model and while we know that there are a lot of people who need to be with us, our challenge is going to be reaching them all and making sure that we keep our costs affordable enough to make sure they can all join us. Our commitment is to providing awesome, professional, amenity-ridden workspace AND enriching childcare under one roof - FOR LESS THAN PROFESSIONAL DAY CARE ALONE. Yes, we are serious. In order to make sure that's a reality, we need to get out of obscurity, and fast.  Fortunately, I love to network and build relationships. This business is MADE for word of mouth, and who talks better than new parents! I think we have an amazing resource with these folks as our target market, you must spend money but saving money is super enticing! Part of our budget will be marketing and networking to get the word out, along with improving our web presence through an improved website and social media engagement. (We already have a trade agreement in place with the local radio station, whoopee!!)    Other Ways You Can Help What's that you say? The holiday season was a cruddy time to launch an indiegogo campaign?? Yes, we considered that. But, honestly, there's no time like the present! Speaking of presents, what about giving your niece an amazing handmade coloring kit? 2 birds with one stone!
But seriously, if you are not in the position to lend your support financially, could you consider sharing the campaign with your network and helping to get the word out?   There it is. Whether you can help or not...know that we love you, admire all that you do for your business and your family, and we stand in awe as you reflect back to us how awesome we all are for making it work!

story:
Short Summary

My husband and I have been blessed with a spot that will allow us to introduce a grand innovation: international vegan fast food. It’s called Vegan Xpress, and the purpose is to show people that vegan food and fast food need not be mutually exclusive categories. At Vegan Xpress, we serve only the finest vegan dishes, and we do so as quickly and conveniently as possible, making it easier for people to stick to their diets and stay healthy and responsible.

In addition to serving food, we also feature in-house entertainment (every other Thursday) by showcasing local talents within our community, which also includes my own singing. Singing is a long-time profession of mine, something that I love to do and still do quit often, and it would be my honor to share this gift of mine with all of my customers. In addition to the restaurant Vegan Xpress offers catering services and cooking workshops. This in return gives people the basic knowledge, tools, and skills to help them create their very own favorite plant based meals.

Veganism is a concept that is here to stay in Israel. The number of vegans within the country is staggering, and the youngest generations are statistically much more likely to be vegan than ever before. Vegan Xpress is a place where not only vegans, but also people of all diversity, can get away from the tension that is often a part of life in Israel and break some proverbial bread together.

I believe in this concept. I know that there is a market for it here in Mitzpe Ramon, and I want to serve that market. On top of that, this restaurant will make it possible for my husband and I to provide for our family. Vegan Xpress is a restaurant for the people of Mitzpe Ramon, yes, but it is also for anyone looking for a unique experience through taste & service while embracing the nature around you.

 

A Little Bit About Chef Britney Monique

Originally from Raleigh, North Carolina, she relocated to Israel with her dad about twenty years ago. Today her home is in Mitzpe Ramon (southern), Israel, a place known as much for its beauty as it is for its pleasant atmosphere and wonderful people.

  1. Married of seven years, and has a step-son serving in the army, and two beautiful daughters.
  2. Last February, Britney graduated from Le Cordon Blue School of Culinary Arts, earning her Bachelor of Arts in Culinary Management.
  3. For almost four years prior to that, she worked as the Head Chef and Restaurant Manager at Ramon Smart Hotels in Mitzpe Ramon. She enjoyed that position greatly, and it was only in order to start her own business that she ever stopped working there.
  4. Britney’s specialty when it comes to the kitchen is vegan cuisine. The inspiration stems from marrying her husband who has been vegan all his life. Knowing this forced her to create dishes/ food alternatives that she had once loved to eat into something more healthier that even her husband could enjoy. She has learned a lot over the years, but time and again, Britney has been drawn back to this one area of cooking, this area in which she excels and this area in which she takes great pride. In vegan cuisine, the ingredients are limitless and the possibilities remain endless. She states “I get excited to step into the kitchen every day, knowing that I am using my creativity for the benefit of others and doing so in a healthy and positive manner”.

What We Need & What You Get

  1. Winter is coming and because of how are restaurant is set-up (seating arrangements are out side and exposed to nature and the elements) it will make it impossible for people to enjoy their dinning experience, for it gets brutally cold with the winds coming from the Ramon crater “Makhtesh” during the winter months. Closing is not an option, but expansion and renovation of the area is, but it comes with a hefty cost that has put my family at a temporary financial stand still.
  2. We always look to elevate our level of service by supplying our customers with the best. A portion of our menu is based upon an oil free concept but we want to take it a step further by incorporating dishes that are gluten free, and also present uncooked “raw” dishes as well. In order to do so special equipment and ingredients would need to be purchased and in a couple of instances imported into the country.
  3.   Giving our name “Vegan Xpress” we strive to serve our customers as quick as possible. Being that my husband and I are the only ones handling taking orders, making the foods/drinks, serving, and cleaning, at some point that quick service ends up being a much longer wait than expected. We wanted to first hire a chef that could help me push the food out much quicker and help in the creation/elevation of healthier dishes to provide for our customers. We found the perfect person for the job! Meenkah Fowler single mother of three is also vegan and already knows how to work with me (she was my sous chef at Ramon Smart Hotel for 2 years) and working under pressure is her specialty. I promised her that if I ever opened my own restaurant that she had to be on my team but I also wanted to make sure that she would be paid accordingly so financially it wouldn’t become a burden on her as she takes care of her 3 young boys. A portion of these funds will be going to a couple months salary for this amazing young woman that I know will help me succeed in this business. By adding more members to our team ensures that we can keep up with supply and demand meaning we will be able to extend work days and hours!

We are ready to move forward with our restaurant immediately, but we need your help. I am turning to you in order to raise $55,000. This start-up capital is going to cover the costs of renovation, help us buy much needed equipment/ingredients, marketing, salary coverage for hiring greatly need staff, and operating Vegan Xpress in general, making the vegan lifestyle more sustainable, comfortable and enjoyable for Mitzpe Ramon at least!  

Here is a list as to where the money raised will help go towards:

Meat/Cheese Slicer: $1080 for slicing our signature meat/cheese alternatives ultra thin

Wood-Fired oven: $2000 for baking pizzas

Industrial Food Processor: $1500

Industrial blender: $1300

Industrial Air Fryer: $2700

Tortilla Press/Maker  $89.99 (for making gluten free flatbreads)

Refrigeration $2,500

Back-up Generator $2700 (we live in the middle of nowhere and when winter hits it tends to wipe out the electricity).

Deep Freezers $2,500

Industrial Post & Pans and serving plates/utensils $2500(for catering up to 100 people)

Website design and marketing $350

Salary coverage for staff member (for first 6 months) $6400

Food Truck: $15550 (importation) to be used to serve neighboring kibbutzs  twice a week (again there is no vegan restaurant within a 70 km/43 miles radius)

Expansion/Renovation/$13830 (also includes fees associated with expansion via the “city hall” municipality standards)

In return for your support here are some awesome perks you will receive:

*Everyone that donates name will be carved on a handmade wooden plank that will be placed on our wall for all to see. 

$20
Social Media Recognition  (from donations of $1 to $20) & a personal email saying thank you!

$30

Vegan Xpress Discount (from $21 to $49)

A 15% discount off first order at Vegan Xpress + social media recognition

$50

Free Lunch Xpress (from donation of $50 to $100)

Free Sandwich of your choice, fries, Salad, and fruit smoothie + Social Media Recognition

 

$100

Vegan Xpress’s Signature Cashew Cheesecake  (serves 8 people)

 Free signature cheesecake with topping of your choice + Social Media Recognition + 15% discount off first order.

$200

Vegan Xpress’s Signature Bacon-less

 Free Vegan Xpress Signature Slab “homemade vegan bacon” sliced to perfection, which you can cook within the comfort of your home + Social Media Recognition + 15% discount off first order.

$500

Vegan Xpress One-on-One Training

Enjoy 7 private cooking classes that are sure to help you prepare awesome vegan meals that you and your family can enjoy! + social media recognition+ 15% discount off first order

$1000

Vegan Xpress Private Diner for 4
Private dinner for up to 4 people + + social media recognition+ 15% discount off first order + free Xpress cheesecake

$5000

Vegan Xpress Catering Event
A catered event of up to 40 people & social media recognition!!!!!!

 

The Impact

Fortunately for the cities in both central and Northern Israel the high demand for vegan alternative menus can be found just minutes a part from each other. That leisure dwindles quickly the further south you travel, and by the time you reach Mitzpe Ramon it’s little to non-existence.

Mitzpe Ramon is a tourist city thanks to the crater, meaning we can now provide vegan meals for the hundreds of thousands of tourist that pass by our town on a daily bases. We are the only “all vegan” establishment within a 70-km/43 miles radius!

I have over 10 + years of experience in the culinary industry and with that experience I want to provide healthy and tasty options on a universal level.

 

Risks & Challenges

Of course, starting and being able to manage & maintain a restaurant is risky business and challenging, but by being able to provide for our community and tourist from all over, our goal is undoubtedly achievable. We did not wait for this campaign to start to begin our dream of Vegan Xpress. We have used all of what savings we have been blessed with to jumpstart this project and get to the point we are at now. With prior years of experience within the food industry we have the tenacity to do what it takes to ensure that our customers continue to receive nothing less than simply the best here at Vegan Xpress!

 

If we don't reach our monetary goal by the end of this campaign, we will purchase what we can with the funds we raise on a priority basis. And of course, we will continue to work hard to save for the rest so we can actualize our full dream for Vegan Xpress. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that everyone can’t afford to donate monetarily, but hopefully after reading and learning about our campaign it will leave you inspired. We ask that you share our IndieGogo campaign through any social media outlets -- but especially those that allow you to link back to this page! 

You can find us on social media here:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/veganxpress777/

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/veganxpress777/

Twitter: https://twitter.com/beautifulsong77 

Thank you to all whom have helped us and will help us make the dream of Vegan Xpress an unbelievable tangible reality!

story:
NAMASTE!!


My name is Dipak. Y’all might know me as the guy behind the Whip In. For 11 years, I worked to make a beer & food mecca where people could gather and be happy. My mom and pop still own that business, but recently I left there to do my own thing.


I’ve always dreamed of having my own food truck and brewery, and now is the time to make that happen. By starting this food truck, I can also gather seed funds for the restart of my award winning brewery Kamala Gardens (GABF Gold 2013; World Beer Cup Silver 2014).


LOTUS JOINT (www.lotusjoint.com) will present tacos con chutney using local seasonal and organic ingredients from folks like Windy Hill Foods for goat, Richardson's Farms for pork, Bastrop Cattle Company for beef, Coyote Creek Farm for eggs, Johnson’s Backyard Garden for veggies and more. I’ll be making my own awesome and unique chutneys to pair with the meats and veggies. Vegetarian, vegan, and gluten free options available!  


The Lotus Joint food truck will be parked at Independence Brewing Company, offering tasty tacos alongside Indy’s wonderful taproom and music program so y’all can abide. I’m excited to be able to collaborate with Independence until Kamala Gardens can open its doors at a permanent location, which will be determined soon.


To get this food truck operational, I need some money of course. I already have a great truck named El Jefe, but it needs kitchen equipment. I shopped for months for the right configuration and setup only to be disappointed by what’s out there. Designing and building this truck myself will enable me to be efficient and fast for your taco needs as you quaff pints of beer.


So please help me with the LOTUS JOINT fundraising campaign! Each of the different levels offer you rewards, plus of course the chance to eat tacos con chutney and help bring my beers back to Austin. My goal of $42K will help build a fantastic kitchen that over time will generate the funds I need to ultimately restart Kamala Gardens.

Thank you in advance. I hope to see y’all at the opening party in early Fall of 2016.

story:
Finding food that's good for you and good for farms, farmers and livestock should be easy, but it's not.

Sadly if you look at the Australian Food Landscape, towering over the top of everybody are a handful of big hairy supermarket chains. They are gigantic and like playground bullies, they use their size to get their own way.


This environment is forcing the small family farmer out of business. In favour of factory farms that sacrifice quality and welfare over price, presentation and production.


It Doesn't Have To Be This Way

Pigs Run Wild is a Seriously Free Range Food Network. We use technology and people power to connect concious consumers, free range farmers and discerning stockists with High Welfare Free Range Pork and Chemical Nitrate Free Smallgoods.


Time To Make A Change

As people who care about where their food comes from, whats in it and how its grown, we can no longer sit on our hands.

We can't wait for government or big business to fix this mess.


It's time to make a stand for the food and farms we all deserve.


Why Pigs Run Wild Is Crowdfunding

Our little human powered network has the power to do a lot of good. In fact it already has.

We have a cluster of small family owned farms from Byron Bay to Canberra. Each one of them growing pigs the way nature intended, foraging and feeding in the paddock and in the sunshine.

We want to keep growing, and help more farmers, more small foodie businesses and more Australian households.

However growing a Seriously Free Range Food Network is seriously hard on our piggy bank.

Our approach is not favoured by banks or venture capitalists, and to be quite honest this needs to be a people's movement. 

Investment from the top end of town may be a significant factor in forcing production models that don't serve us as a whole. 

So we're turning to Indiegogo, partnering up with our stockists and supporters and hosting a celebration of good food and good farming. 

Sure we hope to grow our network adding more consumers, more stockists, more farms and more pigs as a result of the exercise.

However this is as much about allowing people to acknowledge the need for change as anything else. 


It's time for a Free Range Food Revolution!

So What's In It For The Backers

Let's start with the fact all backers get immediate life membership to the Pigs Run Wild Cartel. 

You'll be an insider and you've helped to steer agriculture in a better direction

Our perks boast a range of goodies including;
  • Swag (in the form of Pigs Run Wild trucker caps), 
  • Food (amazing cured meats and bacon), 
  • Experiences - we have some of the best restaurants in Australia serving our pork and we've teamed up with 11 of the finest, to offer you an incredible Nose to Tail Suckling Pig and Wine Degustation.
So check out the perks and show your support by pledging and sharing this campaign.

Suckling Pig And Wine Dégustation Venues

Please note the only way to get into one of these dinners to pledge. You can't book at the restaurant.

story_txt:
Finding food that's good for you and good for farms, farmers and livestock should be easy, but it's not.Sadly if you look at the Australian Food Landscape, towering over the top of everybody are a handful of big hairy supermarket chains. They are gigantic and like playground bullies, they use their size to get their own way.This environment is forcing the small family farmer out of business. In favour of factory farms that sacrifice quality and welfare over price, presentation and production.

It Doesn't Have To Be This Way
Pigs Run Wild is a Seriously Free Range Food Network. We use technology and people power to connect concious consumers, free range farmers and discerning stockists with High Welfare Free Range Pork and Chemical Nitrate Free Smallgoods.

Time To Make A Change
As people who care about where their food comes from, whats in it and how its grown, we can no longer sit on our hands.
We can't wait for government or big business to fix this mess.
It's time to make a stand for the food and farms we all deserve.
Why Pigs Run Wild Is Crowdfunding
Our little human powered network has the power to do a lot of good. In fact it already has. We have a cluster of small family owned farms from Byron Bay to Canberra. Each one of them growing pigs the way nature intended, foraging and feeding in the paddock and in the sunshine.
We want to keep growing, and help more farmers, more small foodie businesses and more Australian households.

However growing a Seriously Free Range Food Network is seriously hard on our piggy bank.

Our approach is not favoured by banks or venture capitalists, and to be quite honest this needs to be a people's movement. Investment from the top end of town may be a significant factor in forcing production models that don't serve us as a whole. So we're turning to Indiegogo, partnering up with our stockists and supporters and hosting a celebration of good food and good farming. Sure we hope to grow our network adding more consumers, more stockists, more farms and more pigs as a result of the exercise.However this is as much about allowing people to acknowledge the need for change as anything else. It's time for a Free Range Food Revolution!
So What's In It For The Backers

You'll be an insider and you've helped to steer agriculture in a better direction
Our perks boast a range of goodies including;

Food (amazing cured meats and bacon),

story:
A SIMPLE WAY TO MAKE A DIFFERENCE

Your contribution will help us:

  • Launch and fund the initial operations of Little Middle Market; and
  • Increase access to convenient, healthier food options to underserved communities in LA striving to adopt and maintain a healthy mind, body and spirit.

 

Our plan is to take a phased approach to open and accelerate the growth of our business with our community as the focus.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Phase 1: The results of our survey indicate a strong desire for fresh produce, coffee, pastries and grab-and-go items. To fund this initial phase and address these immediate needs, we intend to raise $90K to begin operations with a budget projected as follows:

 

 

OUR STORY

After moving to the Leimert Park area in 2013, the scarcity of sustainably-produced foods and products became a harsh reality for our family. While our local big-chain grocery stores provided a meager organic produce section and a few other health-conscious items, we quickly discovered they lacked substantial variety.

 

Traveling considerable distances out of our way for healthier food options has become the norm for us, as well as many other families in the neighborhood. A family of three with both parents employed outside the immediate area, we relied on shopping at stores along our commute to purchase healthy items we needed. We would make special trips to various farmers markets to find the fresh and organic produce, meats/poultry and seafood that were not stocked in the grocery stores closest to us.

Our passion for food, background in sales and marketing, and love for community have compelled us to open Little Middle Market. In Spring 2016, we began developing a strategic plan to launch Little Middle Market to meet a very obvious need of our neighborhood and surrounding community: a place to access fresh, local produce, artisanal foods and a coffee shop within walking distance from home.

We surveyed members of our community to determine if they shared our vision and would support a small specialty grocery market in the community. The response was overwhelmingly positive:

  • all respondents are in favor of opening a place like Little Middle Market
  • the vast majority currently share very similar, challenging and inconvenient shopping experiences
  • there is an absolute need for Little Middle Market.

 

We appreciate your consideration and grateful for your contribution, as it represents your belief our vision.

story:
Dawn of a New Day

A few years ago, I thought about my personal values and how well they aligned with my career and work experiences. I realized they were not aligned and I wanted to do something about it. With a lifetime passion for fitness, health, and nutrition, I have always read, researched, and attended related conferences and events. When I had some recent down time, I went through a period of additional discovery taking me to this endeavor.

It was during this time I developed an awareness of the various challenges as it relates to healthy eating habits. It is more than reading a food product label or knowing what a macronutrient is. Skimming the list, there are food politics, food policies with agendas, GMO vs. non-GMO, natural and artificial ingredients, the sugars - cane, corn, beet, physiological reactions to the body when certain foods or artificial ingredients are entered into the body, and the list goes on. 

In more recent times, Whole Foods Market and Sprouts have developed a more wholesome approach to the supermarket food channel and likewise with the proliferation of healthier for you food concepts in Home Meal Replacements (HMRs) and Fast Casual.(Snap Kitchen, MyFit Foods, The Protein Bar).

But what about the time starved customer? The on-the- go mom with her child needing a healthy alternative without stopping for long or the businessman that does not need to be tempted to buy unhealthy, quick, grab and go snacks at the corner store?

Water Elephant provides a healthy solution to convenient, grab-and-go snack food and beverages. With discovery, development, and now the first implementation phase, Water Elephant is Crowd Funding a new, bricks and mortar, food and beverage retail business. 

While this is a “for profit” endeavor, my desire is to not only offer a better solution for healthy- on the go food and beverages, but be a conduit for transparency, education, and resources in better for you options. All of this will be built Community inclusiveness in mind.

Support for this project will help bring to fruition a business concept that is viable and yet, will be very impactful upon community. Opening the first store will allow a laboratory to test product ideas, operational procedures, and the business model, then ramp up for a rollout of additional stores.

Due to the level of my experience, the risks and challenges are not foreign to me. 

What we need 

As we get closer to signing a lease for the first location, the two most pressing needs are build-out and equipment funds. With an additional $50,000 Water Elephant will be in position to open it's lab store. 

You will be rewarded for your investment with generous access to Water Elephant branded product. If you do not live in the Austin area, you may be more interested in the Limited Edition t-shirts, keychains, and more. 

You Can Help

Do you believe in Water Elephant's mission? Do you want a front row seat watching the next great food and beverage concept come to life before your eyes. Because of you, and others like you, Water Elephant will be a success. 

1. Take a moment to pick a reward level and invest in Water Elephant now.

2. No matter if you participate, please, pass onto family, friends, business associates, anyone you know or acquainted with. Think! You know someone that would be interested in seeing this.

3.  Also ask these folks to continue passing onto their connections. 

4. Post on shared social media.

5. There are Indiegogo tools that make it easy to share.

FAQs

1. What happens to my investment if your full amount is not funded at Indiegogo?

Water Elephant will use the available Indiegogo funds and use other capital resources to complete the project. 

2. If not fully funded, what happens to my reward?

All merchandise related rewards have been budgeted and staged for order whenever the campaign ends.

3. What happens if my reward is tied to Water Elephant branded products?

These rewards can be collected only when the store opens. Recognizing the risk, in most cases, the rewards retail value is more than the actual paid in amount.

4. What will you do with investment amounts that are over the campaign goal?

Currently, Water Elephant is a boot strap start up. "Additional" funds would help polish the new Lab Store and provide cash flow dollars.

Let's Make This Happen!

Questions / Comments? 

rob@waterelephant.com

story:
About the Mission & Philosophy

 

We specialize in caring for veterans naturally with issues such as skin cancer, chronic urticaria (developed after serving in the Persian Gulf, Kosovo, Panama City, Libya, Afghanistan, and Iraq wars), severe rosacea reddening, psoriasis, eczema, hyperpigmentation, hyperhidrosis (body produces excessive sweating), epidermal cysts, papulosquamous disorder, severe acne vulgaris, and other chronic undiagnosed skin disorders during their long military career that spanned from wartime conditions returning burned, scarred and disheartened.  

 

Several years ago I began caring for veterans bringing to them custom formulas for FREE that avoided ingredients of; parabens, sodium lauryl sulfate, and formaldehyde-releasing preservatives. 

One day, I was at the local market, when a veteran past me.  This veteran skin was in such a dire condition I asked him to stop by my office so I could examine him.   This veteran lacked transportation but had a telephone, so I went to him.  Unfortunately, he was sleeping under the bridge; this was shameful.  I brought my bag of goodies which included the Veterans Deserve Healthy Skin kit and asked him to try something I had formulated; he did.  

Within two weeks he found my office to show me his results, after reviewing his case he was supplied for free. What brought awareness to me was how appreciative this warrior was that someone addressed his problem with care.  Moreover, it was explained to my new-found friend, my hands were here to help people.  Furthermore, he was educated about environmental hazards and chemicals men and women are exposed to during active duty that causes many skin disorders. Often, veterans live under harsh conditions, leaving them homeless and unable to obtain care from their VA hospitals, so special care has been taken to simplify any veteran daily routine; by creating an all-in-one, hair and body cleanse system rich in soothing and nourishing botanicals.

 

What We Avoid In Our Veterans Blend
No Parabens
No Sodium Lauryl Sulphate (SLS)
Use Of Natural Preservative
Environmentally Friendly
No Animal Testing
Baby Safe

What We Need

  1. The money we've invested to develop and produce each prototype gets us 23% there. We need YOU to get us across the finish line!
  2. Our campaign is for $62,000 - that will fund to manufacture in bulk and distribute the Veterans Deserve Healthy Skin kits to our Veterans for FREE.
  3. We have a listing of the organizations so feel free to request the listing.
  4. For your contributions, you'll be rewarded with valuable and exciting perks for your $5, $10, $50, and $100 donations.
  5. All funds that are raised will go directly to the purchase all development supplies for giving away free to veteran organizations.
  6. With the funding the Veterans Deserve Healthy Skin kits' production will take approximately thirty days; shipping out immediately for FREE.

 

The Impact 

To benefit our heroes, Skin Protocol™ will provide natural, organic,

safe, effective and non-toxic ingredients in each blend. 

** Organic Ingredients
Hemp **
Grape Seed **
Avocado Oil **
Shea Butter**
Aloe Vera **
Proprietary Blend ***

  1. Independent case studies have shown the use of hemp, chamomile, aloe vera, sweet almond and sunflower oils that are cold pressed was found to repair, condition and replenish irritated skin. Additional properties of shea butter and vitamin e make our veterans blend a great skin rejuvenator while increasing skin's flexibility and hydration.
  2. Skin Protocol™ avoids potential carcinogenic ingredients.
  3. Skin Protocol™ uses only a balanced approach - not extreme.
  4. Skin Protocol™ has an excellent karma while each product is being poured and packaged.  5. Sending love and help to every veteran in need. 

 

 

PRODUCTION & GIVING VALUES

1. Our production of the Veterans Deserve Healthy Skin kits will be given to verified Veteran facilities to distribute to every veteran entering their facility seeking housing, medical care, and any transitional essential needs.  


2. All massive productions of the Veterans Deserve Healthy Skin kits will be given to confirm veteran organizations that genuinely care about whom they service, by using most of their funding to offer programs to veterans entering their facility seeking housing, medical care, and any transitional essential needs. In addition, the organization should use minimum funds toward the administrative cost to qualify, for every FREE shipment.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please use our Indiegogo share tools to share this campaign with your family and friends; especially if they have a Veteran in their life who could benefit from our products. Remember, we want to give our quality skincare products to deserving veterans for free! You can help us make that happen simply by sharing our link. 

If you are able to donate even a small contribution, you will help us reach our goal. Every dollar we receive will go towards manufacturing a bottle of our botanically-based, all natural products to give to our veterans.

Give thanks to your veterans today by supporting our campaign. Thank you.

story:
Local press:

***SATURDAY 17TH SEPTEMBER 2-5PM***
"The Sustainable Living Fair is on a mission to educate and inspire! Learn how to upcycle textiles, jewellery and furniture, gain knowledge on growing and cooking your own vegetables. Come and find out about environmental and community projects in your local area that you can take part in and of course, don't forget to bring all your unwanted clothes, shoes, bags and jewellery for SWISHING!!!. Buy sustainable products that have been created and produced in the local area and enjoy refreshments from the venue café. Brighthelm in central Brighton is a sustainable venue and welcomes you as the host for this event. To be involved as a stall holder or guest speaker, call 07814736486 or email jo.dickens@discerningevents.co.uk"

I started my business, Discerning Events two years ago with a passion for providing events that make a difference. Two years ago I designed and executed a swishing (ethical clothes swapping) event that was oversubscribed and it got me thinking about how passionate people are about upcycling and recyling the posessions that they already own and the passion that people have for reducing landfill, but perhaps needing further advice on how to live more sustainably. This got me thinking also about other areas of sustainability and in turn grew my desire to create the Sustainable Living Fair.

Big Brighton Swish February 2014

The Sustainable Living Fair will have stall holders from local retailers of recycled, hand made, locally sourced goods. Guest speakers will give talks on growing and cooking vegetables, renovated furniture, local environmental community projects. The venue even prides itself on being a sustainable venue.

This event will provide a platform for local providers who are passionate about sustainability to spread the word and raise awareness for their own company profiles. Staff will be employed for this providing a unique employment opportunity, both with this monthly event and subsequent events provided by Discerning Events.

The funding I am hopeful to raise will contribute towards:

  • venue hire for the first event
  • flyer printing and distribution
  • purchase of clothes rails and hangers plus six months storage fees
  • local advertising

Individuals contributing to this project will receive:

£5 = Free entry.

£50 = Free entry to the event and a meal voucher to redeem at the event.

£100 = Free entry and meal vouchers for three events.

£150+ = Free entry and meal vouchers for three event plus your name listed as a gold member contributor on Discerning Event website and publications.

Businesses contributing will receive the same perks listed above for one individual plus contributions of £100+ will have their company log included on all marketing materials for the event as a valued sponsor.

Contributing to the success of this event means that you share the same passion as me for sustainable living and from the bottom of my heart, I sincerely thank you in advance. In addition to financial contributions, I wholeheartedly welcome advice and suggestions so please feel free to contact me.
story_txt:
Local press:***SATURDAY 17TH SEPTEMBER 2-5PM***"The Sustainable Living Fair is on a mission to educate and inspire! Learn how to upcycle textiles, jewellery and furniture, gain knowledge on growing and cooking your own vegetables. Come and find out about environmental and community projects in your local area that you can take part in and of course, don't forget to bring all your unwanted clothes, shoes, bags and jewellery for SWISHING!!!. Buy sustainable products that have been created and produced in the local area and enjoy refreshments from the venue café. Brighthelm in central Brighton is a sustainable venue and welcomes you as the host for this event. To be involved as a stall holder or guest speaker, call 07814736486 or email jo.dickens@discerningevents.co.uk"I started my business, Discerning Events two years ago with a passion for providing events that make a difference. Two years ago I designed and executed a swishing (ethical clothes swapping) event that was oversubscribed and it got me thinking about how passionate people are about upcycling and recyling the posessions that they already own and the passion that people have for reducing landfill, but perhaps needing further advice on how to live more sustainably. This got me thinking also about other areas of sustainability and in turn grew my desire to create the Sustainable Living Fair.Big Brighton Swish February 2014The Sustainable Living Fair will have stall holders from local retailers of recycled, hand made, locally sourced goods. Guest speakers will give talks on growing and cooking vegetables, renovated furniture, local environmental community projects. The venue even prides itself on being a sustainable venue.This event will provide a platform for local providers who are passionate about sustainability to spread the word and raise awareness for their own company profiles. Staff will be employed for this providing a unique employment opportunity, both with this monthly event and subsequent events provided by Discerning Events.The funding I am hopeful to raise will contribute towards:
venue hire for the first event
flyer printing and distribution
purchase of clothes rails and hangers plus six months storage fees
local advertising
Individuals contributing to this project will receive:£5 = Free entry.£50 = Free entry to the event and a meal voucher to redeem at the event.£100 = Free entry and meal vouchers for three events.£150+ = Free entry and meal vouchers for three event plus your name listed as a gold member contributor on Discerning Event website and publications.Businesses contributing will receive the same perks listed above for one individual plus contributions of £100+ will have their company log included on all marketing materials for the event as a valued sponsor.Contributing to the success of this event means that you share the same passion as me for sustainable living and from the bottom of my heart, I sincerely thank you in advance. In addition to financial contributions, I wholeheartedly welcome advice and suggestions so please feel free to contact me.

story:
Welcome to Our Adventure!  We invite you to join us in our quest to start a local Craft Distillery in Tempe, Arizona.  Our spirits will be made by hand in small batches, using our hand-fabricated all-copper stills and brewing equipment.  Starting with only grain and water (we pledge never to use Neutral Grain Spirits in our process), we’ll craft whiskey and spirits that bring the character of Arizona to your drink!  

Our Team

I’m Steve Lemke and together with my partners, Kelly Lattig, and Jeff Reisinger, we are Adventurous Stills.  Our mission is to bring our sense of adventure to distilling whiskey and spirits with flavors you’ll love.  We became friends while enjoying adventures in Arizona – hiking, backpacking, climbing and biking, to name a few.  We also enjoyed making homebrewed beer.  One day we decided to see if we could take our fun a step further and turn beer into whiskey.  One thing led to another, and here we are – about to open our own local Craft Distillery!

Our Adventure

Our whiskey is made slowly using copper pot stills, which develop deep rich nuances and full-grain flavors that continuous-flow stills used by large distillers strip out.  They compromise to increase profits and efficiency at the cost of flavor and character—we do not!   We have custom designed and hand-crafted both of our 100% copper stills.  We have taken the time to truly understand the science of distilling.   Our design ensures that our whiskey retains the character, depth, and richness you expect from a handcrafted whiskey.  And we didn’t stop with the stills.  Each grain used in the making of whiskey has its own unique character and flavor.  The main ingredients; barley, corn, wheat, and rye are great on their own or mixed together.  We go beyond the usual and experiment with toasted wheat, crystal malted barley, red rye, chocolate malts, and “heritage grains” such as spelt, farrow, millet, quinoa, etc.  The possibilities are endless, as is the Adventure.

Join Us

Our distillery is fully self-financed and we have no debt.  Each partner has already contributed enough funds to get our business rolling including all our equipment, licensing fees, initial raw materials, site improvements, and rent.  As soon as our distillery is up and running, we plan to ‘lay up’ as much whiskey as we can in oak casks to begin the aging process.  All of the funds collected from our Indiegogo campaign will be used to distill more whiskey.  Your dollars will help to create more great handcrafted whiskey for you to enjoy!

Perks

Come visit us.  Take a tour of our facility, and enjoy a taste of the whiskey you helped make. Since whiskey takes some time to develop its full flavor, we will only be sampling ‘white’ spirits for the first few months – Gin, Vodka, and Rum.  You are welcome to wait until our whiskey is ready to cash in on your Perks.  Watch our website to see when the whiskey will be ready.  Feel free to stop by and check in on us anytime before then as well.  Hold on to your Certificate and be one of the first to kick off Adventurous Stills.  Look for the Perks that entitle you to free Tastings in our Tasting Room when the doors open (targeting November, 2016).  

 Be Adventurous

                                                Drink Adventurous

story:
Helping Us Help Cambodia

Be part of our project to help us help Cambodia by retaining agricultural profits in Cambodia, by introducing high paying skilled jobs for Cambodians, and by introducing a whole new industry (craft distilling) and vastly improving old ones (e.g. palm sugar processing).

A Brief History

I conceived this idea in 2005 while attending a wine class at Clear Creek Distillery in Portland, Oregon.  After trying their amazing pear brandy, and talking to Dennis McCarthy - a legendary figure in the craft distilling industry - I realized all I needed was the right place for the fruit, and the right person for a partner !

Flash to 2013 - while visiting Cambodia to attend a wedding, I met RJ, my Cambodian partner. While drinking a bottle of pear brandy I had brought with me, we discussed mangoes and other tropical fruits.  RJ is not only a US college graduate - he has his own mango and fruit farms in Cambodia.  And most importantly, he has a strong drive to help his fellow Cambodians and to help develop his native country.

What we've done

By 2014 we had begun perfecting our recipes with a small still, and by 2015 had formed our company.  In 2016, we brought in a professional US distiller from Portland, Oregon to begin employee training.  We have partnered with a major US importer of craft spirits and US distributor.  We are now near completion of our building, and we are in the process of importing commercial craft distilling equipment from around the world.

What we Need

We've had a  500 liter copper still custom built in China by a leader in craft distilling equipment.  We need an additional $19,375 to pay off the balance, ship, and install it in our new building in Sihanoukville Province, Cambodia.  There is nothing like it in Cambodia; and will allow us to immediately begin full production of our mango and cashew fruit brandies, as well as our palm sugar rhum.

Invest in our project and receive some of our unique and exclusive Cambodian perks !

The Impact

Cambodia is a third world country, but is rich in agricultural products. Most of these are not yet processed in Cambodia.  Because of the lack of infrastructure, they are shipped to Thailand or Vietnam, where the bulk of the profits go.  Bayon Distillery - a Cambodian company - is not only adding brand new infrastructure to Cambodia, it is retaining the profits in Cambodia as well.  

Some of the profits will go to employees paid well above the national rate for factory or agricultural workers; and the rest will go to future infrastructure projects, such as a cashew processing plant.

Risks & Challenges

Although we have proofed (sorry !) many of our ideas, concepts, and recipes over the last 3 years, we have not operated at full scale yet.  And although our spirits have been beta tested repeatedly through multiple tastings, there is no guarantee that they will be accepted by the US market.  Mangoes, palm sugar, tamarind, mangosteen .... they are all exotic fruits that relatively few Americans have tried.  But we think it is the very exotic nature of Cambodia's fruits and spices that will be it's biggest draw !

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Give us your email address and the State or Country you live in, so that we can notify you as soon as our product is available near you.
  • Get the word out !  Even if you can't contribute, you may have friends of family that can.
  • Like us on Facebook - and get both our name, brand, and website to all of your friends !

story:
A Little About Us

We, Young and Michal Bennett, are devoted partners, both in life and as owners of Coffee Roboto. We love coffee and bikes, work hard, and don’t take anything for granted. With our little mobile venture, we want to bring a connective coffee experience to our city and culture. Plain and simple, we will brew good coffee, promote sustainability and fair trade, and give back to our community.

With a customized coffee tricycle that is being designed and built for us by Haley Tricycles in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, we will pedal to set locations around town, park, and serve cold and hot coffee. We are also making our own syrups, sodas and chai. And then, one day soon, we will rule the world.

What We Need & What You Get

We have paid the deposit on our tricycle, and it is scheduled to arrive in July. We have also gathered some of the equipment and supplies that we need, taken care of the required licenses, and set up contracts with our vendors, suppliers, and locations. Here are a few things we still need in order to get brewing and on the road. 

·      Trike Expenses – build out, sink, umbrella, bike hardware, storage, signage, menu board

·      Brewing & Storage Equipment – coffee bean canisters, water canisters, cold bags, refrigerator, miscellaneous brewing equipment

·      Startup Expenses – coffee, chai, milk, shrub ingredients, syrup ingredients, cups, lids, water, etc. 

·      Other Expenses – marketing expenses, crowdfunding fees, perk costs, etc.

The Perks

We have put together a variety of coffee-related and locally-crafted gifts to thank you for your generosity. Pictured below are the You Can Do It Kit ($500 pledge),  the limited edition 8-ounce mug handcrafted by Chris Kelsey at Trackside Studio in Spokane, WA (each will be unique - $100 Pledge), and the Card Co Lab letterpress coffee card ($15 pledge and up). We hope you find each reward as rewarding as we do!

If We Don't Reach Our Goal

If we don’t reach our entire goal, we will first put funds towards paying for the tricycle itself and the components needed to finish out the build when it arrives. We will then start with serving at just a few locations until we are able to fund more service.

Making a Difference

We have spent the past year serving great coffee, seasonal handmade shrub sodas, and chai at our monthly Pop Up Cafes in Coeur d’Alene and Post Falls. Anyone who knows us – and the Robot – knows that we love coffee and bicycles. With our tricycle, we will continue our dedication to serving simple coffee drinks, supporting local and sustainable living, and bringing a fresh experience to our community.

Risks & Challenges

In starting our mobile coffee business a year ago, we had no delusions about the risks and challenges we would encounter. It has been a thrilling time of growing and developing. Of course, we still worry about failure, rejection, and profitability. We definitely have our doubts and insecurities! But we will continue to put ourselves out there and discover the possibilities of our dream.

Our promise to you is that we will provide first-rate customer service and the most exceptional cup of coffee we can conceive. We will lose sleep over the best brew methods and the next best coffee roast we can find. And we will work hard to answer your questions, remember your drink and sincerely serve each and every person who chooses Coffee Roboto.

Other Ways You Can Help

  1. Put your money where your zip code is. Support local business.
  2. Put your posts where your friends live. Invite ALL your Facebook Friends to like our Facebook Page. And share our Indiegogo link with ALL your Facebook friends.
  3. Hashtag the #heckyeahcoffeeroboto out of us.

 

Thank You to Our Partners

Coup de Grace Films

DOMA Coffee Roasting Company

Coeur d'Alene Bike Company

Dr. Jeff Larson

Chris Kelsey Ceramics

Kitchen Engine

Card Co Lab

Mountain Madness Soap Company

Vinyl Fire Printing

AHA Creative

Typebee Letterpress Printshop

Camille Schmidt, Our Social Media Queen

Pilgrim's Market

Slate Creek Brewing Co.

Sweet Peaks Ice Cream

Pepe Caldo Pizzeria

story:
My name is Lisa McFadin, and I am the founder of Duvin.  That's a title, but the truth is the community is the founder of Duvin.  There have been so many people that continue to support this endeavor on a daily basis, that I can't keep track.  This has definitely become a cooperative, and without you, Duvin would be just another idea.

In order to move to the next level, a few things have to happen.  We need capital.  I have been working a few jobs in order to sustain this business, and bring it to where we are now.  But now I need to focus, and create the foundation by success.  Not by working night and day, but by asking for capital, and doing it the right way.  We've been here for 13 months through blood, sweat and tears.  Please help me make this happen. 

We are not asking for a lot, but we do need some equipment, we need to clear some vendor accounts, and we need to have a capital supply to staff the kitchen for 6 months.  If you can't contribute money, can you contribute time or equipment?  We will take it all.

With much gratitude,

Lisa McFadin

story:
Like many of our fellow bitcoin/cryptocurency miners out there, we too have been bamboozled by Hashocean. Given the fact that many of these cloud mining companies are basically Ponzi schemes, or offer a really low return, we have decided that it is best not to give credence to these surreptitious operations and venture into starting a company of our own.
Let me begin by saying that we are family folk...Everyday people trying to make ends meet and invest for the future. We believe in integrity and treating others the way you want to be treated. With that in mind, our vision is to create a safe haven for all of us to mine, with a company that is completely transparent and run honestly. We have the technological expertise to make this happen, but lack the funding to see it come to fruition. This is where you come in.... 
Alot of us are irate from being hoodwinked and are disheartened and frustrated with all the charlatan and sham cloud mining companies out there. Here's your chance to take the bull by the horns and make that change. We realize that a lot of people have lost hundreds, thousands and even millions of their hard earned dollars because of Hashocean. We do not expect anyone to make a hefty donation.... Even a mere dollar, or two would be greatly appreciated. The idea is to get as many people as possible on the bandwagon and to donate to this cause. Together, we can make this a reality.
Feel free to repost and share this with friends and family, as well as fellow miners and anyone who believes in what we're trying to achieve. Help us help you, by helping us reach our goal, so that we may all reap the rewards of mining with peace of mind. 
Thank you.
