2. Our Home Space- a platform for conscious consumptionThe web portal Our Home Space is being set up with this campaign. The goal of the page is to enable us to initiate and/or sponsor community projects that empower locals to improve their lives in parts of the world where we see how we easily, with the help of our allies* can make a positive change in the life of a community.One such easy way is helping to ensure that there is clean water available when most needed.The idea behind Our Home Space is to leverage products for social change. Instead of just asking people to contribute with money for a humanitarian cause, we offer products in return. It's called selling (I believe you have heard about it before). We use sales as a means to stimulate social change by selling things people buy regardless of whether we sell them or not. But by buying it from us, the consumer makes a conscious decision. Conscious Consumption. And to show you how that works we offer perks that match the value of your contribution in this campaign.And of course, we don't just offer any products, but products that are made by brilliant people who have ensured that their production process is not only non-detrimental to our world or the people making them, but that the production and distribution helps workers to better living conditions. We also offer products that are made by communities that have no access to the international market, or any other market for that matter. We also offer products from small scale artisans who either manufacture themselves or work closely with the people making their goods, ensuring that the pay is fair. And by allowing us to sell their products from our platform they are helping our cause.The goal is to offer ecological and ethically produced products that are part of everyday life. We are starting this campaign with clothes and jewelry but will eventually have a wider selection of products.What this means for you, our ally* is that you can rest assured that anything you buy on Our Home Space will benefit people in more than one step of the way from design, production and sales.To make it easier for our allies to be well informed when buying from us you will see what level of social, ethical and ecological consideration the product takes in its creation process and thus you can be better informed in your decision.*Ally – Term that we use for our customers, because based on their/your decision to consume consciously we simply cannot use the old wear and tear term ‘consumer’.back to top3. Our first crowdfunding project - PRODUCTS FOR CLEAN WATERThe first project that we are working on at the moment, this very project that you are reading about here on Indiegogo, is a clean water project in the Brazilian part of the Amazon, on the border of Peru where the Huni Kuin people live.Currently many of the young and old die each rainy season due to drinking and washing themselves with contaminated water. The contamination occurs due to heavy rainfall that stirs up all sorts of debris, feces, dead animals etc. from the ground of the forest and washes it down into the rivers which are the main and only source of water for the tribes living there.We aim to bring at least 40 Lifestraw Family units with us to distribute to families with young children who are in risk of getting sick and dying. One lifestraw family unit can provide a family with 18 000 liters (7 755 gallons) of clean potable water. That is 3 years of water consumption for a family of 5. A second aim is to purify water on site, with locally sourced materials so that they won't be dependent on outsiders buying and bringing filters or purification modules.Also, we will be looking at implementing new ways of making toilets in a way so that they do not overflow and contaminate the rivers during rainy season.This will be achieved through a permaculture initiative that you can read more about by clicking this link.Concept image by Artur Moustafa - Our Home Space.back to top3.1 Aim of the projectThe first aim of the project is to make sure that the people of the tribe have access to clean water to prevent deaths amongst its young population as soon as possible. That’s why the project time is set to 19 days. So that we will have time to go there with LifeStraws in the beginning of the rainy season. The campaign ends on Christmas eve and our hope is that by then we will have good news for the people of the village.(Image from the company behind LifeStraw. As you can see, even here there is an extra benefit baked into your backing, not only do the children in the Amazon get clean water, children in Africa will enjoy the same benefit!)An extension of the first goal with this water project, as mentioned above, is to find many ways to make sure that the tribe has access to clean potable water now and in the future.In addition to the tasks outlined in the permaculture project we will also work with making activated carbon for filters that can be made on site. Experiments with this was started last year and we believe it can be made with lime peel for carbon and lime juice (yes, sounds weird but it works) as the active corrosive ingredient. The reason for using lime is because they grow it around the villages. Activated carbon that has been used in filters can later be mixed with earth and food waste to create terra preta, the most fertile soil to be found. Terra Preta is a possible offshoot benefit of the activated carbon part of the project, as the soil which the tribes use to grow their crops on is poor on nutrients and does not yield for long stretches of time, making the locals have to clear new areas of land with fire for growing crops, a process that releases CO2 into the atmosphere. And we want to keep the trees in the Amazon because of the obvious C02 effect, if for nothing else, as trees transform C02 to oxygen. And creating terra preta actually helps to bind C02 from the atmosphere into the ground. Making terra preta was common practice in the pre-Colombian civilizations of the Amazon and was key to being able to sustain larger communities in the Amazonian jungle.To start the project we will however as stated above, first make sure that we are able to help from day one that we arrive there by buying and bringing award winning Life Straw Family units that can give families with children 18 000 liters of potable water per unit (price €105 per unit). LifeStraw removes virtually all bacteria (99.9999 percent), protozoan parasites (99.99 percent) and viruses (99.999 percent) that can contaminate water. We aim at bringing at least 40 Lifestraws Family units with us. If the funding exceeds our goal then all the better. We will be able to bring more units and have cash with us to sponsor projects that seem to be going in the right direction.We are starting this campaign as a means to collect enough funds for us to be able to go to the Amazon to give this much needed aid and then to start the project of making rainwater harvest and purification units together with the locals in Altamira. Once we have positive test results from our water samples we will be inviting people from other villages to come and learn how to replicate the model. The long term goal with the water project is to find many suitable ways to purify water on site, with local materials. This way we can turn it into a part of the culture, to harvest water and make wells instead of relying on the polluted rivers as the only source of water.If we are able to secure enough funds to secure clean water with this campaign we will go ahead with our next step which aims at eliminating the use of diesel for electricity. And in the long run, eliminate the need for diesel powered motors for their boats, powering them with stored solar energy.Fossil fuels is a trap for these people as it is a cost to transport diesel along the rivers using diesel. And so because of their very limited income, sometimes they are stranded in one place, waiting for someone to earn money so that they can buy fuel. At the moment it is simply not possible for them to save any money at all to buy solar cells/photovoltaic cells, and batteries. That will be the second phase for Our Home Space. Diverting our income towards the placement of solar panels and batteries in the villages. So that they can save their earnings and perhaps buy more solar panels for other villages. After having secured energy through renewable sources we will buy computers, cameras and sound equipment for the school and create a controlled (something with walls) environment where there is both energy and clean water and where those who are sick can get treated without having to be out in the open, not having to worry about poisonous animals and insects. Adjacent to this building we will have another controlled environment, a plant school, so that they can grow crops that normally wouldn’t make it past the sprouting stage outside because of insects and other animals. This stage is to ensure that they have access to food all year round and don’t have to buy this from the outside.If the model we are thinking of for the above mentioned phases work out, we will be able to be part of a movement that can eliminate the use of fossil fuels in the Amazon and allows the tribes to once again be self-sufficient yet connected to the world. Yes, it sounds ambitious, but it can done. But only if someone starts. And luckily, there is a few of us on the ground. And now we are reaching out to You to become our allies.But first, we want to do what we can to prevent deaths among the young population of the Huni Kuin during this and the three coming rainy seasons.back to top4. Other Ways You Can HelpDo you like the idea but can't afford our products? Please share it on social networks.You like the idea but not the products? Buy it for a hippie friend of yours, the will love you!Or simply donate. back to top5. What We Need to make this a realityHere are some more numbers for you to see how your shopping can actually help someone. The campaign is set to flexible funding. This means that even if we don't reach the funding goal we will be able to use what we were able to raise towards implementing our vision. If we miss the goal we will not compromise on the perks that we will send out to our backers but instead we will look at how we can still deliver what we will afford. Regardless of the amount of funds raised 70-75% of the profit will go towards delivering water purification to the Huni Kuin. It is too important to risk not doing just because we might not reach all the way. So since there is a will there is a way.  We set our goal at €26,000.  If we use this as en example for how much funds we will be able to raise then the budget for this project will be as follows:  €12,220 is what it costs for us to buy, pay customs and deliver all the products that we will send to you as tokens of our gratitude. The rest, what comes below is what normally goes as 'profit' when doing the numbers for a regular business, but this is where we show how will spend the money differently than as a regular shop would. €2,970 goes to buying LifeStraw Family units. That gives 40 units each capable of purifying 18,000 liters of water. That is 720,000 Liters of purified water. Enough to get 40 families through this and the coming 3 rainy seasons. But remember. What we are really hoping to accomplish here is to create on site water purification with locally sourced materials that can not only be taught, but also replicated and taught to other villages and tribes. This would ensure clean water for a lot longer than those 40 units can. This alongside with the permaculture initiative will help alleviate living conditions in the area immensely.We will however try to get LifeStraw units cheaper in order to maximise efforts. This might be achieved by selling Lifestraw units on our webpage. Discussions about acting as a retailer of their products have started.€3,826 goes to equipment and sponsoring the permaculture project in the village. More detailed budget found under section 5.1.€3,300 of the total profit goes to travel and transport for Artur, Pia and the Lifestraw units. After all, if we can't go there then we can't deliver the items. They live as far into the Amazon as you can imagine.€2,600 10% of what we are able to raise covers fees for Indiegogo and Paypal.€1,084 is profit. It is for us to cover expenses whilst there in the jungle and to compensate for any loss of income that we would have had if we were not working with this project. It is for us to be able to eat, sleep (in a home) and get about. And it is for building our website and operations.That's 7,87% of the earnings for us. That is a bad business idea if the idea is to become wealthy. But that is not the idea here, so don't worry. The idea is to be able to help. The benchmark number for any charity is to spend less than 33.3% of their total income on anything else than the charitable cause. Well we are pretty proud to say that we are within those limits. However we are not a charity (who knows what we will be in the future) but we are a socially conscious company that uses a pattern that already exists, that almost everyone does (buying goods), and use the profit to fund projects we find worth wile. If we are able to fund the entire project, and get even more funds. Then 20% of that extra income will go towards buying more LifeStraw family units.And another 40% will go to supporting and initiating other projects in the village. Like the Permaculture initiative. We will find a way to get better equipment so that we can make sure that the permaculture project can be implemented faster and perhaps in more places.The remaining 40% will have to go to upscale our operations to be able to handle the new size of the project. Half of the extra income of these 40% will go towards paying hours to consultants or hiring in-house staff. 20% will go to office costs, services etc. and 30% will go to research and development, looking at ways to best fulfil the goals of the organization.back to top5.1. Permaculture"Permaculture is a system of agricultural and social design principles centered on simulating or directly utilizing the patterns and features observed in natural ecosystems. It has many branches that include but are not limited to ecological design, ecological engineering, environmental design, construction and integrated water resources management that develops sustainable architecture, and regenerative and self-maintained habitat and agricultural systems modeled from natural ecosystems."Concept image by Artur Moustafa - Our Home Space.Since it is within our vision and mission to sponsor initiatives and projects that have the same aim as us at Our Home Space, we have partnered with a permaculture initiative that share many goals with us.Thus we will be able to achieve our goals by helping with the funding of ongoing initiatives. Simply put, through collaboration.One such initiative is called PERMACULTURE IN THE VILLAGES. It is currently in need of funding for implementation to be possible. They have however secured funds for salaries and air-plane tickets for 3 out of 4 workers through a yearly festival, the Nixpu Pima festival, where people from outside the forest come and pay a sum to participate with the tribe. This is the very same festival where we will be handing out LifeStraw Family units once our funding goals are achieved.So at the moment we need funds for the fourth worker as well as funds for tools and material for implementation to be possible. Thus we have budgeted €3.850 of our raised funds for tools and materials to complete this project.If we go beyond our funding goals we will also make sure that the fourth worker can get paid, speeding up the process considerably.Click here for a fuller description of the project by Hilas Mariante Al Khouri (to the left on the image below ), from Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. back to top5.2. OpportunitiesWe already have some promising opportunities both when it comes to implementation and expansion.Sponsoring on Photo Voltaic film covered glass panelsWe are currently in discussions with a large supplier of glass for photo voltaic cells on the possibillity of sponsorship by displaying their name and making their products available and known through our implementation phase. The more views we get on the videos we post during implementation, the more likeley we are to get a full sponsorship on this. Expanding to other biotopesWe are in discussions with a Tibetan Buddhist monastery in southern India who are interested in making a transition into self-sustanence so that they can work as a hub for the tibetan community in the region.  back to top6. What is Our Home Space?Our Home Space, is as mentioned above, a platform for conscious consumption with the aim of helping to establish at least one self-sustaining village in the Amazon. Here are our vision and mission statements alongside our business idea.(Concept image depicting Voltaic film covered glass panels on a geodesic dome for a plant school that provides energy and harvests rainwater. Concept image by Artur Moustafa - Our Home Space.)6.1 VisionWe see a possible future where many initiatives and ways of self-sustenance co-exist and learn from each other. We believe that a possible way towards this can be found in using our current system (while it exists) to finance and develop this. So that regardless of whether our outside world stands or not, these places will. And they can have everything they need regardless of our rise or fall. Our vision is to help make sure these places exist in all biotopes.The vision of Our Home Space is that by turning one village in the middle of the Amazon into a self-sustainable village that meets the needs of all of its inhabitants we can find ways to make sure that the model can spread to other villages surrounding it ushering a system with nodes that support each other but that can function by themselves.Once we have found a model that works for the tropical jungle, we will look at other biotopes and how we can achieve self-sufficiency together with the people who live there.e at Our Home Space know that the technology to achieve this exists today. Our vision is that we will aid in finding economic solutions that allows for the distribution of the right solution to the right place so that we all can enjoy our home space. 6.2 MissionThe mission of Our Home Space is to, with the help of our allies*, aid with the development of at least one self-sustaining community that can be said to be outside the global economy.Our mission is to make it in such a way that the model is replicable.We will be working towards ensuring that the following criteria is met in every area where we involve ourselves.
Access to clean potable water
Access to renewable energy
Self-sufficiency in food
A place for learning with access to global communications
A place to be able to produce and sell goods to the global and local market
Our Home Space will share all functional findings and strategies openly, as instruction videos, documentation through text and image, classes and workshops and by offering access to all tools used and developed.6.3 BUSINESS IDEAOur business idea is to supply customers with ethically and ecologically produced goods that we know people consume anyway (because of the set-up of the world economic system), such as, but not limited to, t-shirts, underwear, trousers and socks etc. at competitive prices. We will be retailing both our own brands and those of others who we see fit with the model of Our Home Space.And for us to be able to reach out to as many allies as possible we have tailored our own brand, All is One, to be modest in style, color and prints. Because making a fashion statement isn’t necessarily about what you see on the outside.back to top7. Background
 

 
In October 2014 I, Artur, fell ill with Meningitis and in my search of getting better, after having been met by nonchalance from my doctors, I met someone through a friend. My friend was travelling with a shaman from the Amazon by the name of Ixa. Ixa told me he could help me get well and invited me to come to his village in the Amazon. Having spent three days with him I was not doubting that he could indeed live up to what he had said and so a few months later I found myself on the way to his village.I spent quite some time there, carrying with me my lifestraw to allow me to drink water from the river. I mean this is as deep in the jungle as you can get so there is no infrastructure there to speak of. The rivers are the roads and also the only source of water for these people. Ixa showed me the vast treasures of plant medicines that he has learnt about since he was three years old and with time something miraculous happened. About one year after I had first fallen ill I had my first pain free day.Not only was I free of pain. I had regained the physical and mental strength I once had taken for granted.So here I was. Witnessing the lives of the Huni Kuin tribe from within, hearing Ixa and the other villagers telling me about their lives there.And since the rainy season was approaching, I was informed that 9 children in this village alone had died during the past rainy season. I had my lifestraw, but what did they have? The rivers?Well during the rainy season the entire forest is completely washed over with rain for days on end, bringing with it all sorts of debris, feces, dead animals, bacteria and parasites into the rivers.Ixa told me that one reason for having opened up their lands for visitors, participating in their festival and taking part of their culture and knowledge was because they needed help and were inviting us to come up with ideas to help them. I started thinking about how I could help them realize their goals.I reasoned that it would be better to harvest rainwater before it got in contact with the rivers and so back to my normal self I started designing a rainwater harvesting module that I saw could be done with local materials and implemented on every house.Working conditions were not optimal so I decided to make a workbench to quicken my work as my time there was running out. I promised myself that I would be back to complete my project.That of finding a suitable way to purify water on site with local materials. Something that they themselves could make and integrate into their culture to prevent the deaths of their young and old. The Huni Kuin, as are many inhabitants of the Amazon, are carriers of ancient knowledge that only recently has started to make its entry into western society but with major impact on our quality of life with about 25% of our medicines having their origins in the rainforest.At the same time western society and its needs account for rainforest destruction to such a magnitude that it kills about 137 plant, animal and insect species every day.Most shamans, those who carry the accumulated wisdom of thousands of years of predecessors are over 70 years old and don’t have apprentices. This means that their vast knowledge is slipping out of human consciousness as their way of life gives way to western values, which in the end values the amazon based on timber and mining prices.Before the rainforests covered 14% of the world’s surface it is now down to less than 6%. A trend which simply isn’t sustainable in a world with rising CO2 levels. Today the people of this village go to the nearest village with riverboats run by diesel motors where they besides food, buy more diesel to power generators in their own villages.This means that the little income they have from selling arts and crafts go to waste on fossil fuels further polluting the lungs of the world, not because they want to, but because they are trapped in a system created by others.What struck me when I was there was that all of this is unnecessary. They could easily have everything they need to be self-sufficient with some minor help from the outside. Since they can be considered as living outside the global economic system there is no way for them to buy equipment to make solar powered water wells, solar panels, batteries or anything else needed to become self-sufficient by themselves in enough quantities unless something is changed.And we can do that with them.If their money didn’t have to go to fuel and food grown with pesticides in remote places they would be able to direct that money to a nearby community so that they too would be able to become self-reliant.If they were allowed to reach out to a greater audience with their knowledge, story and craft they would be able to make a living.So in the forest, I did not only think of what I could do, but what other people like me could contribute to in order to make sure that the world will be able to take part of the vast knowledge of the forest. At the moment they are looking for better living conditions. And they are looking at what is close at hand. Whilst in our part of the world we are looking beyond what we have today. There are countless initiatives on making self-sustaining communities in the developed world so there is no doubt that this will be achieved sooner or later.And here it is possible because we operate within the global market. We can afford it. There will be business that find a way to give you free energy because it means that they can place energy producing units on your house and sell the surplus back to the grid. Out there, there is no grid and so there is no money to be made in the same business model.We see many benefits with helping them with their tasks. For starters, losing their way of life will simply be too much of a loss for the world. And so we are looking at non-orthodox economic models to make sure that they can benefit from existing solutions in the world so that the world in turn can gain benefit from their knowledge and a healthy Amazonas for times to come. We are after all one humanity sharing this one world.back to top8. So who am I?I mean, you don't just want your goods but you want to know that we will be able to deliver the project promised, right? Well, here is the good thing about bringing LifeStraw units. Even if my communication and teaching/learning skills are poor, they will still have access to 540,000 liters of purified water!Other than that I(Artur) once started and ran a furniture company called VUJJ. We were awarded and nominated for a few prices, mainly for us putting focus on sustainable and durable production with storytelling. Something that was new in the furniture industry in 2006 when we first started. But then I realized what it really meant for me that there were more chairs in the world than people and so I went on to greener pastures thinking there must be a better cause for me to apply my creativity to. Some of those products are still produced today by rvw.se.Image from part of Vujj's showroom in 2007.I then went to London to work for an NGO, CLEAR-Village, working with developing concepts and methods for rapid project planning and implementation within the field of sustainable urban development.I've been a speaker at various sustainability conferences talking from the perspective of an entrepreneur and designer. One such instance was the Sustainability conference '08 in Malmö hosted by the Centre for Sustainable Design, Farnham, UK. Below is a video with thoughts on sustainable design from 2008, expressed by a young and rather camera shy version of me. After that I used those models when I started working as a project manager at the Helsingborg city Theatre, where I worked with theatre as a tool for achieving social cohesion. Something that also lifted the ticket sales of the theatre. When I started the project sales were hanging around 30% and the image of the theatre in the city was dark. Facts I was oblivious to as I started my outreach project. After my four years at the theatre we were up to over 90% in sales and the project had not only won accolade from the main funders, Region Skåne - Kultur and the Swedish Arts Council, but had also received attention from The European commission who used the project as a best practice project for OMC, Open Method of Communication, a way for member countries to share best practice.Here is a video  of recommendation from my former employer at Helsingborg city Theatre. 
 At the end of my time at the theatre, before becoming the theatre manager at a theatre for children, I helped establish the performing arts biennial Bibu in the town of Helsingborg. After that I worked as a theatre manager at Teater Sagohuset. Unfortunately, during my time there I got an inflammation in either my brain or my spine which left me unable to work for more than a year, struggling with constant pain, fatigue, loss of balance, words and many other abilities. It was during this time that I first met the Huni Kuin tribe, and with their ancient knowledge, I was able to restore my body to a functional state. Here is a link to my design page with CV and reference projects&Here is a link to my personal page.But all of this is what I have done before. Now I have the chance to be the person who brings your help to people who need it. I have been able to accomplish things before, and the reason for this section to be here is for you to have confidence in me being able to accomplish this project as well, but this time, with Your help.And yes, there is a possibillity that the funding goal won't be reached or that the ambitions of helping to make them a self-reliant thriving community won't be reached with the help of this initiative. But I can only see one thing worse than that, and that is not even trying.back to top

story:
Our Story

David and Hillary Chapin have been working on Eagle Pass Camp since 2005, when we first brought the property in Wales, MA. After many years and a lot of hard work, we secured a loan from the SBA and began construction on our campground, set to open in Spring 2017. But we have some expenses not covered by the construction loan: the furniture and incidentals such as paper towels, soap, and various other finishing touches. We want to provide our customers high quality sleeping and storage furniture that's made in the USA and not shipped from overseas. We've identified a supplier in Tennessee who can make what we want for the best price, but we need some help to get there. 

What We Need  

We need to furnish our campsite! All money raised will go to paying for beds, mattresses, tables, and chairs for the camp. The more money we raise, the better quality furniture we can buy -- thicker, nicer mattresses, with nylon coverings rather than vinyl, wooden tables and chairs to put in the cabins.  Any money raised beyond what we need for camp furniture will be used for supplies for the camp: hand soap, paper towels, etc. If we greatly exceed our funding goal, we will be able to cover costs to increase the parking area at the camp. 

What You Get

We're offering a variety of Perks, from small to large, but the biggest reward will be the ability to  touch (and sit and sleep on) your contribution plus the opportunity to see your name displayed as a list of our donors.

The Impact

The LARP community in New England is incredibly large and diverse, and really needs some space in which it can spread its wings. Eagle Pass Camp will help grow the community by providing campsite space year-round,  making it easier to find a time and a location to run your game. We will also be providing a number of services to make running a LARP easier for everyone, and hopefully lowering the barrier to entry for new, first-time, or smaller games to run. 

But to do that we need someplace for everyone to sleep!

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word about this campaign and about Eagle Pass Camp generally! Let your LARP directors know about Eagle Pass. Contact us to schedule a tour! And stay tuned for more information about our progress to camp completion.

story:
Short Summary

  • My name is Micheal Finch, I grew up in the Helena community, I also have ridden BMX since I was 10 years old. I am now 30 years old and still riding BMX. We have had a need for an indoor park every since i can remember. I met Larry in 2011 and was instantly drawn to him as a friend, there was a quality about him that you could just tell that he was a good person. Larry helped bridge the gap between the sports that all use the outdoor skatepark in town. There was no beef between the sports after he came around. Tragically Larry passed away from Cancer. Larry created the Helena Skateboard Academy and was teaching kids of all ages to be respectful action sport athletes, and i would like to continue that here in Helena. 
  • This campaign is to raise funds for the materials needed to build an indoor skatepark in the Helena area. There comes a time every year when the snow starts flying, and we all have to put our skateboards, bikes, scooters, and skates away for 6-8 months. It would be amazing if we had a place where we could ride, and skate year round and not have to travel to warmer areas of the country just to have a good time.
  • In donating you will be helping the Helena Community have something safe for the youth to do, you will be helping these athletes ensure that they can participate in their sports year round. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

  • I am asking for 7,000 dollars for materials cost for the park. All donations will go directly to the purchase of lumber and iron, and all other materials needed for the features to be built. 
  • There will be different perks depending on your donation. From getting your name placed in the park as a donator, all the way up to discounted memberships to the park.
  • If we don't reach our full goal we will still use whatever money to get the park under construction. All the perks will still be the same even if we don't obtain our goal. And if we surpass it we will put all money into the facilities.

The Impact

 

  • My project will be beneficial the the community by providing a safe environment to keep up on their sports, it will help cutdown on the shady stuff that goes down at the outdoor skatepark where there is no monitoring of activities.
  • This is my first go at this type of thing but i believe that the community will see that this is a very needed business for the people of Helena.
  • This will be a BULLY FREE ZONE for Helena.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • For those of you that can't donate please make sure to get word out about this project. SHARE SHARE SHARE SHARE on every platform that you can!

story:
Short Summary
Hi, we are Dima and Daria, and we own a small family business, called Babayevharps. We create musical instruments – jaw harps.

Jaw harps, which we offer as a gratitude for your contribution. You can check the sound of harps here.

Dima started to work with metal in 2003, and he's in love with this craft. Now his instruments live in America, Turkey, Greece, Moldova, Norway, England, Israel, Russia and many other countries. All of the harps he makes are hundred percent handmade work. Dima makes everyting to make his instumetns best quality, he is constantly trying to improve the characteristics of instruments he makes and construct new models. As a proof - his harp has overcome 84 opponents in the Russian Jaw harp Festival, which was held in Moscow on September, and got the highest score. One of instruments made by Dima even was played at the Fougaro Jazz Festival which was in Greece! Daria helps Dima at work, communicates with customers, leads social media and comes up with new creative projects. 

Dima and Daria 


Babayev Jaw harps World

Sometimes things are happening by their own way: we didn't expect that production of these instruments can lead to creation of a new small universe.

Jaw harps have rich history and great cultural value. In traditional society jaw harps were used in religious practices. Archaeologists find harps all over the world. In the Middle Ages and even later these instruments have been spread throughout Russia, India and most of Europe.

We think that it is really great that there is a place for magic in our age of computers, offices and machines. With the sound of a jaw harps music, which was played thousands years ago, rushes through the centuries into the modern world. And it is so easy to play this music by yourself, without practicing or training!  Jaw harp is a simple construction instrument. While playing, person resonates with the instrument and becoming a part of it. This creates special music reality, where there is no place for everyday worries. This way the everyday world becomes full of mysteries and magic, and everyone decides by himself how to interpret this magic. 

One of our jaw harps in a process of creating

 

Our participation in jaw harps worldwide culture 

  • Our main project now is a reconstruction of Russian jaw harps dated XIV - XV centuries. The results of this work are planned to present on the 9th International Congress of jaw harp in Moscow which will be held in the second half of 2017. All results will be  free access after publishing. More information about this project you can ask here, but now it has almost a "secret" mark. 
  • Also we support Russian players competitions and make harps for the winners - we sponsored competitions in 2015 and 2016 years and we are plnning and further encourage jaw harps players! 

 

Our cooperation with artists and designers

We cooperate with young artists and designers, whose view of the world is close to ours. Together we come up with this magical world, and no one knows where this way is going to take us. We are very happy that we can create additional opportunities for young artists, and that our small production gains this friendly family. Our wonderful designers help us develop wonderful stickers with magical creatures, fluffy jaw harps toys and prepare new (secret) projects with us :)

    One of stickers with a creature playing a jaw harp made by russian artist Ivan Khanzhin 

     

    What we are planning to do 

    • To introduce two new beautiful types of polished harps (with different sound characteristics) 
    • To make cheaper the production of some current models 
    • Start to making harps of timascus
    • To concentrate on better sound's and visual quality of the harps  
    • To make more that 10 harps in a month! (The main part of work still will stay handmade, we just want to allow machines to help us)
    • To faster finish the reconstruction of Russian jaw harps dated XIV-XV centuries project

     

    What Do We Need

    Now is the crucial moment in the life of our little studio: growing number of orders requires a new workplace and more productive equipment. All of the collected money will be spent on equipment which is required for work with metal - we need a milling machines, belt grinder, and all sorts of grinding machines, and a good anvil which can help us to perform wide range of works, forge-fire (yes, now we work without it), and muffle furnace. 

     

    Other ways you can help

    We understand that there are plenty of organizations and projects who need monetary support. If you can not give us financial aid, but you want to help our little project, please spread the information about it. We and all of the little inhabitants of our world will be very grateful to you. Also, if your grandpa was a blacksmith or jeweller and you found an old anvil under your leads and you want to barter it on our jaw harp - write us. Maybe you just found the thing we are looking for a long time! 

     

    We want to introduce you two our favorite patterned harpsm which body frame is almost ready: is jaw harp is called "Concave form of life". And the next harp is "Samorost". Them was made long time ago and wait  in the wings. Bouth harps are for perk Super-patterned jaw harp (1000 USD). We keep them unfinished so you we make some corrections in the patterns if you want (we can engrave a name or some phrase, or correct the pattern). Also we want to tune it specially for you, so you can choose the key you want. 

     

     

    And one munnharpe called "Fiord" (300 USD). It's body is ready and just wait someone who will say in what tune he wants this harp. We want to accent that taking one of our harps you help our workshop to move to a new level and produce new models of harps. All harps offered here are 100% handmade and will stay handmade in future - we jast want to allow machines to help us. 

     

    More information about Babayevharps project you can find in social media with tag #babayevharps

And the next harp is "Samorost". Them was made long time ago and wait  in the wings. Bouth harps are for perk Super-patterned jaw harp (1000 USD). We keep them unfinished so you we make some corrections in the patterns if you want (we can engrave a name or some phrase, or correct the pattern). It's body is ready and just wait someone who will say in what tune he wants this harp. We want to accent that taking one of our harps you help our workshop to move to a new level and produce new models of harps. story:
One Red Maple Hop Yard

Who:  Volunteers comprised of active duty military, veterans, police, sheriff, fire, and EMS working in collaboration with and in support of One Red Maple farm.

What:  “One Red Maple Hop Yard” – a 1.5 acre agricultural start-up effort to grow hops (three variety minimum) in the rural farmland of Virginia Beach, VA.

When:  Infrastructure installed by the end of February 2017.  Planting of hop rhizomes in the Spring of 2017.

Where:  On the grounds of One Red Maple farm in the Back Bay area of Virginia Beach, VA.

Why: 

  1. To supply emerging and established local craft beer breweries with fresh, east coast, locally grown hops.
  2. To afford the visitors and volunteers of LZ-Grace Warrior Retreat an opportunity to participate in a beneficial activity which produces a viable, perennial, agricultural crop.
  3. 100% of all proceeds of One Red Maple Hop Yard will go to financially support the efforts of Landing Zone Grace Warrior Retreat Foundation, a 501c3 nonprofit organization aimed at providing a secure resting place for SOF members, families and Tier One First Responders.

How:  Through the installation of infrastructure to support a 2,000 crown perennial hop yard on an identified, dedicated 1.5 acre portion of an existing, active, horse boarding farm in the Back Bay area of Virginia Beach, VA.  Infrastructure includes installation of seventy (70) twenty-five foot telephone poles in ten (10) rows on the northernmost portion of the property known as One Red Maple farm.  Infrastructure also includes the installation of ¼ inch stranded steel cable with a 6,640 lb. strength rating continuously across the length of each row at a height of 20 feet above the ground to create a trellis system.  Groundwork infrastructure includes installation of commercial drip irrigation and fertilizer systems.

"One Red Maple Hop Yard” is our ambitious attempt at establishing hops as a viable, sustainable, agricultural crop in Virginia Beach, Virginia.  With the explosion of the craft beer industry comes the demand for one important ingredient; humulus lupulus aka hops.  The demand for hops can sometimes outweigh the supply.  It is our desire to fulfill the need of local craft breweries by providing them with fresh, locally grown hops of the varieties they desire.

Located on a 38 acre horse farm in the rural Back Bay area of Virginia Beach, “One Red Maple Hop Yard” can be found at the end of a Bradford pear tree lined driveway on an initial 1.5 acre site.  Plans for the Hop Yard include infrastructure to accommodate the growth of approximately 2,000 individual perennial hop plants (crowns).  It is our desire to grow the varieties of hops that local brewers need and want.  We also like the idea of keeping a patriotic theme to the varieties of hops we chose to grow. With this in mind, we will grow three varieties of hops as essentials (dual purpose “Chinook” hops, bittering "CTZ" (Columbus/ Tomahawk®/ Zeus) hops and bittering “Admiral” hops.)  An area designated for experimental growth will hopefully, one day, grow bittering “Warrior®” hops.  With proven success, the Hop Yard is designed to easily accommodate expansion in the future. 

In order for “One Red Maple Hop Yard” to get off the ground, both literally and figuratively, your generous financial support will help us purchase the following items:

  1. $25,500.00      installation of seventy (70) twenty-five foot length telephone pole trellis system.
  2. $10,000.00      hop rhizomes (2,000 @ $5.00 each).
  3. $  3,500.00      commercial drip irrigation system for 4,000  linear feet.
  4. $  3,000.00      coir twine and anchors (48,000 ft).
  5. $  5,000.00      nutrients/fertilizer.
  6. $  5,000.00      pesticide/fungicide.
  7. $  2,000.00      two (2) Werner 20 ft. Fiberglass Twin Step Ladders with 300 lb. Load Capacity Type IA Model # T7420.
  8. $     500.00      Powermate  18 in. 196cc 4-Cycle Rear-Tine Gas Tiller Model # PRTT196E.

$54,500.00      Total

More information regarding LZ-Grace Warrior Retreat may be found at http://lz-grace.com/

Additional information can be found on the LZ-Grace Facebook page at https://www.facebook.com/LzGraceVeteransRetreat

Some of the available perk merchandise can be viewed at One Red Maple Hop Yard's Facebook page located at https://www.facebook.com/One-Red-Maple-Hop-Yard-1585779055083102/

It is our hope that the craft brewing industry and the many craft beer enthusiasts find our effort worthwhile and consider supporting us financially.  With your help we can bring a valuable commodity to our local market.  Hops are a perennial plant and hop yards are comparable to vineyards.  Please consider sponsoring us at the highest level possible.  Your generous financial support for One Red Maple Hop Yard directly impacts the Landing Zone Grace Warrior Retreat Foundation, a 501c3 charity.

$     500.00      Powermate  18 in. 196cc 4-Cycle Rear-Tine Gas Tiller Model # PRTT196E.

$54,500.00      Total
More information regarding LZ-Grace Warrior Retreat may be found at http://lz-grace.com/
Additional information can be found on the LZ-Grace Facebook page at https://www.facebook.com/LzGraceVeteransRetreat
Some of the available perk merchandise can be viewed at One Red Maple Hop Yard's Facebook page located at https://www.facebook.com/One-Red-Maple-Hop-Yard-1585779055083102/
It is our hope that the craft brewing industry and the many craft beer enthusiasts find our effort worthwhile and consider supporting us financially.  With your help we can bring a valuable commodity to our local market.  Hops are a perennial plant and hop yards are comparable to vineyards.  Please consider sponsoring us at the highest level possible.  Your generous financial support for One Red Maple Hop Yard directly impacts the Landing Zone Grace Warrior Retreat Foundation, a 501c3 charity.

story:
Have you ever dreamt of a place where you could indulge all of your quirky passions?

Then it may be time for a little Whimsicalitea — an eclectic event & experience emporium where you may enjoy afternoon tea service, enrichment classes, fan activities, immersion theme parties, meetups, getaways, and oh so much more.

Combining the talents and generosity of a number of seasoned creative professionals, Whimsicalitea will offer everything from fantasy fitness classes to fairy tale teas to Fandom Friday nerd-fests. Afternoon tea will be served Monday through Wednesday, with the rest of the week dedicated to our various workshops and theme events. 

Conveniently located in Southern California’s Old World Village, right off the 405 freeway and next to the hugely popular Huntington Beach Bella Terra shopping and entertainment complex, Whimsicalitea is poised to be a destination location with architecture and ambience that hearken back to the magic of classic Europe.

Our team have owned restaurants, tearooms, theater companies and more, and are currently seeking funds to cover the all-important start up costs of putting in a code-compliant kitchen, permits, insurance, and so on. Estimates indicate $15K would be enough to get us going, and given we have volunteer docent staff at the ready our overhead will be minimal. Even if our fundraising falls short of the goal amount, we're going forward with the project. It just may be delayed a bit. We plan to open in Spring and have the bulk of the back-end stuff done including menus and events planned, website done, et cetera.

Our contributor rewards are designed for both locals and long-distance donors with everything from complimentary tea and scones to a trip to London!

Going in with a team (as opposed to a one-man-band) we'll be able to rely on each other for support and backup instead of being solely responsible for every detail. Also, our pre-pay theme events will help us keep the budget lean as we'll know exactly how many people to prepare for and how much staff to engage, versus waiting around every day for people to walk through the door.

If your toes are wiggling at the prospects  but you're not in a position to dole out ducats at present, not to worry. Friends from afar may promote the cause by sharing on social media, and locals are welcome to join our onsite docent volunteam.

We do hope you’ll join your fellow whimsies — together we can bring fantasy and enchantment back into the everyday world. 

For details on everything we will be offering, take a moment to take a gander at our website: whimsicalitea.com

story:
The need is GREAT!
 Trinity Life Solutions was created to provide premier mental health treatment to low income families. After many years of working in the industry Trinity's founder, Alesia Glass-Rhodes recognized that low income families often received sub par treatment with little hope to have a life better. Alesia sought out to find the best professionals in the area to create a place of hope, faith and support for families battling mental illness.  

TLS is a small family focus mental health practice that provides counseling, support coordination and ABA therapy. At the current time we have a long waiting list due to the location and availability of staff. Your contribution will allow us to relocated to a fully renovated space and hire additional staff to meet our community's needs. 

What We Need & What You Get

$26,000 is needed to complete this full project. (50% of project funds will be from matching corporate funds.) 

This Project includes:

  • The relocation and build out of the new ABA therapy clinic. The currently clinic only can serve a very small number of  children during a set time period. Our new clinic will allow for us to triple the number of children and families to be served 
  • Training curriculum for additional staff.  We look to hire additional behavior therapist to work in the ABA clinic. We want to ensure our client's parents that all of our staff have received the same superb training, creating consistency between therapist for their child. 
  • Establishment of new website and marketing materials to eligible families. Our founder is a mental health/social service professional and created basics to start the business off. However, its time for a professional to step in and take the organization to the next level  and to ensure the services we provide are clearly articulated to the families in need of our services. 
  • Legal development of an accompanying nonprofit organization named StrongLinks. StrongLinks is our support group for the families we serve. Through this group we provide social events, financial assistance and personal development. Stronglinks will be incorporated and complete the 501 (C)(3) process as a part of the project.

The Impact

Your contribution goes beyond this project. It will create impact for years to come with in the mental health industry. Many centers refuse to serve low income families due to the hassle of dealing with the medicaid system. However, we offer services to medicaid receipts and look to serve even more as a result of your contribution.   

Risks & Challenges

There is a risk that our renovation can exceed the budget we have set. However, our goals is purchase quality and put in a large number of sweat equity hours. Our current clinic  was complete funded and renovated by Alesia and her husband James. The two completely believe in the work of mental health treatment and continue to go above and beyond to offer the best service in a comfortable environment. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share with your family and friends. Every dollar, share and prayer means the world to us.

story:
Who are we?

My name is Katherine and I own and operate the circus academy of Tucson. Everyday I work to keep our space and program going to provide circus education and a community space to our city. Our program is more than just circus, we want to be part of our student's over all educational life in becoming prepared adults and responsible community members. This includes offering community service opportunities and lessons on setting and completing goals, working as part of a team and exploring the self to develop awareness  and progress as human beings. Everyday, our students lives are impacted by our programming.

 Our goal is to offer circus to ALL in the community who wish to participate regardless of age, body type, socio economic status, race, religion, culture, physical or developmental challenges, gender identity, or any other perceived barrier to participation. We believe that everyone should have the chance to experience the benefits of circus and that everyone can benefit from circus arts. This year we managed to share circus with 15 kids who wouldn't have otherwise been able to participate in this kind of programming and in 2017 we hope to double that.

Why we are fundraising:

In 2016, our first year, we broke even. I am really proud of this as a small business owner. That said, looking at our spring semester, we are predicting a $3000.00 short fall in basic operations expenses. We also need to replace some key supplies such as fabrics with holes. There is building maintenance that needs to be done, including a termite treatment. These are all things that we have to do to keep going. If we exceed our goal, we will even be able to buy a new crash pad!

The Impact

Circus education is on the forefront of youth development programming. Circus programs like ours are having success across the country impacting youth and adults from all walks of life and helping to build strong communities and individuals. Check out:   http://www.americanyouthcircus.org/ for more info on circus programs and social circuses throughout the country!

Risks & Challenges

The challenge to running any business and any youth organization is always money! I have managed to run this by myself and save make it possible to do with little funding just by doing everything myself and working many, many, many hours each week. I know that I can overcome all challenges that arise because of my hard work and dedication and also because of the support of my community. I am eternally grateful to each and every student and family and couldn't do this without the community around me!

story:
My name is Nikki Revis and I am buying Phazes Fitness! 

About 7 years ago, shortly after having my second child (and having neglected my health entirely for years), I found myself in a very dark, sad, and lethargic state.

2010

That was until I took control of my diet and exercise. Within a year I had dropped 40 pounds, reversed my depression, fell in love with life again, and have lived happily ever after! 

 

Because of the level of impact this journey had on my own life, all I've ever wanted is for everyone to experience what I experienced- which is why I decided to become a personal trainer. 

I have been a National Academy of Sports Medicine Certified Personal Trainer now for 6 years, have worked with HUNDREDS of clients, and have also taught my fair share of group fitness classes (including bootcamp, pilates, and yoga). I work with and represent IFBB figure pro Jessie Hilgenberg. As her ambassador, I have had the privilege of attending and assisting at her training camps all over the world, all of which have been incredibly valuable experiences in perfecting my craft. A few months ago, I started feeling like something was missing. I knew I wasn't reaching my fullest potential and I still had so much more to give...but I couldn't pin-point what it was I was supposed to do. That was until I received the phone call informing me that the studio I was currently working at would be selling ownership. Suddenly EVERYTHING made sense. Literally, everything! Every job, every experience, every person who has crossed my path, has all seemed to lead me right here to this moment.

I know with every fiber of my being, that this opportunity was made for me. I get to fulfill my dream of changing lives, but on a much grander scale! So, I am buying this fitness studio!

As with any business venture, there are always risks involved. There will be months where we may not break even, there will be facility and equipment improvements needed, there will be attorney fees, marketing investments made, so I need your help to be as prepared, financially, as possible for when these circumstances arise.

Help me help others, and in return, I will help you too---because that's what I love to do!

Statistics show that lack of accountability is one of the major reasons that people don't achieve their goals. I want to change that by being your own personal and professional accountability partner. To thank you for your support, I will act as a coach/mentor to help lead and guide you to the next step of your journey to health--whatever that might be for you, personally. Not only can you get one-on-one coaching sessions (where we can discuss what you are doing, where you want to be, and what needs to shift to get you there) but you can also receive access to a private community where you can also check-in, ask questions, and receive answers, training tips, and support from a trained professional (yours truly!).    

Spread the word! My tangible facility will only allow me to reach the corners of Southern Utah, but that doesn't mean I can't help you, your friends, and your family get closer to your own goals, as you help me get closer to mine!

story:
Our mission is to enable Competitive UK based Skaters to be able to access and afford the best custom fitted equipment for them.

 

The Manchester Skate Shop will offer long term rentals on new and used equipment for roller derby, roller hockey and inline hockey

 

We're active Roller Derby Skaters, and the story of our journey through our roller skating lives has been echoed time and time again, up and down the country.

We joined an established team in 2012 and fell in love. 

Buying your first set of skates can be really daunting when you feel like Bambi, want to be better but scared you might always be just that little bit shit.  Renos were recommended by our coach. We compared them with some Riedells borrowed from another skater. However when we tried the Renos, they felt better after a few laps so we bought them.

 

Time passed, we skated more, we tried on more skates as and when someone came along with the same sized foot and a new exotic magical setup. As skills started to feel better in others skates we began tweaking.

Nowadays we have a completely custom setup, one that we have painstakingly tweaked and modified as we've learnt more about our own skating and what we need from equipment based on our sizes, weights, strengths and weaknesses. Our current setups have an RRP of around £500, but has easily cost us over £5000 in the past 5 years in terms of what we have tried and dismissed.

 

UK Roller Derby Recyclables has been the best resource ever, we've changed out wheels, we've changed plates, cushions, boots, bearings, not even the bolts remain now from our original setups. We've bought, we've sold, we've traded, we've swapped - all blindly on the internet and all in the hope that the next leap would be the leap home

 

Oh Boy!

 

The Manchester Skate Shop is a Quantum Leap in the way skaters access new and used equipment for competitive skating. We want to put an end to the feelings of dissatisfaction with your skate setup, and allow you to find the right skate setup for you, without constantly having to find lump sums for your next guess of a purchase.

 

 

 

How it Works

 

The Manchester Skate Shop will offer long term rentals on new and used equipment for roller derby, roller hockey and inline hockey. Our dedicated premises in Manchester will be home to all of our stock of new and used equipment.

Not based in or live anywhere near Manchester?

Fear not our travelling store can visit your training sessions, events and games to allow skaters immediate access to our stock.

Want to try new wheels before buying?

Cool, rent them for a few months and see if you like them.

Want to try a different boot or plate?

Sure thing, we can rent one to you for as long as you need/want it.

Want to buy something you've tried?

Great! you can either buy a brand new version, or buy the one you've been renting at a discounted rate.

 

Instead of buying then trying, lets change the way this works, to trying then buying! 

 

 

 

How Much Will This Cost?

 

We want to provide this unique service in the simplest and most affordable way that we can.  We will stock all major brands, models and sizes.

Our rental rate on all equipment is 10% of RRP monthly, charged monthly.

 

Yes just 10%

With our rentals, you can treat them as your own, you can train with them, you can bout with them, you can wrap them up safely at the end of the day and give them a special nook in your skate bag. We will not limit your testing of our rental stock.

 

 

 

What We Need

 

For the initial phase of the project to get off the ground, we need to raise £10,000 in funding. 

We have identified and began talking with a number of suppliers. The feedback so far, from the big name brands, has been really positive and they are behind the project. The one hurdle we have to overcome is locating a physical premises from which to operate.

We have identified a standalone B8 Warehouse unit, 5 minutes outside of the city centre with 24/7 direct access, which we will be using to store our stock. 

From knowing our sport and the nature of our sport, we have chosen to launch as a travelling pop-up shop. You will see by the perks, we are looking to COME TO YOU and let you try out our stock.

  • 40% of the funding raised will go towards leasing a VW Transporter Van
  • 50% of the funding raised will be invested in initial stock
  • 10% of the funding raised will cover the associated acquisition costs of the premises

 

An injection of £10k will allow us to begin supplying Wheel Rentals by 1st September 2017.

We will have availability every day throughout September to be able to turn up at your training session, bout or event; fully loaded with a wide variety of wheel stock and ready for you to try immediately. Whilst we are at your event, you can try one set of wheels or 10 sets of wheels, all for set low price, you can then decide if you want to rent the wheels, buy the wheels, or just stick with what you already have.

Check out our perks to see how you can be one of the first to get us at your event.

By January 2018, we will have rented out over 300 sets of wheels and then be able to supply full custom boot setups, both new and used, and be able to offer the ultimate in affordable customisation services.

 

Where We are Going

 

Achieving £10k in startup funding would be a dream come true, but will not take us anywhere near where we want to be. This round of funding is the first building block in truly revolutionising the way that Competitive Skaters access equipment.

Following a successful first round, we will be equipped to offer wheel rental services to 200 Skaters in the UK. The current estimate size of the UK Roller Derby Community alone is 14,000 active skaters, growing at a rate of 10%/year. 

The revenue from the first 100 rentals, will be reinvested to fund increasing stock levels of wheels and building the wheel rental service. Thereafter 25% of revenue will be reinvested in wheel stock. 

Overheads will be kept deliberately low to aid growth into offering boot, plate and equipment rentals. With the next area of investment being decided by Targeted Market Research conducted throughout September and October 2017.

From the conversations we have had with other skaters, leagues and interested parties, a market share of 10% looks to be achievable within 3 years, translating to a turnover of £450k and an expected profit of £100k/a. With only 4 main competitors in the market, and no service offering this level of flexibility and freedom, we will only be limited by our own resources.

The Manchester Skate Shop is an independent Ltd company based out of Ardwick Sports Hall in Manchester. We are part of the larger community project- Manchester Roller Sports. Manchester Roller Sports is an exciting not for profit project, which in the next 3 years will see the existing sports hall demolished and replaced with a Roller Sports Centre of excellence. The new building will host a WFTDA/International Hockey sized floor, a dedicated skaters gym, seating for upto 500 spectators and your very own Manchester Skate Shop main store offering rentals, sales and maintenance.

From that central location, The Manchester Skate Shop will then look to franchise out its model to allow immediate access to rentals, in stores around the country. Within 5 years, we estimate a UK Market share of at least 20% to be achievable, translating to a turnover of £1.1m with a profit of around £220k.

We currently benefit from: 

  • 10+ years high volume high turnover retail experience
  • 10+ years high pressure customer service experience
  • 2 x dedicated full time actively skating staff
  • Free Website Design, Build, Maintenance & Support
  • Free Digital and Offline Marketing advice and guidance
  • Discounted Accounting and Legals
  • Support from the best suppliers in the market

and are always looking to make more connections and find the best and most straightforward way to reach our goals.

We have big plans, a solid model and a clear route to Market.

If you are considering our 1% equity perk, our expected ROI in 5 years, for an investment of £2k, would be: £3800 =13.7%

 

 

How You Can Help

 

We need support from the Roller Derby Community to get this project up and running and meeting your needs. 

Please share this campaign, donate whatever you can, take advantage of one of our perks and spread the word.

Helping us helps you, your team mates, your league and your community.
