We've bought, we've sold, we've traded, we've swapped - all blindly on the internet and all in the hope that the next leap would be the leap home Oh Boy! The Manchester Skate Shop is a Quantum Leap in the way skaters access new and used equipment for competitive skating. We want to put an end to the feelings of dissatisfaction with your skate setup, and allow you to find the right skate setup for you, without constantly having to find lump sums for your next guess of a purchase.   How it Works The Manchester Skate Shop will offer long term rentals on new and used equipment for roller derby, roller hockey and inline hockey. Our dedicated premises in Manchester will be home to all of our stock of new and used equipment.Not based in or live anywhere near Manchester?Fear not our travelling store can visit your training sessions, events and games to allow skaters immediate access to our stock.Want to try new wheels before buying?Cool, rent them for a few months and see if you like them.Want to try a different boot or plate?Sure thing, we can rent one to you for as long as you need/want it.Want to buy something you've tried?Great! you can either buy a brand new version, or buy the one you've been renting at a discounted rate. Instead of buying then trying, lets change the way this works, to trying then buying!    How Much Will This Cost? We want to provide this unique service in the simplest and most affordable way that we can.  We will stock all major brands, models and sizes.Our rental rate on all equipment is 10% of RRP monthly, charged monthly. Yes just 10%With our rentals, you can treat them as your own, you can train with them, you can bout with them, you can wrap them up safely at the end of the day and give them a special nook in your skate bag. We will not limit your testing of our rental stock.   What We Need For the initial phase of the project to get off the ground, we need to raise £10,000 in funding. We have identified and began talking with a number of suppliers. The feedback so far, from the big name brands, has been really positive and they are behind the project. The one hurdle we have to overcome is locating a physical premises from which to operate.We have identified a standalone B8 Warehouse unit, 5 minutes outside of the city centre with 24/7 direct access, which we will be using to store our stock. From knowing our sport and the nature of our sport, we have chosen to launch as a travelling pop-up shop. You will see by the perks, we are looking to COME TO YOU and let you try out our stock.
40% of the funding raised will go towards leasing a VW Transporter Van
50% of the funding raised will be invested in initial stock
10% of the funding raised will cover the associated acquisition costs of the premises
 An injection of £10k will allow us to begin supplying Wheel Rentals by 1st September 2017.We will have availability every day throughout September to be able to turn up at your training session, bout or event; fully loaded with a wide variety of wheel stock and ready for you to try immediately. Whilst we are at your event, you can try one set of wheels or 10 sets of wheels, all for set low price, you can then decide if you want to rent the wheels, buy the wheels, or just stick with what you already have.Check out our perks to see how you can be one of the first to get us at your event.By January 2018, we will have rented out over 300 sets of wheels and then be able to supply full custom boot setups, both new and used, and be able to offer the ultimate in affordable customisation services. Where We are Going Achieving £10k in startup funding would be a dream come true, but will not take us anywhere near where we want to be. This round of funding is the first building block in truly revolutionising the way that Competitive Skaters access equipment.Following a successful first round, we will be equipped to offer wheel rental services to 200 Skaters in the UK. The current estimate size of the UK Roller Derby Community alone is 14,000 active skaters, growing at a rate of 10%/year. The revenue from the first 100 rentals, will be reinvested to fund increasing stock levels of wheels and building the wheel rental service. Thereafter 25% of revenue will be reinvested in wheel stock. Overheads will be kept deliberately low to aid growth into offering boot, plate and equipment rentals. With the next area of investment being decided by Targeted Market Research conducted throughout September and October 2017.From the conversations we have had with other skaters, leagues and interested parties, a market share of 10% looks to be achievable within 3 years, translating to a turnover of £450k and an expected profit of £100k/a. With only 4 main competitors in the market, and no service offering this level of flexibility and freedom, we will only be limited by our own resources.The Manchester Skate Shop is an independent Ltd company based out of Ardwick Sports Hall in Manchester. We are part of the larger community project- Manchester Roller Sports. Manchester Roller Sports is an exciting not for profit project, which in the next 3 years will see the existing sports hall demolished and replaced with a Roller Sports Centre of excellence. The new building will host a WFTDA/International Hockey sized floor, a dedicated skaters gym, seating for upto 500 spectators and your very own Manchester Skate Shop main store offering rentals, sales and maintenance.From that central location, The Manchester Skate Shop will then look to franchise out its model to allow immediate access to rentals, in stores around the country. Within 5 years, we estimate a UK Market share of at least 20% to be achievable, translating to a turnover of £1.1m with a profit of around £220k.We currently benefit from: 
10+ years high volume high turnover retail experience
10+ years high pressure customer service experience
2 x dedicated full time actively skating staff
Free Website Design, Build, Maintenance & Support
Free Digital and Offline Marketing advice and guidance
Discounted Accounting and Legals
Support from the best suppliers in the market
and are always looking to make more connections and find the best and most straightforward way to reach our goals.We have big plans, a solid model and a clear route to Market. If you are considering our 1% equity perk, our expected ROI in 5 years, for an investment of £2k, would be: £3800 =13.7%  How You Can Help We need support from the Roller Derby Community to get this project up and running and meeting your needs. Please share this campaign, donate whatever you can, take advantage of one of our perks and spread the word.Helping us helps you, your team mates, your league and your community.

story:
My Βelief!!!

The universe grants us with our greatest desires.
When you really want something, the entire universe conspires in helping you to achieve it. And guess what….that is not a secret…it’s magic!

Let me introduce myself
I am Azima and I love inspiring people to discover their blissful and lovable selves! I have always found it pretty hard to answer the question “what is your job?”… and that’s because wanting people to be happy could not be considered as an actual profession.  I am master reiki, heartfulness meditation instructor, dramatherapist, actress, singer, I  am daughter,  I am companion, girlfriend, wife, mother…
I am the best friend you ever had!


I am a therapist... a healer in every way! I am a happy, grateful woman!
Join my campaign and help me fulfill my dream, here, in Greece.

Azima Place Café and Store is the dream of my life. It is a place for everyone. A place where we will be offering joy, laughter and love through everyday actions. It is a place where arts and acting meet alternative treatments, helping people to find their true self…helping them find happiness. In Azima Place Café and Store, people will find out whatever is missing from their lives. Love, joy, friends, laughter, work, but most of all inspiration, optimism and courage to make their dreams come true… just like we did!

If you choose to support my dream, you will be supporting the dream of many others. Dimitris’ dream for example, is to teach acting in classes open to everyone, from children to elderly people.
 


Veta’s dream is to turn cooking into a creative performance. Using traditional homemade Mediterranean recipes and inviting both couples and children to join her, she wants to help them improve their relationships and make them stronger.
She calls her dream “Eros Cooking Recipes”.

Veta Betini, my mother, i will like to share with you the following short film
Actress | lyricist | tv persona | businesswoman | lovely big mamma Veta
Biography Documentary LOVELY BIG VETA Director Kalliopi Legaki
Greece 2000 | 23 Min | OmU English
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Z5j1U9Fr5Fs

 
Elisavet’s dream is to make her first exhibition including self-created pieces of art…
She is our daughter and these are her own hand made paintings she is almost 8 years now, but the paintings starts from 3,5 years old!!! We are proud !!!
 
 
and the “dreams’ list” goes on….

In Azima Place Café and Store healing and meditating crystals fill our place with their unique energy.

We meditate, we exchange reiki therapies, we take yoga lessons, we dance, we cook, we give our own theatrical performances and we LOVE. We love our lives and we dare to dream while staying here, in Greece. Come and visit us and you will be treated with a lot of traditional food and love. And  until then, you will have a special place in my heart, in my meditation and in my prayers.

Continue to stand for what you love. And shine your light in the world!

Thank you for your time and energy

What We Need & What You Get

This summer, in the next 30 days, with your help and support! I will make my dreams, our dreams, come true. Why? Because I want to create Azima Place.  Azima Place is a multi-purpose space that is for people of all ages – for children, for adults, for parents, and for grandparents. In this space, Azima Place Store and Café, the arts meet alternative therapies and come to life.  Under this pie you will find the reasons why I have to raise 35,000 euro/usd.

 
Join our campaign and you will receive a "friendship certification", with your name or your picture in our “wall of love”, alongside our fellow supporters. You may "get your own chair" in our café or your name printed in one of our yoga mattresses. You may even choose to become one of our main sponsors and "see your name right next to our own". Either way, we will all be grateful for your love and support. 

It's like seeing the opening party in Azima Place Cafe & Store We 'll become a big hug, through a heartfulness meditation in - person & on Skype!!! We want you with us! Let's embrace the whole Magic Planet Earth!!!  

...if we don't reach our entire goal...  our project will be adjust it according to the amount that we will qather and with a long-term schedule we will accomplish our vision.
But No ! We have will !!! Wonders happen to those who believe them! We believe so we will all the requested amount . thank you all for your help !

By pitching into our campaign you get access to some pretty awesome perks and a chance to ensure that this amazing space can thrive.
In exchange, I promise to never give up on my dream.
I will continue to inspire people with laughter and joy and help them fulfill their dreams also!

The Impact

A Few Words
The Azima  Place Cafe & Store is a small multi-purpose space, that hosts a variety of different art projects.  It follows the philosophy that "free expression and self-awareness builds the foundation of society."  It develops in three main levels! This is all offered at the Place with its focus on art and therapy, and the Cafe which is a place where everyone can meet and finally, the Store which is a mystical store with crystals and other alternative new age objects of one’s heart’s desire!

Who We Are
Azima Liana Karagiannidou
Master reiki | heartfulness meditation instructor | actress | dramatherapist
Dimitris Chavres
Actor | theatrical play animator | acting instructor.
Veta Betini
Actress | lyricist | tv persona | businesswoman | lovely big mamma Veta
Elisavet  Chavre
8-year-old painter of art objects

What We Offer
Our services combine the arts and alternative therapies to produce creative expression, happiness, laughter and love. We offer our services to private clients, businesses, and schools.

Our services are professional and always have at their foundation creativity and our aesthetics. That is, our passion inspires us to create the arts and activities offered with the purpose of developing emotional intelligence.

The projects offered are two-dimensional:
a. The child. Educating and inspiring the child with direct and indirect methods.
b. Commercial Art  projects. In partnership with private clients, parents, grandparents, businesses and/or groups that are searching for creative and innovative solutions and express social sensitivity and responsibility.

Our mission
Our vision and basic mission is our commitment and devotion to offering high quality creative services towards the development of a "better world", through fulfill interaction with the public.
We faithfully follow medical strategies and define success as the result of a delightful collaboration, between creator and customer, under the umbrella of ethics and morality.

Our strategy
- We offer to the public and to our clients the quality that we would demand for ourselves.
- We approach and dedicate ourselves to each individual project, action, seminar, individual session, giving importance to its one-of-a-kind characteristics, resulting in a new unique experience every time.

- We continually upgrade our aesthetics, keeping up with the global development of character acting therapy, while staying true to our originality and vision.
- We select trusted professionals to successfully complete our projects.
- We invest in the artistic and expressive empowerment of the next generation, who are facing challenges with career indecisiveness.
- We support the values of imagination, inspiration, passion for creativity and productivity, self-awareness and self-confidence.
- We work with businesses, institutions, and individuals who support common values and principles with us.
- We commit ourselves to continuing to meet the highest creative standards.

services

For the child
Το Azima Place Café & Store implements a variety of child-friendly services and has as its main goal its inspiration, the empowerment of expressive and creative self-confidence and self-awareness through interaction.
More specifically:
- Theatrical play | theatrical group.
- hip hop & break dance, aerial yoga, hatha yoga.
- Spontaneous Painting Workshop (Doodling).
- Thematic Workshops for Creative Employment
- Thematically alternative children's parties with creative expression
- Constructions for children
- Reiki 1st Kid Degree

For the adult
We have prepared a number of unique services for adults who share our aesthetics and philosophy and naturally promote wellbeing. ¨
More specifically:
Individual Sessions
- Reiki '
- Aura – Soma 
- Astrology | Human Design System
- Tachyon TLC BARS Cocoon
- Reflexology & Tachyon Cocoon | Ayurvedic massage & Tachyon Cocoon
- Primal Therapy (inner child)
- Crystal Therapy & Tachyon Cocoon
Group Seminars
- Reiki  1st Degree - Reiki  2nd Degree - Reiki Master Degree
- Meditation Seminars Workshops
- Systemic Family Constellations Bert Hellinger
Groups
- Meditation
- Hatha Yoga - Aerial Yoga - Partner Yoga - Yin Yang Flow Yoga - Kundalini Yoga
- Kids & Parents Yoga - Grandparents Yoga
- Belly Dancing
- Theatrical play for adults
- Hip Hop Break Dance - Latin Salsa Modern Dance
- Alternative Azima Cafe, with delicious snacks, salads & sweets, festive brunch, and more.  It is a central meeting place for all.
-Custom made gifts, painting art objects by Elisavet , crystals, books, music, tachyon, aura soma, from the Azima’s  Store, bazzart.
-Alternative presentations, invitations, and announcements of unique young adults with creative and fresh approaches.

For businesses
Our experience and abilities provide us with the flexibility to design and implement tailor made projects for each corporate client, providing effective solutions and promoting goodwill, kindness and generosity.

Indicatively, some of our services are as follows:
-anxiety management seminars, self-confidence development, emotional intelligence development, physical laboratories that promote expression and "reading" body language!

 

Risks & Challenges

The problems have their solution!
Obstacles to Mindfulness and How to Overcome Them it's my job! Whatever goal you want to achieve will include overcoming obstacles. Expect obstacles and accept them as part of real life!
I will Embrace Self-Awareness, we 'll use time to our advantage, we 'll commit to Focused! I like to create rhythm in my life so I can freely engage the creative part of my brain for problem solving. I never forget that the journey is the destination! 

I will like to share with you, a Poem by C. P. Cavafy

"Ithaca"
When you set out for distant Ithaca,
fervently wish your journey may be long, —
full of adventures and with much to learn.
Of the Laestrygones and the Cyclopes,
of the angry god Poseidon, have no fear:
these you shall not encounter, if your thought
remains at all times lofty, — if select
emotion touches you in body and spirit.
Not the Laestrygones, not the Cyclopes,
nor yet the fierce Poseidon, shall you meet,
unless you carry them within your soul, —
unless your soul should raise them to confront you.
 
Fervently wish your journey may be long.
May they be numerous — the summer mornings
when, pleased and joyous, you will be anchoring
in harbours you have never seen before.
Stay at the populous Phoenician marts,
and make provision of good merchandise;
coral and mother of pearl; and ebony
and amber; and voluptuous perfumes
of every kind, in lavish quantity.
Sojourn in many a city of the Nile,
and from the learned learn and learn amain.
 
At every stage bear Ithaca in mind.
The arrival there is your appointed lot.
But hurry not the voyage in the least:
’twere better if you travelled many years
and reached your island home in your old age,
being rich in riches gathered on the way,
and not expecting more from Ithaca.
 
Ithaca gave you the delightful voyage:
without her you would never have set out:
and she has nothing else to give you now.
 
And though you should find her wanting, Ithaca
will not surprise you; for you will arrive
wise and experienced, having long since perceived
the unapparent sense in Ithacas. 

Translated by John Cavafy
(Poems by C. P. Cavafy. Translated, from the Greek, by J. C. Cavafy. Ikaros, 2003) 

Other Ways You Can Help

Beyond financial contributions, there are many ways you can support our campaign and growth efforts!

Help spread the word about this campaign! Social media is a powerful tool to get our story out to the world! You can help us with every share - publicly or personally. We’re sure you have a dear friend, or two, or one hundred, who would love to hear about what we’re up to!

Follow us on social media (found at the top) and sign up for email updates! That way, you’ll be the first to know about shop developments as we get closer to opening our doors this fall.

Literally, tell every smiling, loving, person you know! But, really!

We 'll see you soon in our first meditation in-person, or on Skype this fall September 2017, at Azima Place Cafe & Store

We can't wait to see the Azima Place Cafe & Store,
a place that wouldn't be possible without you! Thank you!
Love & Gratitude

story:
WHO IS LEVI?

You know those motivational videos where the hero leaves everything behind to pursue his dream, kills all the bad guys and gets the pretty girl. Well in this story, that hero is me except the difference is that I am yet to kill the bad guys and I haven't got the pretty girl yet. Let me tell you my tale...


At the age of 15, I left school to pursue my dream in becoming a fighter. Brazilian Jiu-jitsu, though a bitch at first, was my first love. She was in my face, pushed my ego and left me battered but even then, I knew that I wanted to spend the rest of my life with her. 3 years later, nothing has changed.

Though I may not be your average 18 year old, even now at this age, I feel that I have found my calling in Jiu-jitsu. My dream now is to be the best in the world. I want to be a world champion.

The only obstacle standing in my way (apart from obviously the 5 world class fighters I will be fighting) is the funds. This is where I need your help.


THE COMPETITION


The IBJJF a World Championship also known as the 'mundials' is a competition that attracts the best of the best. It is one of those competitions where all the alpha male and females go to find who's the 'G.I.JOE' among them. Training alone for this competition will be gruesome for me. I will be going into a 3 month training camp in New York to train with some of the best athletes, whom I will be competing along side with. From their I make my journey to California to make sure I bring back the gold to Australia


History will not repeat itself.

Being close enough to taste victory only to have it taken from you leaves the worst kind of memories. Yes, I have been here before. Last year, I qualified and came close to fulfilling my dreams only to have some bad calls go against me. There is no one to blame. I just wasn't ready for the title. But a year later, another 1000 hours of training and support from family and friends means that I have another chance at becoming the world champion.


Funding

I am lucky, and so grateful, that my sponsors are covering my flights to and from the competition. I also have managed to save up to $1500 for accommodation, transport and travel inside USA. The only place I am falling short is living costs. USA isn't cheap and when it comes to food, no matter how many 2-minute noodles I eat, it ends up being the large sum of the expenses. I am more than happy to sleep on couches and eat crappy food to get to the 'Mundials', but I don't want the reason of me missing out on this opportunity to be money. That is why I am trying to raise another $2,500 to help me survive for 3 months away from home. These funds will cover part of the accommodation costs in New York and all of the living costs along with food, travel and competition entry costs.


WHY SHOULD YOU HELP?

Jiu-Jitsu has become my life, not a part, but my whole life. Unfortunately however being a full-time athlete in my sport is not as glorified as NBA or NFL. Being a full-time athlete also means that I cannot work a normal job because I have to fully commit to this sport. Though I have worked hard over the last 6 months doing as many hours, whether that's doing personal training or teaching kids, the money is simply not enough. This is why I need your contribution.

You contribution could be the difference between me winning gold at IBJJF 2016 Mundials or coming home empty handed. The hours I am putting in week to week, and the sacrifices I have made, and will make in the coming future, will result to nothing if I cannot make it to California to compete.  


RISKS AND CHALLENGES

Where do I start. There is of course the small challenges such as sleeping on a friend's couch or a floor for 3 months so I can train at my camp in New York. Then there is the lack of money to eat good home-cooked meals and having to put up with tuna and 2-minute noodles. The biggest risk I face as an athlete however is something that we all can relate to. What if I fail again? The thought of not winning this year makes me feel like I am going to vomit.
Unfortunately this is also a part of this life. I have accepted this risk and the thought not winning is what pushes me through the tough hours of training and makes sleeping on the floor and eating 2-minute noodles seem all right. 

Other Ways You Can Help

As a person who is reaching out for support, I understand that not everyone will be able to afford to contribute. There are still many ways in which you can help this cause.

  • If you like this idea, please share the video to your friends and family, who knows how far reaching the campaign could go.
  • If you really want to help, if you are able maybe ask a parent to help you chip in
  • I am running a seminar at Garage Jiu Jitsu. It's going to be a great day. May be you can come to that.
story_txt:
WHO IS LEVI?You know those motivational videos where the hero leaves everything behind to pursue his dream, kills all the bad guys and gets the pretty girl. Well in this story, that hero is me except the difference is that I am yet to kill the bad guys and I haven't got the pretty girl yet. Let me tell you my tale...At the age of 15, I left school to pursue my dream in becoming a fighter. Brazilian Jiu-jitsu, though a bitch at first, was my first love. She was in my face, pushed my ego and left me battered but even then, I knew that I wanted to spend the rest of my life with her. 3 years later, nothing has changed. Though I may not be your average 18 year old, even now at this age, I feel that I have found my calling in Jiu-jitsu. My dream now is to be the best in the world. I want to be a world champion. story:
Amadáin; plural of Amadán, the Irish for fools/idiots. We think it suits.


What's It All About?

This summer we've decided to do the silliest thing you're likely to hear about all year. We're taking part in "the Mongol Rally".

What's the Mongol Rally you ask? Described by the organisers as the greatest motoring adventure on the planet, the Mongol Rally is a cross-continental car journey for charity. It will take us from London to the capital of Mongolia over 15,000KM away, across 2 continents and 17 countries.

Once we leave Ireland, we'll have no fixed route, no backup and no support, just three ill-prepared amadáin, a sea of red tape and some coffee-stained maps.

The best part? We're doing it in a car that's about as dodgy as some of the former Soviet states we're driving through. Forget 4x4's, think Nissan Micra's and Toyota Starlets. We're going to transverse deserts and mountain ranges in a car that would probably struggle to make it the local shop.

Why?

The trip is in aid of the Cork Simon Community, a fantastic local charity who work closely with the men and women who are homeless in Cork, offering housing and support, and helping them on their journey back to independent living. They offer invaluable services to some of the most vulnerable people in Cork, including a nightly soup run, an emergency shelter and a healthcare team. We are extremely proud to be raising money for such a wonderful charity. 


Who Are We?

Meet the 3 amadáin that have decided to risk their lives, sanity, and friendships, on this wacky road trip for charity. 

Conor O'Donoghue
22

David Hayes
23

Emma Finn
23
If you'd like to see our full team member bios you can meet the team here!

Where Does The Money Go?

We are trying to achieve two things. Raise money for Cork Simon and offset some of the costs of the trip for ourselves. So we are putting 50% of each donation to our two goals. Half goes to Cork Simon, half goes to helping us fund the trip.

For example, if you select "The T-Shirt Team" perk, your money is broken down as follows:

Perk Cost €100
Indiegogo Fee - 5% €5
PayPal Fee - 3.4% €3.23
Total Contribution €91.77
Total Donation to Cork Simon €45.89
 
What If I Want It All To Go to Cork Simon?
That's easy as well, all you have to do is manually put in a contribution of your choice right here! The entirety of your donation will go to Cork Simon without any of the Sponsor Perks listed on the right.

What Are The Costs?
This trip requires a massive amount of planning and preparation. We will be travelling along some very harsh environments and putting our lives in danger (no, seriously). As you can imagine, undertaking such a trip requires a significant amount money and equipment. We're hoping that some money raised on this platform will offset some of the costs of the trip. 
  • Visa's and other nasty paperwork ~ €3000
  • Food, water, and petrol ~ €1,500
  • Camping equipment ~ €400
  • Flights home ~ €1500
  • Car and spares ~ €800
What Happens To Un-Spent Money?

Fear not, no money shall be wasted and any money we raise on this crowdfunding platform that isn't spent on the trip will be added to the money raised for the Cork Simon Community.

Corporate Sponsors & Equipment

If you would like to get your company logo plastered on to the side of the car or you'd like to donate some equipment we would love to hear from you. On our website we have a page for sponsors which includes a sponsor pack with further details.

Share!

Please, share our IndieGoGo across social media so all your friends and family can see. The more people who see us the more likely we are to raise the money for the trip! 

Goals

A Handful of Hurlers: €1000

None of us are any good at hurling, in fact we're pretty awful. This isn't stopping us though, and if we manage to raise €1000 in this IndieGoGo we promise to bring our terrible skills and utilise them in some of the most far flung places you can imagine. Fancy some photos of us playing hurling over the gates of hell? Or maybe a quick puck of the sliotar whilst we wait for the Iranian border guards to let us through. Whatever happens we promise to get as many photos of us playing hurling in as many different locations as we can.

Dubious Dubs: €2500

We're ready to put our pride aside if we reach this goal and do what no Cork-folk ever ought to do. We will wear Dublin GAA jerseys for a two days on the trip. Not having showered for a week wouldn't make us feel as dirty us this but we're willing to take one for the team here and do what it takes. Please forgive us.

Nearly Naked Mile: €5000

Want to make us really sweat? We've volunteered our dignity for this goal and we're going to push the car for a mile in the searing desert heat in nothing but our underwear and shoes. Yes really. If the thought of 3 pasty white Irish folk pushing a car in the deserts of Kazakhstan or the Steppes of Mongolia really tickles your fancy (damn weirdos), then make sure we hit this goal.


More Goals Soon!

story:
What is this about?

The Viewpoint Envision to summarize, is a small computer that can fit anywhere that packs power at a great price. It can also be upgraded with ease so allow the user to tweak it to their desire. For more details read the "What is Viewpoint Envision?" section.

What is Viewpoint Envision?

Viewpoint Envision is a desktop PC compressed into the size of a book, without taking away from power or increasing price. The Viewpoint PC is aimed for everyone, it has multiple uses for any type of environment. It is very affordable making it a good choice for schools, it's also small making it a good choice for the work environment, the RAM is easily upgradable plus it has two mini-PCIe slots making it good for PC superusers, it packs power making it good for gaming and it also has all the bells and whistles needed for home use.

So now we are gonna get into all the technical stuff, so be prepared. The Envision PC is based off the Intel NUC form factor, Intel NUC is like a Mini-ITX motherboard, but even smaller. With the Intel NUC motherboard we can fit standard NUC parts in without having to search really hard for them. We will first start off with Intel Celeron chips, most likely the the Celeron 847, then once we get enough money from sales we can work our way up to a Core i7.

The base model (Envision 100) is sold for $199 and comes with a Celeron 847, 120 GB SSD, 2 GB of DDR3 1333 Mhz RAM, Intel HD Graphics, Intel Dual Band Wireless-AC 7260 + Bluetooth 4.0.

You can find more information about specs on our website here: https://sites.google.com/site/theviewpointtechn...

What We Need & What You Get

Now I will explain a little bit more about the project, I will break down some of teh ideas.

  • We need at least $400 in funding to create the Viewpoint Envision, $800 is our goal. When money is donated it is used to buy parts for the computer, this allows us to finish our prototype and build the final product. $100 goes to the prototype and $700 goes to the product. 
  • Our perks are designed to make everyone a part of the project, if you donate $100 we will engrave your name on the inside of the Envision.
  • If our campaign does not become fully funded, we will use the money to complete our final prototype.
  • Extra money that is donated will go into making Viewpoint Envision with the Core i series processors (Core i3/i5/i7).

More details:

  • This project is valuable to you because it creates a better widely a alive Windows counterpart to the Mac Mini and is important to the world because requires less materials to build reducing the effect on the envoriment.
  • In the past we have had succes with our other projects such as Viewpoint Aid, we want to have the same success story for our Viewpoint Envision.
  • Our goal is also to build trust with our supporters by delivering the Envision on time and with no delays, we also won't use the money for personal uses.

Risks & Challenges

There are many risks and challenges we have to overcome to have a succesful project.

  • The largest challenge we have is actually getting funding, many people will look at our campaign, few will actually contribute.
  • Other challenge is that there are thousands of campaigns like this one, with so many it is very hard for one to choose what one they want to contribute to.
  • Our last challenge is that we need to try to work out a deal with Chenbro for the case that is affordable, this is extremely difficult because they are not very well known in the US. For now we can buy them from eBay, but we have to pay extra to get it shipped to our office in the US.
To overcome these challenges we will try everything we can, it won't be easy but every one of these can be fixed.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, you can still help by:

  • Share this with all your friends
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Talk about it with people

Thank you for taking the time to actually read this, I hope you consider donating to our project.

----------------------------

A little bit about our company: Viewpoint Technologies is a software and computer support provider (Soon to be computer manufacturer) that trys to provide only the best products. Our company currently has  4 employees, we are all basically teenagers looking to turn our passion into a company. Our employees are hard  working and love what they do.

story:
Project Summary

Yield Technologies cares about helping people to grow more, while damaging the planet less. We’ve taken technology we discovered at a UK university, and we’re scaling it up and getting it to the people that need it in the developed and developing world.

In our tests to date, we’ve seen a yield increase of more than 42% in some crops, without any more conventional fertilizer or other changes. At the same time, we’ve improved the nutritional content of those crops, making them better for the people that eat them and improving health. That’s why we think we can help to sustainably feed the world with this, if only we can get it out there at prices people can afford – and that means scaling up our production process.

Plants need minerals to grow and stay healthy, just like humans need vitamins. Two of the minerals plants need are iron and silica. Currently, when farmers in the west add iron and silica to their crops, they have to use iron chelate or silicic acid  – expensive chemicals which aren't great for the environment.

We’ve found that tiny particles of iron help the plant to grow, by improving the rate of photosynthesis (the way the plant catches the suns energy), and helping seeds to germinate. We've also found that tiny particles of silica help the plant to grow stronger and get bigger. We package our tiny particles with a natural protein, which not only helps the plant to take the minerals up, but help it to grow as well.

Our campaign will help us to speed up development, and allow us get this new technology directly to the people that need it most, rather than working through multinational agri-chemical companies. Going down that conventional route is likely to slow things down, and make the end product prohibitively expensive for those in the developing world. That is not our goal.

With your help, we can immediately improve the livelihoods of farmers in the developing world, improve the nutrition and health of the people they feed, and sustainably provide this technology to them cheaply, year after year.

 

What We Need

At the moment, our production process is slow and laborious – indeed a lot of it has to be done by hand. That limits the amount of product we can make, and makes it very expensive. But because we have a completely new product and process, we can’t just go out and buy production machinery to make it – the machinery doesn’t exist. Instead, we’re going to have to develop our production process and machinery ourselves, and that is where you come in. By contributing to our campaign, you’ll help us to scale up our production so that we can make the end product available and affordable to farmers in the developing world. We're a keen and experienced group of engineers and chemists. We're not rich, but we've already put a lot of our own money and time into getting the product this far. We feel now is the time to 'go big'. (We're also not creatives, as you can probably tell by our videos and artwork! More on that later...) 

We think we need around $100000 to get us to a place where we can make the product cheaply enough to be affordable for certain crops in the developing world. This amount will allow us to create a single production line. 

Here’s roughly how we get to that figure:

Method refinement and proving

$10000

Initial production machinery

$20000

Scaled up production machinery

$50000

Testing and independent accreditation of the product

$20000

 

We also need help proving out our product on plants. Lots of plants, in lots of environments. The more evidence we have that this approach can work, the more governments and NGO's will stand up and realize that traditional fertilizer is not the only way. 

 

What You Get

What do we give you in return for helping us? Well, we realize that the benefits of such a 'wonder fertilizer' may be hard to believe. And our trial production process is now providing us with small volumes of product. So what better way to show people the difference than to post out samples? For each donation of $10, we will post out a 1 gram sachet of additive from the first batches, which are being produced by hand right now! 1 gram of our additive is enough to dose 17.5 litres of water, which can then be used to water your plants in the normal way - with or without your usual fertilizer. Full instructions will be included with sample sachets. Ideally, if you have two plants side-by-side then you too can witness the difference by treating only one and not the other! If you're not a grower yourself, but believe this is a great project, there is the option to donate $5, which comes with a great big THANKYOU on our part.

Larger donations will receive further sachets, for instance enough for small greenhouses or vegetable gardens. Even better, if you want to get involved in working out just how good the fertilizer is, then please see the 'Big Science' section below!

 

What if we don't raise enough?

If we don’t get to our total, we'll be disappointed. However, we’ll have progressed a long way towards our goal and will have reduced the cost of the product substantially by starting to work through the steps above. We'll carry on investing our own time and money, but crucially, if we have to take venture capital funding, it may mean we lose control of the price of our product, preventing use in the developing world.

 

Big Science

Want to get involved in a worldwide trial? Then read on! We’ve tested our iron and silica on quite a few plants and got great results so far. But there’s a limit to the number of tests we can do; and that’s where you come in.

You can really help us by taking one of our science kits and growing some plants for us - some with our product and some without - then sharing your results. So, you might choose to grow blueberries. We’d ask you to plant four blueberry plants (or take four blueberry seedlings), and water them like this:

  1.        Water only
  2.        Water plus iron
  3.        Water plus silica
  4.        Water plus iron and silica

If you normally use plant food, then use that too, crucially making sure that each plant gets the same amount.

Then, over the weeks that follow, take some simple measurements and some photos, and tell us if the plant grew bigger and stronger, and whether it produced more fruit.

It doesn’t matter whether you grow indoors or outside.

Our science kits will provide everything you need to do the experiment except soil and seeds:

  •          4 pots
  •          Tape measure
  •          Watering can
  •          Iron and silica product
  •          Measuring cylinders
  •          Instructions

When you have some results, you can send them to us at results@yield-tech.co.uk, or post them on our facebook page. We'll keep a log of all the results, concentrating our efforts on promising crops first. We will post full credits to those who have helped.

 

Risks & Challenges

The obstacles we face in scaling up are understanding our production process in real detail, from the basic chemistry that’s going on, through the way the product flows through the process, and the physical and chemical limits that we need to stay within to produce quality product in volume.

We’ll do that by having the right equipment to measure and control the process, and getting the right people and outside help to work with us.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone can contribute cash , but that doesn't mean you can't help the project. Just getting word out about what we're trying to do is a great start. If you find it interesting, even sharing this project with your friends on social media may take us closer to our goals.

As mentioned above, we are a group of engineers and chemists, not creatives. We know our web, artistic and social media skills are a bit lacking! We would be happy to make significant charitable donations of product in exchange for help which may get the word out there, please do just drop us a line.

Additionally, if you are involved with a farm, agriculture, or market-garden/soup kitchen type charity, and would like to put yourselves forward to receive a donation once our production process is scaled up, then please do get in touch.
story_txt:
Project Summary
Yield Technologies cares about helping people to grow more, while damaging the planet less. We’ve taken technology we discovered at a UK university, and we’re scaling it up and getting it to the people that need it in the developed and developing world.
In our tests to date, we’ve seen a yield increase of more than 42% in some crops, without any more conventional fertilizer or other changes. At the same time, we’ve improved the nutritional content of those crops, making them better for the people that eat them and improving health. That’s why we think we can help to sustainably feed the world with this, if only we can get it out there at prices people can afford – and that means scaling up our production process.
Plants need minerals to grow and stay healthy, just like humans need vitamins. Two of the minerals plants need are iron and silica. Currently, when farmers in the west add iron and silica to their crops, they have to use iron chelate or silicic acid  – expensive chemicals which aren't great for the environment.
We’ve found that tiny particles of iron help the plant to grow, by improving the rate of photosynthesis (the way the plant catches the suns energy), and helping seeds to germinate. We've also found that tiny particles of silica help the plant to grow stronger and get bigger. We package our tiny particles with a natural protein, which not only helps the plant to take the minerals up, but help it to grow as well.
Our campaign will help us to speed up development, and allow us get this new technology directly to the people that need it most, rather than working through multinational agri-chemical companies. Going down that conventional route is likely to slow things down, and make the end product prohibitively expensive for those in the developing world. That is not our goal.
With your help, we can immediately improve the livelihoods of farmers in the developing world, improve the nutrition and health of the people they feed, and sustainably provide this technology to them cheaply, year after year.
 

What We Need
At the moment, our production process is slow and laborious – indeed a lot of it has to be done by hand. That limits the amount of product we can make, and makes it very expensive. But because we have a completely new product and process, we can’t just go out and buy production machinery to make it – the machinery doesn’t exist. Instead, we’re going to have to develop our production process and machinery ourselves, and that is where you come in. By contributing to our campaign, you’ll help us to scale up our production so that we can make the end product available and affordable to farmers in the developing world. We're a keen and experienced group of engineers and chemists. We're not rich, but we've already put a lot of our own money and time into getting the product this far. We feel now is the time to 'go big'. (We're also not creatives, as you can probably tell by our videos and artwork! More on that later...) 
We think we need around $100000 to get us to a place where we can make the product cheaply enough to be affordable for certain crops in the developing world. This amount will allow us to create a single production line. 
Here’s roughly how we get to that figure:


Method refinement and proving
$10000


Initial production machinery
$20000


Scaled up production machinery
$50000


Testing and independent accreditation of the product
$20000


 
We also need help proving out our product on plants. Lots of plants, in lots of environments. The more evidence we have that this approach can work, the more governments and NGO's will stand up and realize that traditional fertilizer is not the only way. 
 
What You Get
What do we give you in return for helping us? Well, we realize that the benefits of such a 'wonder fertilizer' may be hard to believe. And our trial production process is now providing us with small volumes of product. So what better way to show people the difference than to post out samples? For each donation of $10, we will post out a 1 gram sachet of additive from the first batches, which are being produced by hand right now! 1 gram of our additive is enough to dose 17.5 litres of water, which can then be used to water your plants in the normal way - with or without your usual fertilizer. Full instructions will be included with sample sachets. Ideally, if you have two plants side-by-side then you too can witness the difference by treating only one and not the other! If you're not a grower yourself, but believe this is a great project, there is the option to donate $5, which comes with a great big THANKYOU on our part.
Larger donations will receive further sachets, for instance enough for small greenhouses or vegetable gardens. Even better, if you want to get involved in working out just how good the fertilizer is, then please see the 'Big Science' section below!
 
What if we don't raise enough?
If we don’t get to our total, we'll be disappointed. However, we’ll have progressed a long way towards our goal and will have reduced the cost of the product substantially by starting to work through the steps above. We'll carry on investing our own time and money, but crucially, if we have to take venture capital funding, it may mean we lose control of the price of our product, preventing use in the developing world.
 
Big Science
Want to get involved in a worldwide trial? Then read on! We’ve tested our iron and silica on quite a few plants and got great results so far. But there’s a limit to the number of tests we can do; and that’s where you come in.
You can really help us by taking one of our science kits and growing some plants for us - some with our product and some without - then sharing your results. So, you might choose to grow blueberries. We’d ask you to plant four blueberry plants (or take four blueberry seedlings), and water them like this:

       Water only
       Water plus iron
       Water plus silica
       Water plus iron and silica

If you normally use plant food, then use that too, crucially making sure that each plant gets the same amount.
Then, over the weeks that follow, take some simple measurements and some photos, and tell us if the plant grew bigger and stronger, and whether it produced more fruit.
It doesn’t matter whether you grow indoors or outside.
Our science kits will provide everything you need to do the experiment except soil and seeds:

         4 pots
         Tape measure
         Watering can
         Iron and silica product
         Measuring cylinders
         Instructions

When you have some results, you can send them to us at results@yield-tech.co.uk, or post them on our facebook page. We'll keep a log of all the results, concentrating our efforts on promising crops first. We will post full credits to those who have helped.

 
Risks & Challenges
The obstacles we face in scaling up are understanding our production process in real detail, from the basic chemistry that’s going on, through the way the product flows through the process, and the physical and chemical limits that we need to stay within to produce quality product in volume.
We’ll do that by having the right equipment to measure and control the process, and getting the right people and outside help to work with us.

Additionally, if you are involved with a farm, agriculture, or market-garden/soup kitchen type charity, and would like to put yourselves forward to receive a donation once our production process is scaled up, then please do get in touch.

story:
Enna Chocolate is moving to Exeter and needs your support!

Our dream of having a large production space that is part bean-to-bar chocolate factory and part cafe with retail space is within reach!  We have found the perfect space in Exeter (hello neighborhood!) and our build-out has begun. The Covid-19 pandemic has slowed us down a bit but it won't stop us. Your help in this final push is needed more than ever so we can scale up production and say a big hello to all our new visitors in Exeter.

Some Background

In 2015 while working as a food photographer I learned that I could make chocolate at home. With a small investment of about $300 I bought a tabletop grinder, ordered a few pounds of fermented dried cocoa beans and started teaching myself the process. After months of trial and error I finally started getting the results I wanted and I started sharing my chocolate with the chefs I was doing food photography for. The chefs wanted to buy some. So I got a license to make chocolate for sale from our home kitchen. Chocolate requires a LOT more space than what's available in the typical home kitchen, so after I started receiving more orders than I could fulfill in that tiny space, my husband Matt and I built a production kitchen in Epping in 2017. Epping has provided a wonderful startup home for our business, and we will forever be grateful to the Epping community for their support and enthusiasm. However, Enna Chocolate is now bursting at the seams at the current location and we need room to grow!

Building the Dream

We love sharing our adventure that is chocolate, and we want to offer a broader chocolate experience to our customers than what is possible in our current space. So we have leased a new space in Exeter NH and we'll be able to expand our customer experience in the following ways:

  • EXPANDED chocolate tasting and retail area with a coffee bar.
  • A 6x6 foot glass viewing window so that visitors can watch the chocolate production process from the retail space.
  • BEVERAGES! We are SO excited to add coffee, espresso, and DRINKING CHOCOLATE to our offerings, plus a few other cacao related refreshments. Have you ever tried fresh cacao juice? Yum! 
  • A COMMUNITY SPACE ~ before there were coffee houses, did you know that the world's great cities had chocolate houses? Our 'chocolateria' will be a welcoming and inspiring place for all to gather. We LOVE the conversations and connections that are inspired by our chocolate craft, and we are very excited to offer a bigger and better space for these special interactions to happen.

We love sharing our chocolate journey with others, and hope you'll join us on this latest phase of our adventure!

What We Need & What You Get

We are seeking to raise at least $25,000. This will help us outfit the cafe with an espresso machine and all the accoutrements necessary to serve our favorite cacao, coffee, and tea beverages.  If we surpass our initial funding goal, we have a really special "stretch goal" in mind. 

In our previous Indiegogo campaign we learned that the most desired perk was CHOCOLATE. So this time around we're again offering our most popular chocolate perks, but we're also offering some fun cafe perks, and of course some very nifty swag.

What if we don't meet our funding goal? We are moving to Exeter no matter what. If we don't meet the initial funding goal, we will build the cafe service portion of our move in a later phase.

What if we surpass our funding goal? We have a couple of "stretch" goals for our fundraising campaign.

  • $25,000 = Rock & Roll Goal ~ Our initial goal will help us crank out our buildout, including coffee & espresso & drinking chocolate equipment
  • $30,000 = Nest Egg Goal ~ this will give us just a little bit of cushion so we can breath easier during the uncertainty brought to the months ahead of us by the Covid-19 pandemic.
  • $40,000 = Gussy Up Goal ~ If we surpass our initial goal by a LOT, we're excited to finally design custom moulds for our chocolate bars (we've been anxious to upgrade from the generic grid-bar design). 

Matt has lovingly restored the antique tin ceiling... the paint in this picture is primer ~ we can't wait for you to see the actual paint color that we chose!

Small Business, Worth Supporting

Fine chocolate made from heirloom cacao saves rainforest, supports farmers, and tastes amazing! Each cacao variety that we source is entirely traceable, fair and ethically produced, organic, and packed with fine flavor.

Enna Chocolate is a bootstrap startup. We will be doing most of the construction ourselves - which is quite in line with Enna's self-taught chocolate-making background, and her husband /business-partner Matt's custom woodworking and fine art skills.

We successfully met our goal in our previous (2016) Indiegogo fundraiser, thanks to the generous support of family, friends, neighbors, and fellow chocolate lovers. 

Risks & Challenges

We have doubled our production & revenues every year since starting in our home kitchen. We are confident that with our continued dedication to quality and fine flavor, there's no place to go but up.

Before COVID-19 the biggest challenge we faced was lack of a space to showcase our chocolate product and create the kind of experience that we wish for our customers to have. We are confident that we'll get through the COVID-19 pandemic, along with our fellow small business owners, and that we'll be able to continue to focus on our mission to make and share fine chocolate with our community and with the world. 

If we don't meet our funding goal, we are still moving forward with our move. If we don't meet our funding goal our plan is to roll out cafe service within a year. 

The impact of COVID-19 on our business and on this fundraiser

It has never been more important to support local businesses. In recent weeks we've had to shift the focus of our product sales from mostly direct in-store sales and wholesale to mostly online orders. We are grateful for the customers who until how have shopped for our chocolate at farmers markets and in other small stores (many of which are closed or only doing limited hours and operations) are continuing to support our business by shopping from us online. In addition, our partnership with Three Rivers Farm Alliance has introduced our chocolate to a whole new market. 

Online orders prepared for shipment. Online sales are an area of our business we've been wanting to invest more time and energy in, so the irony of this moment is not lost on us! 

The COVID-19 pandemic threw a big curveball at our buildout, as we carefully planned this project for the months of March and April.... and then the virus happened. We must limit the number of contractors who are working in the space at one time, and we've had to decline all of the generous offers of help from family and friends who were going to help us with different elements of the construction and the move: maintaining social distance is of utmost importance. Despite this, Matt has accomplished a TON of the construction by himself, and we have some really wonderful contractors who are able to continue working on a one-at-a-time schedule. While Matt works on the new space, Enna continues to manufacture and deliver her chocolate orders.

Chocolate manufacturing will continue, and when we finally CAN open the doors to welcome customers into our new space in Exeter, our business can only expand. After all, the world needs chocolate!

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Please share our campaign with your family and friends. 
  • You may use the Indiegogo share tools to post on facebook or by email. 
  • Shop for our chocolate! Visit our website ennachocolate.com to shop for chocolate.

Thank you for supporting local small business.

story:
We are a group of friends with a love for edible fungi. In 2014, we started the first and, until today, only relatively large-scale mushroom farm in Palestine. The idea for our project began over a BBQ, when we wanted to grill fresh mushrooms but could only find Israeli grown options. Israel imposes a military occupation that controls every single bit of our lives. 

So, on that fateful day, despite our hunger, we did not want to consume the Israeli mushrooms and could not see a reason why we couldn’t grow our own. So, we embarked on a journey of research, education, and training and set up the farm. We called it ‘Amoro', a name inspired by stories of the Amorites people who lived in Palestine around 2000 to 1600 BC.

Importing a top-quality spore infused compost from the Netherlands, we began producing closed-cap white mushrooms. Our staff consisted of women from local vulnerable communities. 

It didn’t take long for Amoro mushrooms to become a hit; people were eating all that we produced. And right when we thought about expanding and making our own compost, our reality of living under occupation hit home. 

Israeli authorities began to stall our compost imports, which must go through Israeli ports. Four containers containing compost were stalled at the Ashdod sea port an average of 49 days each time costing us more than $60,000 in port fees only. It was a clear targeting of our farm. We imported from the Netherlands, with whom Israel has very strong trade relations. We also bought from the same source Israeli mushroom farms buy from, but while Israeli farms continued to produce mushrooms with support and subsidy from their government, our production was stalled and our losses accumulated. 

We wrote to the port authorities through our lawyer each time but received no answer. We are now developing our legal challenge to what we believe are arbitrary restrictions imposed on us by Israel. It is a long process and in the meantime we need to continue to produce to maintain the farm.

We are asking your help to make up for some of what we lost in port fees.  Help us raise $30,000 which we will use to:

1- Build a compost storing space (refrigerated)  that will help us mitigate any similar obstacles we may face in the future and allow production continuity. This costs around $10,000

2- Ensure proper maintenance of the farm including by upgrading filters, sensors, humidifiers, growing nets, and pulling wench. These upgrades will ensure that we produce top quality and highly competitive product.  All will cost around $10,000

3- Buy a steam boiler to ensure best hygienic practice, costs around $10,000  

With your help we can keep producing, satisfying Palestinian love for mushrooms, maintaining independence, and investing in a better future for Amoro and our communities. 

Please donate any amount, every little helps. 

Please do get in touch, we will be more than happy to answer your questions or just chat with you about Amoro

story:
Short Summary

My name is Lesley Wills and I am the creator and owner of Follow Your Bliss Cafe in Bangor North Wales http://www.followyourblisspt.com. FYBliss Cafe was created 3 years ago within small shop in Bangor (we only can sit 15 max) which has lead to a continuing following of amazing customers who love what FYB Cafe does. We offer a totally gluten free and can be dairy free environment, and our food is freshly made and prepared by our amazing staff. People travel far and wide to experience our food along with our wide selection of hot and cold drinks, 

We are the only one of a few companies in the UK that make, bottle and sell commercially water kefir which is a natural unpasteurised probiotic drink gluten free and vegan. All our drinks can be made with organic dairy or nut milk.  Hot drinks like ayurvedic teas, golden milks, super food lattes made with chaga and lattes which are made with nut milk, adding matche, or moringa powder, Our smoothies and juices (including hot juices) are a big hit in FYBliss so we sell the mixes for people to take home and make. With locally roasted Poblado coffee, made fresh in house and stocked on our shelves along with other Welsh products we can give our customers a take home taste of Wales. By supporting the plastic free movement by using only stainless steel straws in our Cafe when serving drinks and offering reusable smoothie cups and fair trade stainless steel elephant tins, we are carving out a market of being inventive and supporting, which to us here at FYBliss the only way forward and that is why we have seen our following grow.

FYB is like no other side by side with our food we offer sell out talks and workshops on topics such as Food as your Medicine, and including Ayurvedic cooking. I have spent three years growing this cafe and it is truly a success story. 

This campaign is about raising money for the fit out of our new venture Follow Your Bliss Cafe mark 2, which is still in Bangor...hooray I hear the people of Bangor cry. This place has more space in fact an extra 3 floors, along with a basement. The ground floor will be our Cafe seating up too 30 - 40 covers along with a large takeaway shop. The upper floors will made into 2 small Yoga / Pilates studios and several therapy rooms which will offer, sound therapy. EFT, nutritional advice, just to name a few, along with our always over subscribed workshops and talks. 

We need this space to show people what food can do for your health and wellbeing along side complimentary therapies that help support our bodies.

With your support this can happen it’s something that Bangor so badly needs... well I feel every city needs. So many people want to eat clean along with wanting a deeper understanding of how to support their bodies by eating what is right for them 

What We Need & What You Get

I need to raise £16,000. This will go to fitting out the Cafe. So buying equipment like cookers extra fridges and of course tables chairs. I want it to look amazing and the basement toilet needs an overhaul. 

When you fund us we will be offering some amazing perks. From having a wall with your name emblazoned on it. To being invited to the grand opening event. Free access to our cookery courses and food workshops along with passes for free dinning out experiences 

I am going for the flexible crowd funding which means that what ever I raise I get to keep it’s slightly higher percentage rate but I know we will reach it as this is such a great project 

The Impact

This amazing cafe will not only give FYBliss Cafe a wider audience but by transforming this property into a space of health and wellbeing will increase the energy and vitality to this part of Bangor, North Wales. We have shown our worth in little FYBliss by the large growing following we have and now the next step awaits.

Risks & Challenges

There are risks it is a big project and lots of areas to cover employing more staff creating a larger kitchen, getting the balance right in food and shop. Having worked in the first FYBliss for three years I have encounter a lot of problems from staffing to cash flow which has taught me huge amounts I know whatever tricky situation is encountered I can call on past experiences to find a solution my inner voice is of one of "we can work it out" and if not I always know a person who can..

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

If contributing with money is out for you, then we would like you to help by spreading the word and sharing this with friends family coming along and supporting us when we open our doors and just being you. 

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it Always Follow your Bliss

.
story_txt:
Short Summary

My name is Lesley Wills and I am the creator and owner of Follow Your Bliss Cafe in Bangor North Wales http://www.followyourblisspt.com. FYBliss Cafe was created 3 years ago within small shop in Bangor (we only can sit 15 max) which has lead to a continuing following of amazing customers who love what FYB Cafe does. We offer a totally gluten free and can be dairy free environment, and our food is freshly made and prepared by our amazing staff. People travel far and wide to experience our food along with our wide selection of hot and cold drinks, 
We are the only one of a few companies in the UK that make, bottle and sell commercially water kefir which is a natural unpasteurised probiotic drink gluten free and vegan. All our drinks can be made with organic dairy or nut milk.  Hot drinks like ayurvedic teas, golden milks, super food lattes made with chaga and lattes which are made with nut milk, adding matche, or moringa powder, Our smoothies and juices (including hot juices) are a big hit in FYBliss so we sell the mixes for people to take home and make. With locally roasted Poblado coffee, made fresh in house and stocked on our shelves along with other Welsh products we can give our customers a take home taste of Wales. By supporting the plastic free movement by using only stainless steel straws in our Cafe when serving drinks and offering reusable smoothie cups and fair trade stainless steel elephant tins, we are carving out a market of being inventive and supporting, which to us here at FYBliss the only way forward and that is why we have seen our following grow.
FYB is like no other side by side with our food we offer sell out talks and workshops on topics such as Food as your Medicine, and including Ayurvedic cooking. I have spent three years growing this cafe and it is truly a success story. 
This campaign is about raising money for the fit out of our new venture Follow Your Bliss Cafe mark 2, which is still in Bangor...hooray I hear the people of Bangor cry. This place has more space in fact an extra 3 floors, along with a basement. The ground floor will be our Cafe seating up too 30 - 40 covers along with a large takeaway shop. When you fund us we will be offering some amazing perks. From having a wall with your name emblazoned on it. To being invited to the grand opening event. Free access to our cookery courses and food workshops along with passes for free dinning out experiences 
I am going for the flexible crowd funding which means that what ever I raise I get to keep it’s slightly higher percentage rate but I know we will reach it as this is such a great project

We have shown our worth in little FYBliss by the large growing following we have and now the next step awaits.

There are risks it is a big project and lots of areas to cover employing more staff creating a larger kitchen, getting the balance right in food and shop. Having worked in the first FYBliss for three years I have encounter a lot of problems from staffing to cash flow which has taught me huge amounts I know whatever tricky situation is encountered I can call on past experiences to find a solution my inner voice is of one of "we can work it out" and if not I always know a person who can..
Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
-Who We Are & What We Do-

Hello! We are Major & Jennifer Clark - husband & wife team- and the owners/operators of Elopers. Elopers is a small venue wedding service based in Frederick, MD. We provide intimate elopements for couples and other full-scale wedding services. We aim to serve couples who desire intimate and memorable elopements, as well as couples looking for quality and affordable wedding services. Today, we have united over 100 individuals in wedded bliss and desire to reach more!

We are asking your help with one last bit of financing for our new brick and mortar location in the Arts & Entertainment district of Hagerstown, MD. Having this location will help our small business get to the next level. Elopers’ headquarters will house the city's first wedding chapel styled venue  for elopements and small ceremonies! 

Major and I have invested a great deal into this business and have a passion for what we do. We are asking you to plant a seed of love to help us grow.

- What We Need-

We are asking donors for $6,000 to be used for final renovations of our new location. As a thank you, we are offering some great personalized gifts and recognition – which include: a shout-out on the donor page of our website- www.Elopers.net,  personalized hand-etched glasses, your name prominently displayed on the donor wall in our offices and MORE! 

Our campaign consists of a flexible goal. In the event we do not reach it, all contributions will still be used towards smaller renovation projects.

-The Impact-

Your contribution will help further our dream and our small business. In uncertain times as these, we enjoy bringing LOVE & HAPPINESS to people from all walks of life. Help us continue!

Supporting this campaign is also an excellent way to support the Shop Small movement. When you donate, it not only helps us, but also other small businesses that we will use as vendors, as well as local businesses we will partner with. It’s the gift that keeps on giving and every gift counts!

In 2015, we introduced our new business model to Western Maryland and it has grown exponentially in just three short years. We are anticipating the same growth or even more with our new venue.

There are always risk and challenges when embarking on a small business journey.  Fortunately, we have been established for 3 years in the DC, Virginia and Maryland wedding market and have been fortunate enough to work with industry leaders who have mentored us well. While we can’t account for all challenges, we are certain with your support, we can achieve great things.

We are appreciative of everyone who has been with us since the beginning, those just joining and everyone in between. If you are unable to support financially, please share and help us get the word out. Thank you in advance!

story:
Short Summary

  • My name is Tracy Stocker and I have been involved in animal rescue since moving to Oregon in 1997. My career in veterinary medicine spanned 15 years and I focused on feline care as cats are my passion.  In addition, I became actively involved in local cat rescue in 2012 and have held 6 positions with agencies including Core Paws, Cat Adoption Team, Felines First Rescue and Animal Aid, Inc. I even have a job that focuses on cat care as I have owned and operated my own small business, When You're Not There Pet Care, here in Oregon since 2009. I live, breathe and sleep felines! Anything I can do to provide them and their caregivers with the best, most up to date health, behavior and welfare information is my goal. Happy, healthy cats live long and tranquil lives! 
  • My Indiegogo campaign to get Purrs and Pastries Cat Cafe up and running is based on the idea that Portland is ready for it's next cat cafe featuring highly adoptable, friendly cats and kittens searching for their forever families! I will build a cafe featuring some of the area's best and favorite cupcakes, pies and cakes along with delectable coffee, teas and juices from local businesses. Portland is proud of it's home-grown artisans and the closeness and support we show each other; my cat cafe will also host a small art gallery featuring local crafters along with a retail area with some of the best cat themed tees, jewelry, gifts, toys and enrichment supplies. Everything a kitty caregiver could need!
  • By contributing to our campaign to launch our start up, you will not only make a huge difference in the lives of local cats needing families, but also with supporting a much needed retail space that will foster community togetherness, feature local special events and fun activities and a great place to relax and enjoy truly delectable desserts! There will be something for everyone at Purrs and Pastries Cat Cafe! Especially if you are a lover of all things feline. 

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need to fundraise $30,000 to cover our startup costs including rent, construction, cafe equipment & supplies and cat room "catification" and our fundraising Perks gifts. The cafe and cat room will be outfitted with comfortable and stylish seating and tables along with a few lounging chairs and sofas. We will also offer key-lock lockers for your personal belongings so nothing gets lost, stepped on or stolen while you are visiting the kitties. 
  • You'll love the decor with light and bright colors, soothing color schemes and interesting and unique textures; for the comfort of cats and people alike. 
  • If we don't reach our full goal, all donated funds will go towards the most immediate need which is securing the leased property. We would need to look at starting "smaller" by having less square feet than originally hoped for; thus limiting the size of the cafe and retail spaces. Once the property is leased, the primary goal is to offer the cats the larger room space, with the cafe being one half the square footage of the cat room. 

The Impact

  • This campaign is valuable to the community because it will fill a niche on Portland's west side. Adoptable cats and kittens will find temporary housing in the Cat Room and will be available to meet so many folks which will help socialize them and prepare them to meet their forever family. 
  • This venture will be my 4th small business in the PNW (3 in Oregon and 1 in Washington) and I know that I will not only bring my business skills, love of cats and enthusiasm to this concept; but also my heart. Helping cats, and the people who love them, is what really makes me tick. I've spent the past 9 years building my other small business (When You're Not There Pet Care) and have garnered so much happiness, a great base of clients and a real level of success in my career. I know that with the connections that I have made in the animal welfare community in the Portland area; this too will be a wonderful place for cat lovers to come and enjoy their time spent in a great atmosphere with really great food and beverages!
  • Portland's homeless cat population continues to grow year by year; I know that by adding the newest concept in 'adoption centers' via a brand new Cat Cafe....we will find hundreds of cats and kittens their forever homes! 

Risks & Challenges

There are always challenges that present themselves when opening a new small business! As an entrepreneur, I know that hurdles are meant to be overcome. Since I have run 3 other small pet related businesses in the Pacific Northwest since 1998; I feel that I have garnered a lot of experience and problem solving skills over the years. Combining my past career experiences in retail management, food and beverage industry and well, ....being 'the boss' has provided me with a firm foundation to grow upon. I feel that all of my past jobs, skills, experiences and knowledge from all of my other endeavors have culminated to bring me here; to opening Purrs and Pastries Cat Cafe. 

  • I think the largest risks are associated with owning and operating a food and beverage establishment focusing on offering pastries, desserts, coffees, teas and other light beverages.  There are many food and beverage choices in the community and being proactive in advertising and marketing will be critical to our success.  I know that the food and beverage items we plan to carry are great quality items and many community members already love them. Having another venue to dine in or carry them out will appeal to many folks and their families. 
  • My plan for overcoming challenges is to gather information; from patrons, from staff members and volunteers and other cat cafe owners. There are unique instances that apply only to cat cafes: cats transmitting zoonotic diseases to visitors, cats potentially injuring visitors, cats escaping from the cat room, etc. Combining a cafe and a cat adoption center will be new; but the trend of cat cafes has already hit the US and many business owners are friendly with each other and willing to lend helpful advice. We are all in the game to get more homeless cats adopted while offering wonderful, tasty treats in a spot that is fun and relaxing. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • We'd love if you could help us raise much needed funds to cover the initial start up costs, but if you can't, we'd appreciate you spreading the word among your cat (and cupcake) loving friends, family and neighbors! 
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools to help us share our venture! By visiting or just sharing our dream-come-true by word of mouth.....you're helping! Thank you!

Having another venue to dine in or carry them out will appeal to many folks and their families. 
My plan for overcoming challenges is to gather information; from patrons, from staff members and volunteers and other cat cafe owners.
