We are all in the game to get more homeless cats adopted while offering wonderful, tasty treats in a spot that is fun and relaxing. 


Other Ways You Can Help

We'd love if you could help us raise much needed funds to cover the initial start up costs, but if you can't, we'd appreciate you spreading the word among your cat (and cupcake) loving friends, family and neighbors! 
Please use the Indiegogo share tools to help us share our venture! By visiting or just sharing our dream-come-true by word of mouth.....you're helping! Thank you!

story:
Tiny house in Camp Pod Ostrog is based on the idea that unforgettable adventure shouldn't have to cost a fortune. Our overall goal is to create a complex of  tiny houses throughout the most naturally beautiful areas of Camp Pod Ostrog. Our unique houses will blur the line between camping and staying in a luxury cabin and will truly deliver an experience to remember.

 

This campaign is to help us launch our first tiny house, in Camp Pod Ostrog. Overlooking one of our states most prized tourist place, Monastery Ostrog, our first tiny home is designed with you in mind and combines all the fun of camping in the great outdoors with the must-have amenities.



From the outdoor cooking and dining areas with beautiful view, and tiny house big enough to sleep 4, we aim to deliver one thing: an unforgettable experience for our guests. 

By contributing to our campaign, you're helping us reimagine the way we explore our village and Montenegro.

WHY ARE WE FUNDING ON INDIEGOGO?

Our campground and property have already been visited by over 80 guests in one month period and are and are even receiving guests in the camping off-season . We are funding on Indiegogo to assist in financing the camp and rural development phase which is currently underway.

 
 
All the Fun of Camping, None of the Hassle!

Escaping your daily grind doesn't mean you have to give up the comforts of home. We will blur the line between camping and staying in a cabin by providing all the freedom and flexibility of camping with the added benefit of modern amenities you'll love!

Camp Site Amenities:

  • Fire Pit 
  • Village Superior Views
  • Places to Set Up a Tent
  • Provided Camp Fire Cookware & More!

 

Tiny House Amenities:

  • 3 bed, 1 sofa and a dining table
  • Bathroom with Shower included near tiny house
  • Kitchen with Stove Top & Fridge
  • Clean Linens Provided
  • Wifi & Streaming Services
  • Air Conditioning &  Heating
  • Solar panel
  • On Demand Hot Water & More!

Have Questions or Need Clarification?

Contact Milan, Founder of Camp Pod Ostrog, directly at www.podostrog.me and he will respond within 24 hours! Keep in mind that many answers can be found by reading this entire page. :)

Explore the MUST SEE Monastery Ostrog that is less then an hour hiking from Tiny House! Pictured below is the Monastery Ostrog.

Built in Ostroške Grede Mountain clifsf - with million visitors through out the year

Pet Friendly!

What's a vacation without your dog?! Bring your furry companion with you during your adventure in Montenegro! The hiking trails are the perfect place for them to explore too. Plus, we will have waste bags available outside the home for when your four legged friend does their business. ;)

You're Part of the Team!

In order to make Tiny House a reality, we need your help.

The tiny house and property already have a community that is going to support us, but your contributions create a larger community that will enjoy our campground and village itself. 

By supporting Tiny House in Camp Pod Ostrog, you're not only backing our vision, you are also becoming an indispensable part of our team. Your insights and feedback will help us create a destination that will be unlike any other in Montenegro!

We have prepared a lot of perks for supporters - from handmade gifts, online stores, pre-book and time shared ownerships!

Love and share is also a great contribution!

 

Backer Contributions Will Go Towards:

Materials and handwork: We will buy and transport all materials needed for tiny house to be built.

Indoor & Outdoor Furnishings: Mattresses, linens, cookwares, indoor/outdoor seating, outdoor lighting, solar panel & more.

Unique Extras: If we're able to raise enough, we would also love to add additional amenities to really push the guest experience at tiny house to the next level. Some of those extras include outdoor bluetooth speakers, unique lounge swings, professional anti-mosquito treatments or even a climate controlled stargazing dome!

If we are able to raise more funds, we will also start building another tiny house, so the idea of a complex of complex will be  happening. Your support now will provide a more immersive experience at Camp Pod Ostrog as soon as we finisg building Tiny House.

Project Challenges

Though we already have decided about the Tiny house project and its place in Camp, there are always challenges with a project of this size. The biggest challenge we face is the timeline. Weather and temperature will play an important role in how soon the building process will be finished. That said, the amount of building needed is relatively small and should only take a matter of weeks to two months to complete.

We are  ready to get to work as soon as possible. Overall, we are extremely optimistic that we will meet our expected timeline to begin accepting guests in December of 2018.

Your insights and feedback will help us create a destination that will be unlike any other in Montenegro!We have prepared a lot of perks for supporters - from handmade gifts, online stores, pre-book and time shared ownerships!Love and share is also a great contribution! Backer Contributions Will Go Towards:Materials and handwork: We will buy and transport all materials needed for tiny house to be built.Indoor & Outdoor Furnishings: Mattresses, linens, cookwares, indoor/outdoor seating, outdoor lighting, solar panel & more.Unique Extras: If we're able to raise enough, we would also love to add additional amenities to really push the guest experience at tiny house to the next level. Some of those extras include outdoor bluetooth speakers, unique lounge swings, professional anti-mosquito treatments or even a climate controlled stargazing dome!If we are able to raise more funds, we will also start building another tiny house, so the idea of a complex of complex will be  happening. Your support now will provide a more immersive experience at Camp Pod Ostrog as soon as we finisg building Tiny House.Project ChallengesThough we already have decided about the Tiny house project and its place in Camp, there are always challenges with a project of this size. The biggest challenge we face is the timeline. Weather and temperature will play an important role in how soon the building process will be finished. That said, the amount of building needed is relatively small and should only take a matter of weeks to two months to complete.We are  ready to get to work as soon as possible. Overall, we are extremely optimistic that we will meet our expected timeline to begin accepting guests in December of 2018.

story:
Welcome to Bushcraft Ridge

UPDATE: We have secured our first $25,000 through private funding, allowing us to purchase the land!  So we are officially open for business!  Book now and come enjoy the Ridge anytime!  Your contribution will go toward launching our veteran's, women's, and youth outreach programs, as well as improving our amenities and educational offerings!

Hi! I'm Brad Nelson, a combat veteran of Operation Iraqi Freedom. When I returned home, I discovered I had to fight a different kind of battle---a battle to make sense of the world, to find my place in it, and to find peace of mind. I was blessed to discover the art of bushcraft---the art of thriving in the natural environment and acquiring the skills necessary to do so.

By reconnecting with nature and learning self-reliance and primitive survival skills, I found my center. I found peace. I found the confidence and positive spirit that allowed me to re-engage the world. And I want to help others do the same.

My partner in this venture, Nathan Copeland, fought a similar battle after an outdoor adventure turned into a real-life survival situation. He knows first hand the lifesaving value of wilderness survival skills.   After making it home, he doubled down in his commitment to learning bushcraft skills---skills he used living for a year off the grid in the remote Lost Coast wilderness area.  

Together, we are starting Bushcraft Ridge to share our life-saving experiences and the joy of bushcraft and wilderness survival with our friends, our community, and anyone else in need.  

Bushcraft Ridge will provide primitive camping space dedicated to learning and practicing bushcraft in an unadulterated old-growth forest between the Cumberland River and the 20,000-acre Cheatham County Wildlife Management reserve---all a mere 15 minutes northwest of Nashville, TN, and only 40 minutes from Clarksville and Fort Campbell.  

Furthermore, we will engage in constant fundraising to provide this opportunity free of charge to those in need. Studies have shown that bushcraft is effective treatment helping combat veterans and battered women alike overcome PTSD, as well as alleviating anxiety, depression, and the stress of modern life.  We will be working with veteran's groups, inner-city youth programs, and battered women's shelters to make sure we reach those who need this life-changing and life-saving opportunity most.

Did you know you can help us raise money simply by shopping at Amazon through our associate link? Click here: Bushcraft Gear 

 

What We Need & What You Get

Goal Markers

$1,500: We can launch our tree identification program.

$2,500: We can purchase basic training gear.

$5,000: We can launch our wilderness education programs. 

$7,500: We can have onsite shipping containers to store training gear.

$10,000:  We can dig a well.

$15,000: We can purchase a basic ATV to shuttle people with disabilities up the ridge.

$25,000: We can launch our combat-disabled veterans program

$30,000: We can launch our inner-city youth and women-in-recovery programs.

$40,000:We can improve our package offerings

$80,000: We can add 10 more acres to the property.

 

 

The Impact

Your donation will give someone in need a life-saving experience. It is proven that spending time in nature reduces stress, anxiety, and depression and improves general mental health and well-being.  And studies have shown time outdoors is effective treatment for combat veterans as well as abused women suffering PTSD. Bushcraft Ridge is the only primitive camping experience in the region dedicated to community outreach. We will continually raise funds to to pay for attendance and supplies for those who need them most, while also maintaining the natural beauty of the property.

Equal to our commitment to community is our commitment to the environment. Bushcraft Ridge will preserve a unique swath of Tennessee hill country in its raw and natural state. Our programs are designed with conservation in mind. By selectively removing dead-standing trees and clearing underbrush, we will actually improve the health of the forest. And by thoughtfully scheduling attendance, we will prevent overcrowding and draining the forest's resources.

 

Risks & Challenges

There are many campgrounds out there. So what sets Bushcraft Ridge apart? 

  • More than just a camping experience, Bushcraft Ridge allows attendees to use the landscape and all it offers to practice primitive survival skills, from fire starting to trapping to shelter building---all done with conservation in mind using methods that actually improve the forest, instead of stripping it of its resources.
  • We are huge fans of bushcraft schools, like the Pathfinder School. But their programs are highly intensive. They require weeks of physical training before even an able-bodied adult should attend. And the cost can be prohibitive for many. Bushcraft Ridge will offer a more recreational experience that is also educational. We want you to be able to learn the joy of bushcrafting no matter your age, physical health, or finances.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Did you know you can help us raise money simply by shopping at Amazon through our associate link? Click here: Bushcraft Gear 

If you are a member of a veterans organization or other group interested in Bushcraft Ridge, don't hesitate to reach out.

Thank you for taking the time to learn about our little paradise in the woods! Please donate or share this campaign, and we hope to see you at the Ridge!!!

story:
What is the Bean Center for Gifted Enrichment and Support?

The Bean Center (TBC) is a unique gifted enrichment center, dreamed up and founded by a veteran teacher (me!) with a love for gifted kids and a passion for making a difference in the lives of children.

I was so tired, year after year, of the lack of services for my middle school gifted kids. One teacher for the whole school? No program? It was an afterthought in most cases. And finally, I said, enough. We should just outsource the parts of gifted programming that are missing.

So here I am.

Our model is exciting in that we serve gifted students outside of the typical school experience. Think of us like “gifted outpatient care”-- almost like a Kumon learning center meets group therapy meets an internship, mixed with hands-on activities, guest speakers and sprinkled with teacher and parent trainings and...voila! 

We serve small groups of students ages 10-15 (kids outside of that welcome, but that is the target) in three areas: 

Explorations, where we play and dig deeply into high interest topics

Survival, which is a social-emotional course designed specifically for gifted students (this has a parent component)

And Genius Hour, which are student-led, teacher-guided passion projects assisted by a community mentor as appropriate. These projects promote productive struggle, motivation, soft skills, and support students’ areas of relative weakness, and result in an outcome specific to the student and the project (for example, a 3-D printed collapsible snowboard or a photography exhibit that deal with stress). 

The sky is the limit, and students can repeat the modules as often as they like (the goal is to have different levels and topics in the survival pod once we have multiple staff).

We also do parent and teacher trainings to help the adults better serve and support gifted behavior development.

What We Need & What You Get

What we need:

  • TBC is a brand-new enrichment program, and we need your help to launch with a bang for our gifted students!
  • Our $25,000 goal will allow us to purchase a cart of high-quality chromebooks, STEM toys, ipads, a green screen and recording equipment and software for student projects.
  • It will allow us to pay an honorarium to guest speakers.
  • We will purchase paint, flexible seating, books for our library, snacks for our parent lounge, and classroom supplies.
  • It will allow us to cover insurance, marketing, and operating expenses while we register students and serve our first pods.

What you get:

Check out our Perks!

  • Every contributor receives 10% off any classes for life. 
  • All perks are cumulative.
  • We will display your name, quote and/or logo on a wall in our center at the $250 level and up, and at the $1000 level, you will be featured on our website as well so all of our clients can meet our top-level supporters. 
  • We are supported by a great local artist, Ungala Grace (@ungalagrace on Instagram!) who has agreed to offer prints and even a custom Soul Painting at different donor levels, too! The Soul Painting has a $600 value and is an heirloom quality piece just for you.
  • The Owl print will vary based on design.
  • The Collage print will also vary.

We will reach out to you for custom information. 

The Impact

Gifted kids need something different! I have been a teacher for 17 years, and I am tired of watching things that don't work.

So, we seek to bridge the gap between what these children need and what they get. 

We believe that having a gifted brain is like a superpower, and that gifted students are misunderstood and underserved (#savecerberalsuperheroes!)

We believe that today, we may require such superheroes to save the world. Why, then, is education towards students who achieve differently on the *other* end of the bell curve so abysmal and piecemeal? 

Shouldn’t we be devoting resources toward these very students?

We believe the answer is yes.

That’s why we are doing what we do.  

So while there might be special schools for gifted students, or even enrichment centers, there isn’t anything quite like The Bean Center. 

Won’t you help us?

Gifted students need more! The testing culture in schools as well as the variety of student needs vs funding and available staff make this type of education less of a priority.

The Bean Center is changing the way gifted education services are delivered with our small group, explorations and social-emotional-based models. Families need more options, gifted kids need more support to develop gifted behaviors, and 

I have implemented a program in public school with fantastic impact. Here is a quick video with some examples of the projects kids presented one year: Genius Hour essential questions

It is important to realize that *any* student not getting what they need is likely to be anxious and disenchanted, as well as disengaged. The risk is great for gifted students due to the way services are both constructed and rendered. 

Sure, some schools have great programs, but not everyone has access to them. Waitlists, yearly tuition fees, and stringent admissions criteria restrict the number of students that can access these programs. 

The Bean Center evaluates each case and allows students into the center to explore and develop skills what will help these students reach their best possible outcomes-- whether they are have access to a school gifted program or not, for whatever reason.

Risks & Challenges

Our biggest challenge is making sure students and parents learn about us. We also need to stay on top of keeping technology in the center. With only one teacher right now, we can only offer so many sessions per evening, too. Once we have steady enrollment, we would like to have 3-4 teachers per center, then multiple centers to keep the small and intimate learning community feel.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you’re able to donate financially, great!

If not, we understand and thank you for reading on. You can still help us by sharing our campaign, referring a child, or following us on social media and sharing our content. We believe this is an important mission and we are pleased to have you on board in *any* way!

Thank you so much for your support!

Love, 

Sandy Bean

Founder of The Bean Center

story:
We want to raise $100 from 10,000 people to help invest in black-owned food businesses.

Who Is Black Food Collective?

Black Food Collective was founded in 2017, we started off as an organization that wanted to support black-owned food businesses, we did by hosting different community events, but now we have grown into a business incubator focusing on food businesses.
 

In the midst of COVID-19, many black-owned food businesses were hit hard, most of them were already hanging on but this pandemic has placed even more adversity. In July 2020 Black Food Collective launch EPIC Ventures Test Kitchen, a food incubator space that invests in black-owned food businesses. We host weekly popup events, rent kitchen space at a discounted rate, and we mentor these businesses to help them sustain during this time, and prepare for the future.

Many black-owned businesses didn't receive the PPE loan set out to help businesses sustain while closed due to the COVID-19. Historically black-owned businesses have always been underfunded and supported because of systemic racism which doesn't allow these businesses to grow and leave a foundation of wealth to their children. Its time for US to change that system.

Our goal is to invest in the businesses over the next 5 years will plan to invest in 30 black-owned food businesses at least $200k each. We are creating spaces for these businesses to thrive.

Some of our projects:

EPIC Ventures Test Kitchen, currently open. A food incubator program for black-owned businesses. Hosting weekly popup events.

The Town Hall Oakland, opening fall 2022. Is an outdoor food mart with twelve mini restaurants made out of shipping containers, featuring all black-owned businesses.

https://youtu.be/b8UFDG8f3J0

EPIC Ventures Ghost Kitchen, date TBD, is the first black-owned ghost kitchen that will offer 25-40 300/sqft kitchens to members of the Black Food Collective. What are Ghost Kitchens?

Our Founder:

Celebrity Chef and Chopped Champion Chef Rashad Armstead. Chef Rashad has over 17 years in the foodservice industry and has first-hand knowledge of the struggles of owning a food business, so in 2017 he founded Black Food Collective as a way to support and bring these businesses together. Chef has the heart to see black-owned businesses succeed, he's not calling for equality but he's demanding EQUITY.

The Campaign

We have all seen the current events that are happening in our country and now this generation is demanding change, this is why we would like to raise at least $100 from 10,000 people to invest in black-owned food businesses. We just don't want to see these businesses be sustained, its time to see these businesses THRIVE.

Please join us and share this with everyone you know, you have the opportunity to make sure that black-owned food businesses are a staple in every community and that they have equal opportunity to THRIVE.

"WE ONLY WIN TOGETHER"

story:
Esperanza Soaps: Empowering families to lift themselves from poverty. 

Esperanza Soaps is an innovative company placed in Las Malvinas, a low income neighborhood in the heart of Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic. Our factory will produce handcrafted, all-natural soaps with the island's showcase ingredients. Our soap will be made by the women of Las Malvinas, who will have now a steady income. We'll sell our soaps to several customer segments - such as tourists and businesses - on the island and abroad.

MADE FOR HOPE. We placed our soap factory inside Las Malvinas, to bring jobs and empowerment to women that want a brighter future for themselves and their children. Esperanza Soaps hires and trains the women of Las Malvinas, most of whom have not had the opportunity of a steady job, and struggle to make ends meet.

DOMINICAN GOODNESS - A SOAP YOU’RE HAPPY TO USE AND PROUD TO GIVE TO OTHERS. Esperanza Soaps are unique: made with the best of the Caribbean - all natural, local ingredients like coconuts, mangoes and passion fruit; cacao, coffee and rum, herbs grown locally such as lavender, peppermint and aloe. We offer deep moisturizing soaps, aloe-based soaps to keep your skin smooth and healthy, a wide variety of exfoliating soaps and soaps for the morning, the evening and special occasions. It’s good for you, and a perfect, meaningful gift for those you love!

SOAP MAKES LIFE BETTER.  We make soap because soap is good for you! Most of us take soap for granted, but it has the power to keep us clean and healthy, and it helps prevent sickness like diarrhea or infectious diseases. In one year two million children are killed from diarrhea. 41 percent of these tragic deaths could be prevented by the simple act of hand washing with clean water and soap. Esperanza Soaps will make soap available for the community of Las Malvinas, and implement hand washing programs for kids and adults. In a place without a sewer system like Las Malvinas, soap can make a huge impact and save lives.  

We’re a team of 35 passionate staff and volunteers from all around the world that have worked diligently to get our soap business ready. And now we’re good to go! We need your pledge to get this business off the ground!

Why a soap factory, and why Las Malvinas?

We’re starting our factory in Las Malvinas because there we’ve met strong devoted women we truly believe in. With your pledge we can run our company for a full year: hire a team of business professionals and women. We can equip a soap factory in the community and start producing our all natural, dominican soaps. Soap making is easy to learn, can be made in a kitchen, and will allow us to scale production quickly. For more information, please continue reading.

We believe poverty is wrong. We can, and must, eradicate it. We’ve started Esperanza Soaps because it’s a chance to empower women to lift themselves and their families from poverty for good.

No one should be condemned to live a life of poverty. Not here. Not anywhere.

Esperanza Soaps focuses on women employment because we’ve seen how the mothers in this community go far and beyond to invest in their children and their futures. They put their income into sending their sons and daughters to school, to keep them well-fed and healthy. We share their hope for their children, and we’ve created Esperanza Soaps as a way of putting means in their hands to do so.

1.  What do you need the money for?

When we meet our goal of $75,000, we will have working capital for 1 year.

We will:

a.  Hire staff: Five women in the community will be trained in making/curing soap. We will also send Kevin Moforte (see below for a short bio) as the manager of Esperanza Soaps for one year. We also need local business staff (design, marketing and sales), a security guard, etc.

b.  Equip a soap factory/laboratory: A soap lab requires a space with power and utilities. Making soap needs a modern oven, a stove  and a long list of tools, utensils  and shelf space.

c.  Purchase the materials for first batch. All the basic ingredients we require can be purchased locally and in bulk.

d.  Set up sales channels.  Most of our customers frequent the same locations. We are exploring the most efficient setup and partnerships to distribute our products.

e.  Transportation: A (used) pickup truck for daily operations.


2.  Why are you making soap?

Soap is easy to learn how to make. It’s a lot like making bread – almost anyone can pick it up, but not everyone will practice enough to become good at making it. It also involves lots of creativity – to combine new ingredients successfully, to come up with new recipes and to try new scents.

a.  Soap can be made in a kitchen. A company making large amounts of soap, like Esperanza Soaps, needs a large space to cure the soaps for several weeks, but the making of the soap itself can be done in a large kitchen with an oven.

b. Soap making is scalable. In one afternoon a team can make 12 bars of soap or 1200 bars of soap.

c. Soap is good for you. One of the goals in creating this company was to create products that make life better. Soap is one of them, especially in communities without sewerage like Las Malvinas.

d. The ingredients needed to make soap are easily procured. The main ingredients are oils and lye, which are readily available in the Dominican Republic.  

3.  Who are you going to sell the soap to?

Our target customer segments are tourists and high income Dominicans. Every year, five million tourists come to the country to enjoy its sandy beaches and resorts. These tourists bring back home millions of dollars’ worth of souvenirs and gifts such as rum, tobacco and handcrafted goods. The Dominican government is investing heavily to double the number of visitors by 2022, so our main consumer market will expand strongly in the next years.

4.  How do you know this business will be a success?

Every business venture has risks. We have been diligently researching and consulting with a talented team of professionals to understand our industry and market dynamics. Among the people working with us are business professors and students of the Isenberg School of Management of UMass Amherst, social entrepreneurs, business owners, and nonprofit directors.

First, our soaps are already generating demand. We are receiving offers for our soaps in the price range we expect to sell on the island. In customer product testing, our soaps are consistently described as premium and high quality. People comment very favorably on their feel, smell and appearance, and the social impact the soaps’ production has increases their value for our target customers.

Second, we are at the confluence of three promising trends:

a)  Demand for handmade, natural products is on the rise. In markets across the world handmade soap has appeared as a response for people’s desire to use natural soaps that do not contain harmful or synthetic chemicals.

b)  Tourists, especially Millennials, which are our main customer segment, are expected to double in the coming years.

c)  Demand for premium goods is on the rise in the Dominican Republic. Economic growth has spurred a middle and high income population demanding premium goods.

Third, we know the community and the culture.

Our team and manager have extensive experience working in the Caribbean. We started a pilot last year making soap in the community, proving not only the interest the people have, the availability of space and workers, but also the ease to procure materials.


5.  Why did you choose Las Malvinas in Santo Domingo to start this company with?

Kevin Moforte, the founder of Upward Ventures, has been working with the families of Las Malvinas for over seven years. As a result, our organization has a deep relationship with them; we know most of the families and most of the families know us. We’ve partnered with them in several projects that have improved the quality of life of the families in the past years. Over time, our joint work has evolved from attending the emergency of some families to community-based projects for hundreds of families.

Working in Las Malvinas allows us to partner with Practivistas Dominicana  - a student group from Humboldt State University and Universidad Iberoamericana that co-constructs solutions with communities like Las Malvinas. Their innovative projects aim at improving community life while promoting sustainability and the use of appropriate technology. Upward Ventures and Practivistas collaborated with Las Malvinas to build the water cistern and a popular pharmacy, and will work jointly on integrating the factory into the community and conducting practical research for new products and ventures. 

6. Are you training the women to be soap entrepreneurs?

No. The women will be hired by Esperanza Soap and have a guaranteed income as employees of the company. We will train them to make the soap and be health promoters in the community.

Our model is different from other institutions that promote economic development. We are creating a scalable company that competes in the market. We are creating a product within the community and selling it to others, outside of Las Malvinas, and bringing revenue in. We’re not a microfinance institution that loans the women capital to start their own business. We aren't also simply training them to be soap entrepreneurs. Maybe in the future, once they've mastered soap making with Esperanza Soaps they’ll have skills and capital to become entrepreneurs. But right now, their best option is to participate in a scalable company with a growing consumer base.

7.  Who is Kevin Moforte?

Kevin Moforte is Chilean-American and has worked for a decade in development, especially with extremely poor communities. He started as a volunteer for TECHO, a Chilean nonprofit that builds temporary housing in slums across the continent. After graduating with a degree in Aviation Engineering, Kevin worked for TECHO as the Director for the Colombian branch and founded the organization’s branch in the Dominican Republic. During his period at TECHO Kevin lead a team that drew thousands of volunteers, built hundreds of houses and advocated for poor communities across Latin America. TECHO today is a highly recognized organization in Colombia and the Dominican Republic.

Kevin later worked in startups as an engineer (a solar energy company) and a manager (an electronic recycling company). He came to the US in 2011 to get his Master in Public Policy at UMass Amherst. Before starting Upward Ventures, Kevin was a professor of Innovation and Sustainable Development at two Chilean universities and co-founded Puentek, an organization that trains youth in Lean Startup methodologies in Santiago, Chile.  See his LinkedIn profile here

8.  “Esperanza Soap will be a for-profit social business”. What does that mean?

A social business is a business that maximizes its social impact while being financially sustainable and independent from a constant stream of donations. Because it operates like a for-profit, it generates revenue that covers its costs and allows it to grow.

A social business is different from a traditional for-profit business in that a social business’ goal is to maximize its social impact, not to maximize its profits at any cost.

The social impact Esperanza Soaps generates is empowering very poor families to rise from poverty by giving them employment opportunities. We are committed to employing people trapped in extreme poverty, persisting in giving them training and a steady income. Our impact is. specifically in Las Malvinas:  

a)  Provide stable employment and a steady income to women that currently are living on less than 2 dollars a day, and have sporadic sources of income. This will allow them to spend more on essentials (food – more and better, clothing, repairing their homes) and invest in their families (sending their kids to school well fed, providing the school supplies they need from uniforms to materials requested).

b)  Make soap available in the community and train women to be health promoters – so people of Las Malvinas, especially children, develop the habit of hand washing with soap 5 times a day. There is vast literature that sustains hand washing with soap as one of the most effective programs to improve the health of a community, especially one with no sewerage, like Las Malvinas. Please refer to our website for this: www.upward-ventures.org/resources.

9.  What is the relationship between Upward Ventures and Esperanza Soaps?

Upward Ventures is a nonprofit organization that starts social businesses in low income communities like Las Malvinas in the Dominican Republic, to bring jobs and empowerment to families living in poverty. It conducts the community discovery meetings, the market research and fundraising for its ventures. Once an idea gets proven and turns into a startup, it is released and turned into a for-profit company.

Upward Ventures’ headquarters are in Amherst MA, USA, and will soon open offices in Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic, where it will work with different communities, universities and churches.

Esperanza Soaps is the first enterprise of Upward Ventures. It is a for-profit company and will operate in the community of Las Malvinas in the Dominican Republic, making handmade, natural soaps.  

10.I understand you want to focus on women, but what about the men? Are they excluded from Esperanza Soaps? Will there be problems in the community because of the company’s policy of hiring only women?

These are legitimate concerns, and as a community-based company we are mindful of the relations amongst the people. Men also have a role to play in our company and will be incorporated into our workforce. We’ll most likely hire men to be in charge of security, transportation and other roles. Please keep in mind we personally know the women we are to hire, their children and their partners. The women know their communities best and we listen to them. The factory is their idea to make money in a way that will minimize potential tension or conflict.

THANK YOU FOR SUPPORTING US!

Questions? Please write to kevin@upward-ventures.org

Domingo, Dominican Republic. Our factory will produce handcrafted,
all-natural soaps with the island's showcase ingredients. Our soap
will be made by the women of Las Malvinas, who will have now a steady income. We'll sell our soaps to several customer segments
- such as tourists and businesses - on the island and abroad.MADE FOR HOPE. We placed our soap factory inside Las Malvinas, to bring
jobs and empowerment to women that want a brighter future for themselves and
their children. Esperanza Soaps hires and trains the women of Las Malvinas,
most of whom have not had the opportunity of a steady job, and struggle to make
ends meet.

smooth and healthy, a wide variety of exfoliating soaps and soaps for the
morning, the evening and special occasions. It’s good for you, and a perfect,
meaningful gift for those you love!

healthy, and it helps prevent sickness like diarrhea or infectious

story:
Hello friends, meet the Rovegno family!

We are on a mission to help increase our ability to not only help grow our business but to help contribute to more people who need help too. You see I have a vision of one day raising money for local, national and world relief for anyone who needs it. My idea is to use the growth of my business to help secure property where we can hold large events to raise the money for that purpose.

For us to realize this dream we need some help by some amazing people who can help us get to the point of selling our items Amazon which will give us the ability to increase our revenue along with giving us the ability to start putting money specifically towards our main mission.

In order for us to secure a spot on Amazon with our products we must have our products inspected by a laboratory which will provide a letter stating that all ingredients are safe for use on people. The cost of this we have found is $1000 for each item. We have a total of four products which will need this analysis. We know that by getting our products on Amazon our goal can be achieved within the next 2 years.

Give us a helping hand in achieving this by contributing or just help us spread the word through sharing this campaign on your Facebook, Twitter, Instagram pages or any other way you feel would be beneficial..



Thank You, and see you soon on the Zen Dairy Farm!! 

WB Eric, Dorene, Angelica and Derrick Rovegno

If you would like more information, please feel free to contact us personally at: zendairygoats@gmail.com or give us a call at (719) 251-0588

Join our News-feed and do a little shopping for your gifts at: Zen Dairy Goats

You can also follows us on: 

Facebook at: Zen Dairy Goats

By following us you can see our specials, products, baby kids (goats), and our progress as we move forward on this journey..


Please check out some of the amazing articles written about us here at Zen:

Hungry Chicken Homestead

Pueblo Chieftain

story:
Short Summary                                                         

With your help, Haiti will soon have a new attraction to talk about. Kiskeya Water Park, will be Haiti’s first ever family entertainment water park. Our country has experienced devastation from natural disasters and economic turmoil and the people of Haiti need opportunities to thrive, learn and grow. We also hope to encourage and promote tourism so that the world can experience how great Haiti is. We see Kiskeya Water Park as the answer.

Our project is a 1-acre outdoor water park featuring signature rides for kids and adults of all ages and a wonderfully designed area for local visitors and tourists. The park will provide visitors with a wholesome environment, amusement, entertainment, excitement, competition, souvenirs and great food and beverages all while forming lasting memories.

Currently a large gap exists in the entertainment offerings in Haiti, and Kiskeya Water Park has positioned itself to fill this void. We intend to build an experience that is unique, participative and fun. Quality entertainment is a main focus coupled with the type of adventure the current market demands. Our Team is working with Aquakita Group Development to assist in planning, engineering, and design of this one of a kind park.  

 What We Need & What You Get                                            

Kiskeya Waterpark Campaign hopes to raise $250,000 USD through Indiegogo to create a vibrant and sustainable water park, that will support our community and attract tourists to contribute to the Haitian economy. My wife and I have committed $10,000 in additional capital and our business partner Mrs. Eunisse, was very excited to invest $25,000 dollars to support the project. 

Interest from government or public development companies and individuals who may assist in the acquisition of land for the proposed site is welcome. Our ideal site would be in Ouest department, located 12.9 kilometers (8.0 mi) to the northeast of Haiti's capital city, Port-au-Prince.  Within a 15-mile radius there is a population of more than 700,000 people, not including our welcomed tourists. There is very good access to utilities, water, electricity and sewage services and travel by the country's road network is very reasonable. We want to begin construction as soon as possible. 

Supporters will receive many perks:

You'll be the first to receive entry passes to the park. Of course you'll also be the first to receive a painting of our great Warrior ancestor Caonabo.

The Economic and Community Impact

Kiskeya Water Park will succeed by offering its visitors a safe, secure and fun environment, and close personal attention. The goals of the water park are dual-sided: to help families spend quality time together, and to make a memorable, safe, educational, and fun experience that encourages them to return.

Our hope is to attract people interested in helping us provide this resource to local families and to also encourage tourism to rebuild our economy. It will be a fantastic place full of fun and adventures. We have developed a strong business plan. We have the energy and the motivation to build on our dream to see this water park become a reality. We have faith that our friends across the world will see our project as a positive contribution to rebuilding Haiti. 

Kiskeya Water Park will have the potential to earn several million dollars in gross sales in the first few years which will allow us to continue increasing our local staff and our swimming class offerings. We also plan to use a portion of the profits to help send more children to school every year and to contribute to the construction of a free community clinic

My name is Jean Hubert Romain and Kiskeya Water Park has been my dream project to make a reality for Haiti. I am 29 years-old and married to Moza Flaure Alcius who is also 29 years- old. We have a 14-month old baby boy, Jared-Noah. After the 2010 earthquake, I worked with the US Military C-troop squadron 73 Calvary for two months assisting them in food and water distribution for the displaced people of the biggest camp in Haiti. Since then, I have worked as the hospital coordinator of Jenkins Penn Haitian Relief Organization (J/PHRO), an NGO providing free care and medication for more than 8,000 people each month. 

I have a Bachelor degree in Business Administration & an Associate degree in Community Leadership from Madonna University of Michigan and a Bachelor Degree in Theology from BEREE School of Theology.  Since my childhood, I have always wanted to build an amazing place for people to come, somewhere they can find peace and happiness while forgetting all the torments of the Haitian life. Realizing this project will be the biggest satisfaction for me and my family.

My wife and I have participated in many fundraising projects before and are experienced in community outreach.

We hope you join us.

Help us spread the word!

Please share this campaign as widely as possible on Facebook, Twitter, and other social media! https://www.indiegogo.com/project/preview/8660f47e 

https://www.facebook.com/kiskeyawaterpark/?fref=ts
story_txt:
Short Summary                 
                     
                 
With your help, Haiti will soon have a new attraction to talk
about. Kiskeya Water Park, will be Haiti’s first ever family entertainment
water park. Our country has experienced devastation from natural disasters and
economic turmoil and the people of Haiti need opportunities to thrive, learn
and grow. We also hope to encourage and promote tourism so that the world can
experience how great Haiti is. We see Kiskeya Water Park as the answer.
Our project is a 1-acre outdoor water park featuring signature
rides for kids and adults of all ages and a wonderfully designed area for local
visitors and tourists. The park will provide visitors with a wholesome
environment, amusement, entertainment, excitement, competition, souvenirs and
great food and beverages all while forming lasting memories.
Currently a large gap exists in the entertainment offerings in
Haiti, and Kiskeya Water Park has positioned itself to fill this
void. We intend to build an experience that is unique, participative and
fun. Quality entertainment is a main focus coupled with the type of
adventure the current market demands. Our Team is working with Aquakita
Group Development to assist in planning, engineering, and design of this one of
a kind park.  
 What We
Need & What You Get                
                     
     
Kiskeya Waterpark Campaign hopes to raise $250,000 USD through
Indiegogo to create a vibrant and sustainable water park, that will support our
community and attract tourists to contribute to the Haitian economy. My wife
and I have committed $10,000 in additional capital and our business partner
Mrs. Eunisse, was very excited to invest $25,000 dollars to support the
project. 
Interest from government or public development companies and
individuals who may assist in the acquisition of land for the proposed
site is welcome. Our ideal site would be in Ouest department, located 12.9
kilometers (8.0 mi) to the northeast of Haiti's capital city, Port-au-Prince.
 Within a 15-mile radius there is a population of more than 700,000
people, not including our welcomed tourists. There is very good access to
utilities, water, electricity and sewage services and travel by the country's
road network is very reasonable. We want to begin construction as soon as possible. 
Supporters will receive many perks:
You'll be the first to receive entry passes to the park. Of
course you'll also be the first to receive a painting of our great Warrior
ancestor Caonabo.
The Economic and Community Impact
Kiskeya Water Park will succeed
by offering its visitors a safe, secure and fun environment, and close personal
attention. The goals of the water park are dual-sided: to help families spend
quality time together, and to make a memorable, safe, educational, and fun
experience that encourages them to return.
Our hope is to attract people interested in helping us provide
this resource to local families and to also encourage tourism to rebuild our
economy. It will be a fantastic place full of fun and adventures. We have
developed a strong business plan. We have the energy and the motivation to
build on our dream to see this water park become a reality. We have faith that
our friends across the world will see our project as a positive contribution to
rebuilding Haiti. 
Kiskeya Water Park will have the potential to earn several million
dollars in gross sales in the first few years which will allow us to continue
increasing our local staff and our swimming class offerings. We also plan to
use a portion of the profits to help send more children to school every year
and to contribute to the construction of a free community clinic
My name is Jean Hubert Romain and Kiskeya Water Park has been my
dream project to make a reality for Haiti. I am 29 years-old and married
to Moza Flaure Alcius who is also 29 years- old. We have a 14-month old baby boy, Jared-Noah. After the 2010 earthquake, I worked with the US
Military C-troop squadron 73 Calvary for two months assisting them in food and
water distribution for the displaced people of the biggest camp in Haiti. Since
then, I have worked as the hospital coordinator of Jenkins Penn Haitian Relief
Organization (J/PHRO), an NGO providing free care and medication for more than
8,000 people each month. 
I have a Bachelor degree in Business Administration & an
Associate degree in Community Leadership from Madonna University of Michigan
and a Bachelor Degree in Theology from BEREE School of Theology.  Since my
childhood, I have always wanted to build an amazing place for people to come,
somewhere they can find peace and happiness while forgetting all the torments
of the Haitian life. Realizing this project will be the biggest satisfaction
for me and my family.
My wife and I have
participated in many fundraising projects before and are experienced
in community outreach.
We hope you join us.
Help us spread the word!
Please share this campaign as widely as possible on Facebook,
Twitter, and other social media! https://www.indiegogo.com/project/preview/8660f47e 
https://www.facebook.com/kiskeyawaterpark/?fref=ts

story:
Summary

Francine Scott

http://womanfirstinstitute.org

My birth into 1960s Glasgow prepared me well for passionate living and a career that has embraced roles within fashion, business, conservation and military service. In a life devoted to the events I recount, I live in a country cottage, where I am currently at work on the next wave of content for The Woman First Institute and the second volume of the Woman First Chronicles.

With a weakness for exquisite dresses, silk lingerie and a classic high heel, my feminism does not rest merely on equality. How a woman reminds herself of the sheer joy of being a woman is a business men can only envy and serve. This phenomenon is erotically charged with nuanced possibilities that have led me to explore the absolute power of female sexuality and the understanding that female fulfillment is the key to human prosperity and happiness.

 

                                                  

                                      https://amazon.com/dp/B01GT2OH6U

                                     https://amazon.co.uk/dp/B01GT2OH6U

 

With something of a scarcity of discerning content in the provision for this market, my creative endeavors have sought to fill this gap. Coming First - Vol 1 of The Woman First Chronicles tells the story of how four women founded The Woman First Institute http://womanfirstinstitute.org  At its core is erotic seduction and humor, but its underlying, political and philosophical implications are as much a part of its message as any sexual gratification. In no small way, the Woman First Institute is playing its part in promoting the virtues of gynarchy and female led relationships.

 

                                

 

Founders of The Woman First Institute

http://womanfirstinstitute.org

 

Amanda Newman - Chancellor and High Priestess of Nympho-Serenity

 

Kate Glover - Dean of the Faculty of Female Fulfillment

Claire Paterson - Treasurer and Professor of Male Disciplinary Studies

Jane Cunningham - Head of Fashion, Womenswear and Feminine Frippery.

                                            

Gynarchy, Feminism, Female Supremacy, Male Subordination and  Feminization

The Woman First Institute is dedicated to the political tenet of a benevolent female autocracy over men, where the democratic principles of femocracy give rise to every woman's right to the feminarchy of her choice. Such utopian ideology requires support from all its prospective citizens. We urge all women and men, who wish to see this in their lifetime, to declare their interest now! Women, natural-born or trans, and men alike have a unique opportunity, here and now, to shape The Woman First Institute. As well as a mind-blowing abundance of perks from which to choose, by becoming a Contributor, you will be supporting women in their female led relationship(s), aiding their way to a satisfying, orderly, polyandrous/polyamorous life. Your contribution to male chastity, feminization, cuckoldry, obedience and subservience will never be surpassed.

 

                               

 

In 2017, all known penises must be declared. Male citizens will be duty bound to register for Penis Tax, subjecting their attached appendages to the meticulous scrutiny of the Penis Tax Inspectorate. In their service as Sissies, Servitors, Studs and Tran-Sisters, adherence to their assigned masturbation temperance regime will be rigorously enforced.

 

Campaign Aims                                      

In addition to the next volume of The Woman First Chronicles, the Institute plans to introduce a raft of new content to satisfy its growing following. Exclusively Woman will launch next summer. Its women-only content will entertain, inform and guide our female following on how to come first. Exclusively Woman extends a hand to every woman, helping her through her female led relationship(s) and aiding her way to a satisfying, orderly, polyandrous/polyamorous life.

 

                                           

 

Next summer also sees the launch of the Penis Tax, an affordable, monthly levy to which our growing male following can contribute. Overseen by the Penis Tax Inspectorate, all revenues raised will fund The Woman First Treasury. As privileged recipients of exclusive content, Penis Tax payers will be expected to comply with their assigned masturbation temperance regime as well as being richly informed of what they are missing.

                                      

                                               

 

Panty Slavery is also part of our planning. This is a rare opportunity to hand-wash and press our defiled panties to perfection. This privilege will be carried out by devotees who are willing to spend their time and resources in this most intimate of subservient tasks. Accordingly, subscribers will be given a full and detailed account of how the soiled panties in their charge came to be in the condition in which they find them.

The Woman First Institute http://womanfirstinstitute.org is keen to capitalize on the purchase options its viewership is making. Clothing is of particular interest. With multiple affiliate marketing opportunities made possible upon its launch, development of online shopping is underway for lingerie, dresses, hosiery and shoes nuanced to the particular interests of our growing audience.

 

   

 

Opening in April 2017, The House of Woman First online department store will serve our growing following with only the finest made-to-measure and ready-to-wear lingerie, dresses, hosiery and shoes in Real Girl Fit (for women) and Sissy Fit (for M/F trans-women). In addition to this, it is our privilege that the talented Jane Cunningham is contributing her exquisite, haute-couture services to our campaign. Jane has designed a collection of made-to-measure, pure silk lingerie and nightwear in both Real Girl Fit (for women) and Sissy Fit (for M/F trans-women). Due to launch independently in the autumn/winter of 2017, the collection will arrive in time for those winter nights in and early bedtimes.

 

                

              

With most of the design and development work behind us and a plethora of content, The Woman First Institute http://womanfirstinstitute.org is backer-ready and all set to move on from its embryonic beginnings to a thriving, expanding start-up.

 

What We Need & What You Get

The Woman First Institute http://womanfirstinstitute.org seeks funding of £28,000 to achieve its outlined goals. Broadly speaking, this breaks down as follows:

  • Marketing £8000
  • Launch of 'Exclusively Woman' £1500
  • Launch of the 'Penis Tax' £1500
  • Launch of 'Panty Slavery' £1000
  • Publication of the second volume of The Woman First Chronicles £1500
  • Development of online shopping £3500
  • Potential Perk fulfillment £9000
  • Indiegogo and transaction fees £2000                                  

It is envisaged that our marketing budget will be 50% spend on advertising and professional services and 50% in-house. Publication of the second volume of The Woman First Chronicles, the launch of Exclusively Woman, the Penis Tax and Panty Slavery, as well as the development of online shopping are down largely to the time of content providers and developers. With funding, this is time that can be devoted, full time, to The Woman First Institute http://womanfirstinstitute.org. The content provision that already exists is testament to what can be achieved with the additional demands of other commitments. What is possible, with funding in place, is knowledge that has been hard earned.

 

                                              

The value of The Woman First Institute is almost intangible but it is fair to say that it has every prospect of enjoying high growth. Besides a bounty of enticing perks, contributors have an opportunity to be part of a movement. All contributors will experience Amanda's Gratitude. A multitude of perks include the sexiest read of your life with Francine Scott's Coming First - Kindle Edition or Coming First - Print Edition.

 

              

It's time for insufficient husbands and boyfriends to be shown their place. Get him to sign on the dotted line. Make a Servitor of him or, better still, a Maidservant. As a contributor, you can receive an editable edition of the Cuckold Covenant to edit, print and present to your partner. The Cuckold Covenant is a postnuptial bond upon which uxorious husbands and boyfriends can take their solemn vows to serve, honor, obey and remain true to their partner whilst yielding to her divine right to seek romance and sexual gratification in another.

 

                                        

                                           Woman First Institute A0 Poster

To commemorate our campaign, as a contributor, our limited-edition, A0-print, campaign poster can be yours to adorn your wall. Get In Bed with Amanda now! See Perks - Woman First Institute Poster

 

   

      Exclusively Woman            Penis Tax Exemption              Panty Slave Trial

Lifelong access to Exclusively Woman can be yours for the lifetime of the Woman First Institute. Its women-only content will entertain, inform and guide you on how to come first. Exclusively Woman extends a hand to every woman, helping her through her female led relationship(s) and aiding her way to a satisfying, orderly, polyandrous/polyamorous life. See Perks - Exclusively Woman

With the launch of the Penis Tax, the Penis Tax Inspectorate will have their hands full. All revenues raised will fund The Woman First Treasury. As privileged recipients of exclusive content, Penis Tax payers will be expected to comply with their assigned masturbation temperance regime whilst being informed of what they are missing. Contributors have a unique opportunity to life-long access to Penis Tax Payer's content. See Perks - Penis Tax Exemption

We will entrust you to hand-wash and press a pair of our defiled panties to perfection. You will be given a full account of how your assigned panties came to be in the condition in which you find them, along with complete washing instructions. Do well and we will send you another pair. We wear expensive lingerie so your contribution includes a £50 panty retainer, returnable when the panties you have been assigned are, once again, caressing the nether regions of their rightful owner. See Perks - Panty Slave Trial

 

                 

The launch of PURE SILK by Jane Cunningham is set for autumn/winter 2017. Contributors, however, have a unique opportunity to experience the sheer joy it is to wear a Jane Cunningham, pure silk, made-to-measure, full-length nightdress and negligee, in time for spring/summer, long in advance of their launch. Whatever your size, body shape, height or gender, you can experience this exclusive, limited-edition, haute-couture, sensual luxury before anyone else. Become one of the few to feel what it's like to go to bed with a Jane Cunningham, pure silk nightdress, made to fit your body. Exclusive to contributors to The Woman First Institute. See Perks - Pure Silk Nightdress, Pure Silk Negligee, Pure Silk Nightdress+Negligee

With Pure Silk Membership, in addition to your very own made-to-measure, pure silk, full-length nightdress & negligee, not only will you receive a signed copy of all current and future volumes of The Woman First Chronicles, you also get to choose from any and every other, aforementioned perk.

 

    

With the April opening of The House of Woman First online department store, you will never get another chance to grab our ultimate perk. Now is the time to become an Associate Publisher or Department Store Partner. As well as all the privileges of Pure Silk Membership, publishers and partners are uniquely placed to attain the wardrobe of their dreams, with a Wardrobe for Life account. With full access to our Dept. Store and Book Sales accounts, our top-flight contributors can watch their wardrobe grow and grow for years to come. Let us credit your Wardrobe for Life account with 7½% of the profits from The House of Woman First Department Store (Department Store Partner) or sales of The Woman First Chronicles [25p(GBP) or 31c(USD) per book] (Associate Publisher). Spend it on anything from our department store's exquisite collections of lingerie, dresses, nightwear, hosiery and shoes. As we grow, your wardrobe grows, throughout a lifetime of trading. Moreover, you are free to market our books and department store, giving you the power to increase the size of your wardrobe at will. To start you off, we will send you a Jane Cunningham, pure silk nightdress and negligee, made to fit your body.

 

The Impact

Contributors can make a huge impact on the progress of The Woman First Institute http://womanfirstinstitute.org. Whilst our modest efforts in marketing have produced promising results, funded marketing will establish the brand and lead the way to implement the aforementioned plans for the next volume of The Woman First Chronicles, Exclusively Woman, the Penis Tax and Panty Slavery. With our developments in online shopping and the approaching launch of Jane Cunningham's lingerie & nightwear collections, there has never been a better time to become a contributor.

The Woman First Institute http://womanfirstinstitute.org is a unique online presence which, as well as entertaining, is helping bring about real societal change. It offers the world an alternative to patriarchal structures, representing gynarchy to women and men alike with humor. The underlying, erotic leanings served by our appeal present many opportunities to penetrate a broad range of markets.

 

                                               

 

Whilst contributors may well see the business case for The Woman First Institute, a degree of empathy with our cause would benefit all of us. The Institute is keen to form partnerships with like minded individuals who are as enthusiastic as we are to see women coming first. An entirely business approach to our campaign would be welcome from contributors but it is worth bearing in mind that, whilst the Institute will continue to make progress on the web, economic uncertainties will continue to exist. Potential rewards are high but the risks need to be spread.

 

Risks & Challenges

All of the aforementioned plans for The Woman First Institute http://womanfirstinstitute.org carry their own risks. The diversity of their potential income streams helps to reduce those risks. Taken collectively, these plans can, at least, provide a platform for further growth. No doubt, in the coming year, not all of these plans will bear the promise they carry but they will have given us a profile from which to build further.

Every provision has been made to ensure that, no matter what, fulfillment of our pledges is paramount. Whatever outcomes prevail, The Woman First Institute will deliver on all of its perks.   

Providing content and development is the least of our unknowns. Experience has taught us how to deliver this on time and within budgets. Less known are marketing outcomes, which is why so much of the budget is set aside for this. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you find yourself keen to help but unsure of the risks or unable to make a contribution, don't be discouraged. The Woman First Institute http://womanfirstinstitute.org needs all the ambassadors it can get so use your Indiegogo share tools, get networking and let others know of our campaign.

                                                  

Don't forget, you can always support us simply by purchasing Coming First by Francine Scott. Available in Kindle and print editions. Free, on Kindle Unlimited.

USA -  https://amazon.com/dp/B01GT2OH6U

UK - https://amazon.co.uk/dp/B01GT2OH6U

Germany - https://amazon.de/dp/B01GT2OH6U

France - https://amazon.fr/dp/B01GT2OH6U

Spain - https://amazon.es/dp/B01GT2OH6U

Italy - https://amazon.it/dp/B01GT2OH6U

Japan - https://amazon.co.jp/dp/B01GT2OH6U

Brazil - https://amazon.com.br/dp/B01GT2OH6U

Canada - https://amazon.ca/dp/B01GT2OH6U

India - https://amazon.in/dp/B01GT2OH6U

Australia - https://amazon.com.au/dp/B01GT2OH6U

 

If you would like a print edition of Coming First and wish all proceeds from your book purchase to benefit The Woman First Institute, buy it at -

https://createspace.com/6008195

To start you off, we will send you a Jane Cunningham, pure silk nightdress and negligee, made to fit your body.
 

The Impact
Contributors can make a huge impact on the progress of The Woman First Institute http://womanfirstinstitute.org. Whilst our modest efforts in marketing have produced promising results, funded marketing will establish the brand and lead the way to implement the aforementioned plans for the next volume of The Woman First Chronicles, Exclusively Woman, the Penis Tax and Panty Slavery. With our developments in online shopping and the approaching launch of Jane Cunningham's lingerie & nightwear collections, there has never been a better time to become a contributor.
The Woman First Institute http://womanfirstinstitute.org is a unique online presence which, as well as entertaining, is helping bring about real societal change. It offers the world an alternative to patriarchal structures, representing gynarchy to women and men alike with humor. The underlying, erotic leanings served by our appeal present many opportunities to penetrate a broad range of markets.
 
                                                
 
Whilst contributors may well see the business case for The Woman First Institute, a degree of empathy with our cause would benefit all of us. The Institute is keen to form partnerships with like minded individuals who are as enthusiastic as we are to see women coming first. An entirely business approach to our campaign would be welcome from contributors but it is worth bearing in mind that, whilst the Institute will continue to make progress on the web, economic uncertainties will continue to exist. Potential rewards are high but the risks need to be spread.
 

Risks & Challenges
All of the aforementioned plans for The Woman First Institute http://womanfirstinstitute.org carry their own risks. The diversity of their potential income streams helps to reduce those risks. Taken collectively, these plans can, at least, provide a platform for further growth. No doubt, in the coming year, not all of these plans will bear the promise they carry but they will have given us a profile from which to build further.
Every provision has been made to ensure that, no matter what, fulfillment of our pledges is paramount. Whatever outcomes prevail, The Woman First Institute will deliver on all of its perks.   
Providing content and development is the least of our unknowns. Experience has taught us how to deliver this on time and within budgets. Less known are marketing outcomes, which is why so much of the budget is set aside for this. 
 

Other Ways You Can Help
If you find yourself keen to help but unsure of the risks or unable to make a contribution, don't be discouraged. The Woman First Institute http://womanfirstinstitute.org needs all the ambassadors it can get so use your Indiegogo share tools, get networking and let others know of our campaign.
                                                   
Don't forget, you can always support us simply by purchasing Coming First by Francine Scott. Available in Kindle and print editions. Free, on Kindle Unlimited.
USA -  https://amazon.com/dp/B01GT2OH6U
UK - https://amazon.co.uk/dp/B01GT2OH6U
Germany - https://amazon.de/dp/B01GT2OH6U
France - https://amazon.fr/dp/B01GT2OH6U
Spain - https://amazon.es/dp/B01GT2OH6U
Italy - https://amazon.it/dp/B01GT2OH6U
Japan - https://amazon.co.jp/dp/B01GT2OH6U
Brazil - https://amazon.com.br/dp/B01GT2OH6U
Canada - https://amazon.ca/dp/B01GT2OH6U
India - https://amazon.in/dp/B01GT2OH6U
Australia - https://amazon.com.au/dp/B01GT2OH6U
 
If you would like a print edition of Coming First and wish all proceeds from your book purchase to benefit The Woman First Institute, buy it at -
https://createspace.com/6008195

story:
The Skinny

Have you ever experienced a 100-ton whale breaching out of the ocean, aside from watching a nature channel? Can you image watching it in real life? We want to give you the opportunity to feel the spray from a whale’s tail on your face.

The Mission

Help us to give you the opportunity of seeing these magnificent marvels of the natural world first-hand before it’s too late! A day can make a difference in your life – we pledge to offer a peaceful day that will take you away.

The Crew

We are here to offer you an experience that many people don’t have the opportunity to realize. We are combining our knowledge and will be purchasing a modest day sailboat - just in time for the whale watching season that is just around the corner. With our combined talents, we plan on taking our customers on mini-cruises that you will find forever memorable.

The Experience

Our love of being on and around boats and the ocean has led to our need to share our passion with others.

Nick has studied sailing and is a RYA Yacht Master, and Andrew is a certified PADI diver,  We are both passionate of the water and all that it offers. In turn, we want to share our experiences with you.

We are in the process of raising capital to purchase a 22’ Catalina sailboat so that we can offer you the experience of whale watching with us and all the magic the sea has to offer.

Nick is a RYA Yachtmaster, from Waterford, Ireland. After his first encounter sailing aboard the RV Heraclitus in Morocco in 2009, he has rarely strayed far from the sea. Continuing to master his craft on the Irish Sea, Atlantic, Mediterranean, South Pacific, and the Caribbean. He has found his home on the beautiful California coast. 

Andy, a native Brit., is a certified PADI diver and has completed his Aware Course and certification, which allows him to safely observe the whales as his guests enjoy the ambiance and tranquility of sailing quietly on the sea, while at the same time, respecting the whales’ habitat and space.

Together we will make history, and we would love for you to be a part of it!

This is the first step, in a much larger and wider reaching and altruistic plan that we have had for many years.   Angela's many years of experience in business management will allow us to reach that goal successfully. 

If you want to help but can't be here in San Diego to experience our tours first-hand, click on the BACK IT NOW button above and give what you can.  

The Campaign Team
Nick Hurt - Captain
Andrew James Hewitt - First Mate
Angela Durian - Event Mgr, Purser

story:
Fresh Eggs from Doretta Farms

Our names are Kari and Ian, and we run a small farm in the Shenandoah Valley. 

Both Ian and I grew up raising chickens and gardening, but we've decided that not only do we want the reward of fresh eggs and vegetables for ourselves- we want to share that reward with others! We love working outdoors and being able to raise and grow our own food and realized that we could turn this lifestyle into a career. As an added bonus, grass fed chickens produce vastly healthier eggs than any you can find at the store.

As our campaign indicates, we plan to focus our efforts on eggs production before eventually expanding our gardens to provide lots of delicious vegetables and herbs. Ian and I are full of ideas and energy- we've even talked about raising ducks and rabbits, and growing flowers too, maybe even honey bees- we just need your help to get there!

 

We plan to start with a flock of 100, and project our maximum flock size at no more than 300.

The funds for this campaign will be used to:

  • Purchase a variety of hatching eggs, pullets, and full grown chickens to build our flock

  • Get fencing to expand our chicken yard

  • An egg washer/sanitizer

  • Feeders and waterers

  • Egg cartons

The Impact

  • This project is important to us on a very personal level, but we embark on this journey not solely for our own fulfillment, but also so that we may contribute local, healthy food to our area.

  • This isn't our first venture into small business- Ian runs a successful award winning photo and video studio in northern Virginia (Toy Box Studios). Between his business savvy, and my farm grown ambition, and our collective determination, Doretta will be making her mark sooner than you know!

  • Help us get outdoors and get our hands dirty!

Risks & Challenges

  • Sure, every small business has challenges, and we won't be the exception. One challenge will be finding our markets- will that be primarily with restaurants? Small grocery stores? Would we work best as a CSA? Maybe we'll really shine at local markets.
  • Many of these questions will be answered as we move forward. We plan to be proactive in tackling this challenge by approaching restaurants directly and asking what they'd like us to grow- instead of the other way around (growing something and trying to find a buyer). Doretta will also have set business hours so people can stop by and buy eggs and produce from us even if they aren't able to make it to the weekend markets. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Just because you can't contribute, doesn't mean you can't help!:

  • Share our Facebook posts, Instagram photos, and videos- the best help a small business owner can get is making sure people know we exist!
  • Don't forget about the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Help us bring craft beer to the city of Statesville, NC!

I started out as a home-brewer with a few of my friends, brewing small batches on my kitchen stove. We had to move outside when my wife needed the kitchen back (and as we upgraded our gear). 

Now it's time to go "pro" and bring beer production back to Statesville. 

Fourth Creek Brewing Co isn't just about beer; we're about people.

 We're raising money to help renovate a historic building in the heart of downtown Statesville, NC. By helping us, you will help our local economy grow by bringing a fun atmosphere and great beer (as well as a few jobs) to our city which in turn will attract even more businesses, local artisans and events. We want to be the hangout hub for our community; a place where everyone is welcome and everyone wants to be. We also want to give back to our community by regularly donating a portion of our proceeds to local charities and schools.


What We Need & What You Get

Building a brewery takes a lot of money! We're raising capital too,  but we wanted to give our friends and neighbors the unique oppotunity to be involved in helping make this happen. Everyone loves to be a part of something exciting and everyone that helps us out will be commemorated on our "Wall of Fame" in addition to receiving some really cool brewery swag. See our perks below.

The money we raise will go toward our building renovation- necessary things like floor drains, lights, modernizing restrooms, a cool bar, and so on. If we exceed our goal, then we will donate a portion of those proceeds to our local food pantry and put the rest of that money toward making our brewhouse and capacity more efficient. 


Risks & Challenges

We hope to be open for business in Spring 2017. That being said, building a business is tough. Sometimes things take longer or cost more (or both) than you anticipate.  While our Founder Jonathan has many years of construction and project management experience, we can't always foresee every pitfall we may encounter and it may take us longer than we anticipate.

We do make this promise: -sink or swim- we will make sure every donor gets their brewery item (decal, glass, growler, shirt).


Other Ways You Can Help

Thanks for taking the time to check us out. You can also help us to spread the love by sharing our campaign on your social media site and telling your friends.

Thanks again for helping us out and remember:  "Drink Upstream!"


~Jonathan
